name: Connie Cummings
text:
Oh my! When you go visit your husband's hometown and stomping grounds, it's always fun to try new places...and Bootsie's is an absolute local gem...not to be missed!

We were quickly greeted on an unusually slow Friday night (football night) and were in for an absolute treat! From the kind servers, to the cook...they were literally one big happy family! You could tell they love to cook and you can feel it in their home cooking!

Everything our table of 9 ordered was outstanding...freshly prepared and full of flavor!

The two appetizers were incredible...Fried banana peppers and fried bacon wrapped pickles! They sound weird but were fantastic! Fried, crispy and absolute perfection.

Absolute standouts included the pork ribs (come early before they sell out), white mac n cheese, chicken quesadilla, Bootsie's dog (sausage dog with BBQ), and even the kids meal were homemade chicken nuggets.

Took a banana pudding and key lime pie to go. Amazing!!!!

Just come here...no matter how far the drive (we came from Oregon) to get here!

resp.text: We are so happy you guys came in!! We hope to see you all again! ❤️

name: Tera L. Kirksey
text: I had a Loaded Baked Potato with chicken. I had the Banana pudding for dessert. Real friendly staff! The food and service was excellent!

resp.text: Thank you so much for coming in and we are glad you enjoyed!! Hope to see you again! ❤️

name: Alock19
text: Bootsie dog , WOW!!! One of the best things I have ever eaten. Highly recommend ! I got the mild and it was perfect, little heat but not too much. Will be my next order.

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed!! Hope to see you soon!! ❤️

name: Mitch and Carolyn J
text: Where to start? Everything is amazingly good! The ribs and butts best BBQ this side of the Mississippi. The wings are killer and to catch the .75 wing night is double great! The Bootsie Dog, the Loaded fries or nachos and so much more! You can't go wrong. But be sure to save room for the fresh Key lime pie or Lemon Meringue.

name: Mariah Chapman
text:
Like many others, I have to laud the stunningly delicious ribs at Bootsie’s.  From the rub that makes them tasty, to their tender, fall-off-the-bone meat, these are the best ribs in Alabama. Maybe the south. Maybe the world.

Don’t miss the fried banana peppers and banana pudding or lemon meringue pie. Get both for dessert. They complement each other well and your prediabetes will be worth it, they are delicious.

resp.text: Thank you SO much! ❤️

name: Jaylon Williams
text: Food was delicious i most definitely give it a 10/10 it was excellent i love it and i will be returning

resp.text: We are so glad!! See you soon ! ❤️

name: Brad Richardson
text: Great food, especially the ribs, potato salad, and baked beans. The people are alright too lol

name: Alana Rich
text: THE BEST. Best Mac and Cheese, Best Homemade sauce and BEST RIBS EVER. What a GREAT PLACE 👍🏼

resp.text: Thank you so much!!! We are so glad you enjoyed! ❤️❤️

name: Brittany Gray
text: This Was The Best Place At Eat! Awesome people great food!!

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed !! Thank you for coming!!! ❤️

name: Paige Mintz
text: The food was fresh and delicious and huge portions. We ordered to go but inside was very clean and practicing Covid safety measures.

resp.text: Thank you so much !! ❤️

text: Great place and Good people

name: thomas dunnavant
text: I eat here often, they consistently have the best BBQ chicken available anywhere and i have traveled every state in the country.   Good Poor, Carolina Style plus... good people work there.

name: ASHLEY SMITH
text: I love love love Lawlers Ham. It is the best on the Stuffie potato but i will take it anyway I can get it. Its so bad, I am almost certain that the staff there knows me by name, and if not, they know my face, And exactly what I want to order!!! Friendly and courteous staff and always smiling when you arrive. Great value for the exceptional food!!! I have not eaten anything from here (either location) that is not 100% delicious!

name: Thomas Sisson
text: I had the sample plate food was great. Service was friendly.

name: James Burton
text: Great place, great food. Time to go back soon!!

name: David Steinhauser
text: We ordered a slab of ribs and a pint of potato salad.  Both were wonderful.  The ribs and both the hot and mild sauces are really good and the potato salad had potatoes that weren’t too soft and had a great flavor as well.  It was far more than two of us could eat in one meal.  The owner gave me a taste of the hot slaw.  I will be getting that next time I am there.  We will be going back.

name: Jarl Balgruuf
text: This place is the definition of a good country BBQ joint. The food is excellent and the owner is a very friendly guy. I'd eat here all the time if I lived nearby. The hot slaw is great as is the BBQ. It looks a bit shabby but I actually kind of like that aesthetic, it fits the personality of the place well. Definitely recommend.

name: Nuke Life
text: Crite's is in the middle of no where. When you pull up to it your first reaction is I am not going to eat here....when you step in it doesn't get much better. The place on the inside doesn't look any better than the outside, some people may say its worse its definitely a culture shock.  But the 97 health score rating makes you walk to the counter. You will be so glad you did!!!!! The ribs are to die for. It is the first place that I have ever been to that if you pull on the bone it comes out clean not bothering the meat. They are so tender and juicy its insane. They have real BBQ sauce which is better than the vinegar based everywhere else!!! Try it and you will be coming back again and again! I suggest the rib plate!

name: mikeandtina
text: Great bbq and ribs.  I love the pulled pork, my wife and nieces love the shredded chicken and turkey sandwiches.  Their hot mustard slaw rocks.

name: GA Duncan (Grant Duncan)
text: Awesome food. Ribs are good,    Bar-B-Q is good,and chicken is  good. The food is cooked to order.

name: Thatonehorridchristian
text: It's the best restaurant. The pork sandwich is the best. You need to go there!!!! 🍴🐷🐖

name: Jerry Cox
text: Modest little Barbecue restaurant, it's a regular lunch stop that we look forward to on Fridays.

name: Miranda Shoulders
text: Best rib's and pulled pork and the sides are good too.

name: Sarah Myers
text: Quick, cheap and delicious

name: nikki billips
text: Best ribs and hot slaw around.

name: Jerry Dobrich
text: Excellent!

name: Chris McGhee
text: Rude ppl

name: nikki kessinger
text: Love it

name: Stephanie Crumbley
text: If there were a way to give no star, I would. This place was great when Freddy owned it. Whoever the girl is that owns it now, purposely tried to overcharge us $10.00 for our meal. I gave her 3 chances to make it right, even asking for an itemized receipt for tax purposes, in which she wrote down the items with no prices and just a total. I finally got my 10 dollars but she lost a customer. And we had tipped her 23% !!! I hate it to because the food was pretty good (Freddy was cooking) and we live super close. But a couple things I can not deal with are liars and thieves.  Keep your eyes on your pocketbook if you go in this place. She told us she was the owner. Good luck lady.

name: Mary Turnbow
text: Good food. Great service . Cash or checks only. Tea was fresh. Boiled whole shrimp was fresh. Also had the BBQ and country style ribs. Bbq was good but the ribs were WOW! No sauce needed.  Worth a trip thru the woods.

name: Jennifer Griffith
text: Awesome food....always great experience!!!!! Not bad wait time for food. One of my favorites!!!

name: Donald Watson
text: Service sucks food sucks..... potato salad comes from walmart.... they always run out of food

name: Connie Lawson
text: Love this place.  If your looking for a great steak look no further.

name: Adrian Lawless
text: Best BBQ around. Wonderful atmosphere. Feels like your at home.

name: Wiley Kimbrell
text: Great foog, great service and great atmosphere

name: Ami C
text: Great Food and an Awesome Owner

name: Kenneth Files
text: Great atmosphere and food

name: Jamie Whitaker
text: All around everything is good!

name: Anthony Morrison
text: Awesome food!!

name: Angela Serigny
text: We love the BBQ ribs; they're amazing and so tender they fall off the bone.  Hands down the best BBQ ever, I wish they had more sides to choose from but other than that everything is great. This place is highly recommend!

name: Seth Falan
text: Some of he best BBQ in town. Amazing service, and run by equally amazing people. I always look forward to visiting when they're open.

name: Wayne Chai
text: Savory, Exquisite and finger licking good BBQ Ribs! I had mine paired with potato salad and baked beans. The sides were just ok, not great no bad. Maybe it is just me, the potato salad tasted like store bought and the baked beans were from the can. My order also came with white bread and a slice of corn bread. The bread tasted stale and the cornbread was mushed. Albeit all these, I'd still rate this a 3.5 stars just for its barbeque.

name: Jack Henza
text: Incredible BBQ. Got the chicken because they were out of pork, was not disappointed. Perfectly cooked, amazing sauce, great beans and potato salad.

name: Robert Serigny
text: Words can't describe you have to get a taste of them ribs they are amazing.

name: Jeff Mack (PayCoin)
text: Very very good BBQ, I always get their ribs, Gives large portions of food and the sauce on ribs is excellent.. Highly recommend!!

name: Mark Young
text: Smokey. Is a good cook and a good guy. Their serving breakfast now. 🍖

name: Greg Orourke
text: Good BBQ

name: Michael Abston
text: Off the chain....

name: phuong tran
text: We like a lot going out. Last night we  visited this fine place which friends told us about. We passed a lovely experience there with excellent cooking and a courteous crew and a great chief cook. We  added this restaurant in our phone list  and we shall definitely go again very soon. We highly recommend.

name: Ronald Pham
text: Best place to buy food when in a hurry. The customer service is efficient, prices are affordable, awesome atmosphere. Highly recommended

name: Blake Wiggins
text: Good food, nice people

name: Clayton Rector
text: Ok-ish food, run down building, a man was smoking inside the seating area while children sat at another table. I likely will not return.

name: Ronnie Blankenship
text: Nice chef and server I had a great experience there

name: Tiffany Tibbs
text: Good food and friendly staff! Make sure that you bring cash. No debit cards.

name: Ashley Jospeh
text: Awww Man! SO disappointed! I grew up eating Jiffs my entire childhood. Use to walk there and pick up dinner my mom would order.Took my husband in there today to show him what a real burger tastes like bc he isn't from this area. After watcing 2 roaches walk across the floor we decided to cancel our orders. The lady walks over and squishes the roach with her shoe right in front of us. Appetites ruined. :(

name: mabel brito
text:
Homade country cooking..
Breakfast n lunch..love it

name: Adam Abts
text: Good food. Good service. 👍

name: Daniel Bridges
text: Great biscuits.

name: Robert Owens
text: Everyone seems to know everyone is real nice

name: Mike Ramsey
text: Great food and the best home made gravy and biscuits

name: English Farms
text: Home cooking. Local food.

name: William Minyard
text: Had breakfast and the food was bland

name: Michael Neal
text: Food was delish!

name: Rena Jones
text: The cook is awesome

name: Carin Lake
text: Best burgers in St.Clair county

name: Lonnie Molt
text: Cheeseburgers are great!

name: Steve Buchanan
text: Good food

name: Patti Barber
text: AWESOME SAUSAGE & BISCUITS

name: Michael Jenkins
text: Great place!

name: Ritadita Argo
text: Decent

name: Eddie Pike
text: Very 👍]

name: Crystal Little Clopton
text: Great place to eat... Really hate to see them leave Leighton... I know my son's will hate it too, especially my oldest... Surely He will eat good when he gets to Huntsville to the Arsenal....

name: meagan lewis
text: Best food in this area. Ribs fall off the bone. Everything's seasoned perfectly! The lemon pepper wings are to die for! Wished they were open on Sundays!

name: Jeff WALKER
text: Good catfish and the baked beans are good enough to stab somebody over.

name: Tony Bobo
text: Very good barbeque sandwich. Great atmosphere,

name: Randy Waldrep
text: Best ribs this side of Memphis!!! Food and service was awesome.

name: Rhonda Waldrep
text: Awesome food and service...the best ribs around

name: Kensley Lewis
text: Pretty good, I've had better.

name: Dorinda Davis
text: Their loaded potato is very good. Remember this is a BBQ restaurant.

name: Brittney Jones
text: Unexplainable!!!! U have to Try it!!!

name: Patrick Williams
text: The ribs. Oh. My. Goodness. The RIBS!! Dry rub ribs with a side of Alabama White BBQ sauce will treat you RIGHT!! The place is bare bones, but the ribs are outta this world!!

name: Kathryn Ford
text: We really enjoyed everything we had here! Most of my party of six got the ribs which were cooked beautifully with about 6 choices of sauce on the table! I got the chef salad with Texas toast and it was delicious as well.  The sign is very faded, so we were worried at first and problem wouldn't have even stopped if our family hadn't pulled in the empty parking lot first.  We are so glad we did though, it was definitely delicious just may need to improve the curb appeal to attract more customers.

name: Steven jackson
text:
We stoped by River City BBQ one night and it was a particularly busy night! They wait staff were run off their feet but greeted us and told us it might be a while, which was fine!
We got drinks straight away and waited about15 minutes and we ordered, no problems there!

We made the mistake of ordering way too much! It was all really good. The mac and cheese and BBQ beans were to die for! The fried pickles and okra was also amazing!

The brisket was a little dry but still yummy with some of their great sausages. The prices were cheap and the staff friendly.

name: Malcolm McGregor
text: The BBQ was very good, as we're the sides.   A local haunt, the ambience is small town Alabama which I enjoyed.   I would recommend the River City BBQ if you are passing through Eufaula.

name: adam sperry
text: Came by about an hour before closing on a Wednesday night. They had really good brisket and the sides made me feel like I was at a family reunions. Good Eats keep up the good work

name: Pary Sumlar
text:
The best place I know of to get a pulled pork sandwich.   Their sweet citrus chipotle BBQ sauce is my all time favorite anywhere ever.

The bathroom is incredibly small though.

name: Howard Kaplan
text: 5 stars for food. Not so much on appearance. Very good pork and BBQ sauce selection.

name: Cassie Young
text: Love their BBQ! I would definitely recommend it. Their sauces are awesome

name: D.l. Overstreet
text: Not fancy but really good food... A good clean up and outside advert would put it where it should be.

name: Jerri Ludlam
text: Great food.  Very accommodating. I'm a regular!!

name: Linda G
text: Loved their Chicken with Alabama White Sauce ..Hubby Loved their ribs💕

name: Corn Holea
text: I liked the  Brunswick stew, my fries bathe in the goodness. You need  to try it for yourself that BBQ is awesome!

name: Taylor Allen
text: Consistently great food! Try the jalapeño & cheddar hush puppies and sweet potato fries. I stop every time on my way to Florida

name: Jenny Warren
text: Good moist BBQ!! I will be back on my way through again.

name: Jennifer Kelley
text: Great food friendly workers and great atmosphere not to mention really really good prices

name: Charles Satterfield
text: Was served old order of ribs that had been reheated.  Were tough and not fit to eat.  Asked the waitress twice and received a half way excuse.  She ask the manager and she admitted the other members of our party received fresh ribs and that my order was older.  No discount or sincere apology.  Have visited 2-3 times a year when in Eufala.  Will never eat there again.

name: Brandy Royal
text: It was awesome. Quick service and the food was amazing!!!!!

name: Jared Cook
text: Meh. Bout all you can say. Tad overpriced, dull atmosphere,  service was meh. Food meh

name: Julie Twining
text: Love the ribs, but they are not always consistent with tenderness

name: Billy Watkins
text: Employees are nice foods good but a little on the pricey side

name: Kellie Muldoon
text: Pretty good food and variety.  Out of certain food items a good bit

name: Yvonne Adams
text: Great food, friendly staff. Sweet Potato fries and Brunswick stew are my favorites!

name: andrea reid
text: Passing through on our way home to Florida. Food was ok, bbq sauces were really good, place is a little run down but thats ok, service was ok-not very friendly.

name: Angela Gilliand
text: The food was disgusting and the wait staff was incompetent!  Our order was wrong and missing half of what we ordered.  The BBQ meat had been boiled not smoked and it had been re-heated.

resp.text: This review seems to be posted on the wrong page. Our meat is definitely not boiled or reheated.

name: Bobbie Brewton
text: Great food but way overpriced.

name: Emily Carnley
text: Food was pretty bad, water tasted like it was from a pool and when me and my group got back to our car it was covered in Flys, plus the grill they Cook this so called "best barbecue" is only about 5 feet from the dumpster. I would NOT recommend this to anyone!!!!

resp.text: We are certainly sorry that you did not enjoy your experience and wish for the opportunity to remedy your concerns. We would like to point out that next to our dumpster is a grease disposal/recycling container. Our pit is farther back near the other side of the building.

name: Gage Sellers
text: One of the best BBQ places I've been to in my life!

name: Miranda McKinley
text: We stop on our way to the beach every year. Best brisket bbq and their sides are awesome too!

name: Derek South
text: Food was good, staff were friendly.

name: Lisa Taylor
text: The food and the service were awesome!!!

name: gabrielle Thornton
text: Cozy BBQ joint loaded with flavor!

name: Terrius Rodgers
text: Pretty good food and definitely good food!

name: Cliff Langley
text: Good bbq, needs bigger portions

name: Tomas Portilla
text: Great place SUPER DELICIOUS FOOD!!!

name: Karen Welsh
text: It's not that good and very pricey for what you get

name: Faye Pittman
text: Barbecue potatoes are AWESOME!

name: Mattie Quarles
text: It was kinda packed but the BBQ was worth it

name: Mime Segura
text: Delicious, clean and friendly!

name: Lee Brunson
text: The food is amazing

text: They had a decent price on the meals, $5 for a pulled pork sandwich,  side, and drink.  However, we had to order pizza as they were out of buns at about 1 PM. text: Went here because of the 4 star rating. The reviews here are very misleading. I had the BBQ pork sandwich and Brunswick stew. The food quality was absolutely terrible. It tastes like the meat was frozen or boiled, there is no way this was smoked meat. No flavor. The sauce was not very good at all. The stew reminded me of something that was served in a public school cafeteria. I understand they have decent burgers, maybe they should focus on that and stop serving this sorry attempt at "BBQ". I can honestly say this was the worst BBQ I have had at a BBQ restaurant.

text: They used to be an great place to eat.  The last five times I have been the food has not been up to par.   The meat is dry.  The portions are small in comparison to other restaurants.  And they do not mind serving you a dried stuffed potato.  Will not be going again.

name: tomasz zajac
text: Little Paul's delivers frequently to my place of work.  Often times they forget side items, and extra condiments, which are ordered and payed for.  This week our order lacked two plates of food which were payed for.  When we called to report this, we were accused of hiding food, and the staff argued with us about the impossibility of an error occurring on their end.  They did eventually bring the food, but not before a member of their staff searched our work area for "hidden" food.  They left us with the impression that they thought we were thieves.  When we called to speak with the part owner she did not apologize, and led us to believe that our business was not valued.  We have ordered from Little Paul's for years, but over time the food has become unpredictable, and the service unprofessional.  All six of my co-workers agree that they have never been treated so despicably.  Our supervisor asked the delivery boy to leave our work area because his behavior was so offensive!   I will continue to post this message wherever a review can be posted, for the sake of justice!

name: Wesley Thompson
text:
Man, I love Larry's. I almost always get the exact same thing every time I go: a pork barbecue platter. It comes with 2 sides, but since they got rid of their rice (which was SOOOOO yummy!), I typically only get fries and substitute extra garlic bread. This time was no exception.

I always get the sweet tea, because, duh, Alabama and use the house made "hot" barbecue sauce on my sliced pork. I put the quotes around hot because, while it is a bit spicy and quite flavorful, I've never found the hot sauce here (or at any Larry's restaurant) particularly hot.

Also, I've had the barbecue chopped one time a long time ago but always get it sliced these days. I just like being able to stab it with my fork and get how ever much I want. Plus, it doesn't fall off as often.

Anyway, give Larry's a try if you ever ride past one. I've eaten at the ones in Enterprise, Daleville, Dothan, and of course, here in Andalusia. The only time they have ever let me down was the day I was told, "Oh, we don't serve rice anymore." 😢

name: Patricia Campbell
text:
From entering to departing, the service was horrific. Dropping dishes on the floor, then trying to place for use anyway. Taking way to long from ordering to being served. No refills was offered on our tea. No receipt, No knowledge of store permit #.
This was a first at any Larry's bbq. And I have enjoyed my trips there, until 8/3/2021. In Dothan, Alabama.
There was NO excuse for this kind of service.
However, I will continue to visit Larry's bbq in Enterprise, Alabama.

My grand daughter had a kids meal corn dog and Mac and cheese. When she finished she wanted another corn dog. Waitress said ok and  brought it to her. When We paid our bill, the cashier charged us 4.99 for the kids meal and 4.99 for just a corn dog. Would not let me talk to a manager. She was rude and just kept glaring at us. Feel free Larry’s to contact me.

name: Brad Seehawer
text:
I like how Bradshaw's is located nowhere near I-85. Bradshaw's is the quintessential barbecue hut - middle of nowhere, cheap, only open for lunch four days a week, and only offering the absolute basics for a barbecue restaurant. Pork, chicken, or ribs. Beans, slaw, fries, potato salad. Also, their pork is the second best I've found in Montgomery - a strong amount of park and smoke ring, though less fatty than Fat Boy's, which loses them a smidgen of points in the moment, though my digestion system appreciated it in the long term.

The finely chopped slaw was equal parts mayo and vinegar and wasn't uncommon to these parts*, and while I regret not getting the potato salad - which garnered praise from several of my fellow diners - the standard fries I did end up with were fried very well and seasoned liberally, so I wasn't too let down.

(*Edit: I've been informed that the slaw has neither vinegar nor mayo, so shows what I know.)

It's a simple restaurant. Bradshaw's knows what they do well, and they trust Montgomery to come and figure it out for themselves.

name: Stephen's Account
text: One of the best restaurants in Montgomery!  Whenever I invite my friends out, they're always like "I don't have a taste for BBQ," but what they don't realize is Varsity doesn't just have good BBQ, they have other good foods like fried chicken, hamburgers, and other good sandwiches.  However, what keeps me coming back are the sides!  I could eat their collards and macaroni and cheese everyday, if calories weren't a factor.  Their sweet tea is awesome, too!

name: Brad Seehawer
text: The highway-adjacent location and sports bar-ish theme of Varsity doesn't inspire confidence to put out good 'que in a city dominated by mediocre barbecue restaurants, but to their credit, both the chopped pork and chopped brisket were tender, flavorful, and kept moist from a good amount of fat distributed throughout the meat. Greens were plenty good, mac and cheese was average, but it was still more than enough to make me a little confused as to why the place was so empty on a Sunday night.

name: Kenneth. Rason.
text: Fantastic, Great Place, GREAT FOOD. Sadly, I forgot to buy T shirts for my mates...Roll on Varsity...

name: Don Lee
text: My wife & I have been eating at Sweet Alice's BBQ for sometime now. She has some of the best BBQ anywhere around. As far as I can tell all of her items are home style made from scratch. The pie's & cakes are great. Her homemade hot & sweet pickles are just like those my Grandmother used to make. The patio eating area is nice with various styles of tables which add to the homey surroundings. From the outside it just looks like one of those places that you just know is a good place to eat. If you have a little time & go at lunch, you will see a number of folks come there to eat or pickup takeout. I don't know of many people who live in the Clanton area that haven't eaten there.

text: Very rude! The AA lady at the counter is apparently mute: does not say "Hi! How are you?" or anything, but just give a look that said "what do you want", "sure and get out." The moment I walked away and look back, she greeted another AA customer with smile and hospitality. I have been eating here for awhile, and the food is adequate. But, the rude attitude of the employee here makes the food tastes worst. One time they forgot to make my order, despite already charged my credit card, causing me to waste a lot of my busied time. If you believe that the attitude of the employee affects the quality of the service, I DO NOT recommend this establishment. Go to North Pavilion Food Court next to Women and Infant Center, the AA people there are much nicer, thus the food served there tastes extra delicious.

name: Jack Gogan
text: ordered chips and queso, was watered down sent it back and was told it’d only be five minutes. Waited thirty minutes and decided to just get a refund on the queso when I was then greeted with two bowls of queso and chips to compensate for my thirty minute wait. Sat down, opened it, and found out that both bowls of queso were just as watery as the other one with lumps of cheese in it. Might as well just fill a bowl up with water and throw cheese blocks in it and serve it.

resp.text: Hi Jack, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

text: This is pretty good but kind of salty.  It's also pretty expensive and I think it's more expensive than going to a  regular FMBBQ.  It feels like they are gouging the students because they can.  I don't get a lot of money to eat on every day and once my dining dollars are used up I don't eat at the student center.

resp.text: Hi, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing director at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience.

name: ashley freeman
text: My friends and I come here all the time and always get the "love me tender chicken sandwich". We ordered the same thing today and received a pork sandwich instead. We went up to workers and politely told them our problem. The workers told us that we were wrong in a hasty and unconcerned manner and shoved our food back to us over the counter. They refused to listen to us and fix our problem.

name: Tyjae Steele
text: Years ago my family and I went to Full Moon Bar-B-Que as a part of a family lunch. Although they were short staffed, the cashier was friendly and attentive to our orders. After being accommodated for  around 50 guests, they served each of us delicious food! The place is not huge but a good size to fit my family in. They serve full course meals for a fair price! I ate a barbeque chicken meal with macaroni and cheese,  collard greens, big cornbread and southern sweet iced tea!!! Everything was delicous!!!! This family owned business also delivers! A barbeque diner that delivers is a plus along with its convenient location around amenities!!!! I'd recommend anyone in the Birmingham area to stop by here for great food and service!!!!

resp.text: Hi Tyjae, we appreciate the love and hope to have you and your family back soon!

name: Wes Sullivan
text: if you want catfish or cheese biscuits go to jim n nicks, if you want the popular name go to dreamland, if you want the best smoked wings you've ever had go to saw's soul food, but if you want great bbq overall and the best ribs in bham go to full moon! their ribs really are 2nd to none...then there is their chow chow....it serves like pickles do in most bbq restraints and it goes great on a bbq sandwiches...or any bbq for that matter.

resp.text: Hi Wes, thank you for your support! Come back and see us soon!

name: Matthew Siple
text: Legitimately the worst service i've had so far at UAB. I ordered 3 tenders, banana pudding, and a drink. Then, the cashier didn't even give me my banana pudding so i went to my table. When i was buzzed, I came and got my box and had to look for help to actually get my pudding. So, i go and sit down again and open up my box to find 2 tiny tenders and so i go back and I'm like, "hey i ordered 3 tenders and i only got 2." This lady then looks at me like i had just personally offended her so i'm like "I'm not tryna be a dick I'm just hungry". So then she reluctantly gave me my third tender, but like, the hill student center is primarily for UAB students. College students! students that are typically starving because all we can eat is campus dining. I had not eaten all day, like, of course I wanted to get what I paid for. The money my parents had to work hard for to buy me a meal plan.

resp.text: Hi Matthew, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing director at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Chloe Langley
text: Food is very salty, so if you have high blood pressure I don't recommend. Also some employees seem like they hate being there. I mean I would too, but there's something called faking it.

name: Jonathan Lackey
text:
You can get a good meal from full moon at a specific time of the day. The lunch rush. Go then, get a decent BBQ meal.

Anytime else? Run far, run fast.

The last two Friday nights I've eaten here have been awful. On one, the queso was cold. Queso is good, cold queso tastes like liquid sadness. The meat on my BBQ nachos was cold as well, as though they had taken it out of a fridge (probably had) and only made half an attempt to warm them.

But tonight topped the list. I ordered a pork sandwich which is standard BBQ fare. First bite, pig skin. I'm not talking about football, I'm talking actual pig skin, or something that looks very similar. The rest of the meat was dry, and the beans were burned. Chucked it into the trash, where it belonged. There goes 8 dollars I'll never get back.

Their fries are consistently awful too. Driest fries I've ever had.

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing director at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Tim Fisher
text: A little expensive, but the quality and quantity are well worth it. I highly recommend the open-face pork sandwich.

resp.text: Hi Tim, thank you for your feedback! We're glad you enjoyed your experience!

name: VeeVee
text: Great food and service.

resp.text: Hi Davida, thank you for supporting Full Moon BBQ! Come see us again soon!

name: Dan K
text: They messed up my order last 4 times. Always overcharging.

resp.text: Hi Dan, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing director at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience.

name: j-ruy diaz
text: Very rude employees, I do not recommend going here.

name: Gary Johnson
text: Oldest BBQ place in Alabama. I think the best. Started in the late 1800's and its on the list of 100 places to eat at in Alabama.

name: Bart Parry
text: A disgrace to bbq.

name: Weston Oliver
text: Restaurant was disgusting. Bathrooms had not been cleaned in weeks and smelled like an outhouse, food was sub par at best. Staff apparently never cleans anything as everything there was gross and sticky. Do not go. I am reporting to health department.

resp.text: Weston, thank you for the feedback, and I regret that this was your experience. This is not our Dickey's standard. Please reach out to me at socialmedia@dickeys.com so that we may learn more of your visit and can address these issues. Thank you, Ann, Social Team.

name: Eric
text: Great pork sandwich.... Onion might have been a little to over powering though?  :)

name: Christopher Merchant
text: Great food, home style surrounding, wonderful service. Also live radio broadcast makes for great entertainment.

name: Rickey Giddeon
text: I can't believe the bad comments I read. This place food is great. Some say it's pricey. They have good deals each day and anywhere in town BBQ is expensive. It's very reasonable here and the customer service is great.

name: Jeremy English
text: A little pricey, but the food is a solid 9 out of 10. Perfect pulled pork, excellent sauces, jalapeno beans are kinda thick & really tasty. Good comfort food!

name: Sharon Sparks
text: I visited in your place of business on 02/16/2019 @ 6pm and ordered a small bbq sandwich, the individual that waited on me was very rude, didn't greet with any friendliness, just complained they had been busy all day. As he began preparing my sandwich, I noticed the bun was really small, I questioned that and it was told they were store bought and that the normal buns were frozen, so I said why charge the same amount for a smaller sandwich, and he stated to me after I ask for my money back, that he would give me two, okay then he stopped making my sandwich and didn't even explain that he would be back in a minute and when I looked around the corner he was standing there on his cell phone, and used only one glove to continue, I said shouldn't you have on two gloves, he stated I didn't feel like putting the other on. So I ask him did they not put onions on the sandwiches anymore,  and he stated yes, so he grabbed a knife that had been hanging on the wall, so I thought he was going to clean it, it was already dirty, I said are you going to clean that, he stated to me, very nasty, its what I have used all day, I said, I don't care, don't use it on my food, he then he got mad and stated to the other employee who was standing there, finish this order and then I really wanted my money back, He stated he didn't want to fool with the register, so I ask for corporate number, and he stated I am corporate, I stated okay, but I am going to take this further than you, I took those sandwiches and fed them to my dog. Its awful nasty in the 69S Tuscaloosa, Al Dickeys, the cashier was nice, and very apologetic, and I thanked him and he was a younger male,

resp.text: mattie, thank you for the feedback, and I regret that this was your experience. This is not our Dickey's standard. Please reach out to me at socialmedia@dickeys.com so that we may learn more of your visit and can address these issues. Thank you, Marin, Social Team.

text: Angela was amazing!  She was working by herself so she was cooking the food and waiting on people. Our ribs were tender and delicious along with the pulled pork sandwich. Our best trip so far!

name: Kristie Reine Ring
text: The food was great but more importantly the service was amazing!   The kindness and helpfulness of the staff was above and beyond amazing.  Our family appreciates the well done meal and great environment!

name: Greg Randall
text: I had a pork sandwich; it was fine.  The BBQ sauce is too sweet.  The Fried Onion Tanglers are phenomenal.

text: They have always been very courteous and the food especially the ribs beat out dreamland ten to one. As for pricing as good as anyone else in tuacaloosa maybe better.

text: Food is good, but 69 south location workers are RUDE RUDE RUDE. No respect for customers, always rolling their eyes or talking smack about someone else that works there. SO UNPROFESSIONAL. It is AWFUL. Will not be back.

text: Ordered takeout tonight and it was terrible. I think the coleslaw was out of date. The ribs tasted like they were a week old too. Will not be back. I pray I don’t have food poisoning.

resp.text: Hi Evelyn, we are sad to see that you were not satisfied with your experience ordering from Dickey's. I would appreciate it if you sent me an email to socialmedia@dickeys.com with your contact information. - Ann, social team

text: Given this place too many chances to impress me. If you go, go for meat only. I just had to convince the cashier that a yeast roll was included with my meal-really? I bought $30 worth off bbq and youre going to argue with me about a yeast roll...when it says on your sign that its included with the meat?? This place typically runs out of everything, so go early if you go at all. And dont be suprised if something is left out of your togo bag- has happened twice before- which is why I checked on the roll this time!

I couldn't take my eyes off the grimy napkin dispenser on our table, had to have been months since it was cleaned.  The waitress was polite and attentive.

The ribs literally fall off the bone, the baked beans were the best I've ever had. Everything was fresh and cooked to perfection. Stop here trust me it is worth the Detour you will not be disappointed!!

text: As if the BBQ and the burgers weren't the best in town, they added FISH! Rachel knows how to cook fried catfish in such a way that will have you craving for more!

text: We were in town for the weekend and decided to try something new. We had no idea what to order! The girls at the front were very helpful and we got amazing food! I had the bibimbop with octopus, very tasty! Will go back if I'm ever in Montgomery again!

name: Jae En
text: The service was HORRIFIC.  I asked the waitress for a glass for my beer and she said NO.  She refused to give me a glass, then she didn't even bother to bring out our Soju.  We ended up spending nearly 2 hours in this restaurant because the service took so long.  The food was expensive and sub-par.  I wish I could give this place 0 stars.

name: Tori W
text: Solid Korean. If you are interested in trying Korean food in Montgomery, you are in luck. The Hyundai Plant down the road has created an awesome collective of very authentic Korean restaurants. Woo Ga is one of those in the collective. They do have a Chinese fusion menu, but they offer traditional Korean dishes, including all the traditional side dishes of small plate pickled spicy veges & tofu. Outside they also have BBQ grills where you can grill your own meats which is a neat experience if you've never tried. They unfortunately don't offer Bi Bim Bop, which is one of my favorite dishes, but they do have hot stone pots (Dol sot), and the Bulgolgi dol sot was pretty tasty!

name: Chris Lynch
text: Great Korean food.  I had the bulgogi, soondubu jigae, and beef rib galbi.  All were fantastic.  Ban chan is complimentary.

name: LISA FISHER
text: Food and service was excellent!  Will be back. Will tell others about.

text: I could smell from the parking lot this was going to be great.  It was almost closing time and he was out of ribs, someone ran off with the last 7 slabs! No worries, was offered the BBQ sandwich and gladly accepted! Juicy meat, and topped with his signature family recipe slaw, just wonderful!  Also got down on a slaw dog and that was also a great idea! Never had one like this rib shack does it, that's for sure! If it wasn't closed as I write this, i'd go back for another! Heck, I'll be back, still gotta try these ribs now!  P.S. Cash only.

name: Angelica Meeks
text: Very friendly southern hospitality. And very delicious food. Would definitely recommend 👌

name: Matthew McReynolds
text:
Had known about it looking for barbecue places several months back, but realized within the past few weeks that it was very close on the route that I traveled to and from work(actually right on it —AL Hwy 379. Stopped and was not disappointed at all.

The restaurant is a cozy little shack, but the food goes way beyond it. the shredded pork was outstanding as well as the ribs. The side items are delicious. I have not tried the chicken nor the hotdogs/sausage/hamburgers yet, since they only serve them during the weekdays (unless you pre-order them). I usually get a plate for me my mom and myself on Sundays. My mom actually devoured the whole plate the first time she tried it.

Their sauces Are all homemade. I really loved their vinegar-based ones. Tried their Carolina hot last week and it was very good. The sweet and tangy is also good, which is what my mom likes.

Would definitely recommend this place to anyone. country’s barbecue in Columbus used to be my favorite place, but it’s got mad competition with backwaters now.

-8/23/20: Finally got a chance to try some of their chicken. It was awesome. Had a great smoky flavor and was done all the way through. Had to pre-order it since they don’t usually cook it on the weekends.

-1018/20: Watch out y’all. Mr. Wayne is being a mad scientist at deliciousness. Picked up two barbecue plates and a full slab of ribs from him on Sunday. He is experimenting with a new honey Bourbon glaze for the ribs. Didn’t have time for it to go on the grill to be caramelized, but with it just being wet and soaking into the ribs when I got them home, they were outstanding. When my mom eats more ribs than barbecue, you know it’s good. It’s not overly sweet, but you can taste the hint of bourbon and honey. I’m not a person that likes sweet foods, but I thoroughly enjoyed it too. Keep up the good work Mr. Wayne.

11/1/20- Mr. Wayne has a new sauce that would make Ted Nugent proud. Ask for the Wang Dang. It’s awesome

text: I visited Sand Mountain Bootleggers today with my son and his girlfriend for father's day. I had the brisket sandwich very good I will suggest the bourbon bbq sauce went well with brisket and the pickled veggies topping. My son had the bacon double cheeseburger he said it was awesome his girlfriend had the Sunday special chicken dumplings. Very good food I will recommend people to try it.

name: Jack durham
text: Had ribs. Very good food. Tried barbeque and it was so good we took a couple pounds home for holiday meal.  You don't go here for fancy atmosphere, you go here because it's the best food in the area, hands down.  The workers were friendly and attentive to our needs.  I will actually recommend this place because of the superior food quality.

resp.text: Thank you very much!  We just love to make folks happy with good food.

name: Joey West
text: The Barbecue here is absolutely delicious! Also they have a pay it forward board so that not anyone will go without a meal..a very nice idea so that not anyone will go hungry..I can't wait to try the smoked chicken..if you haven't tried this place u need to..the Barbecue was so good it didn't even need extra sauce..and I am a big sauce lover!

resp.text: Thanks Joey!  It's our pleasure to serve y'all.

name: June Johnson (Yaya)
text: The ribs were fantastic, great service, and an enjoyable experience.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Jonnie Damman
text: BBQ Brisket, green beans& potato salad, all VERY tasty.

resp.text: Thank you!  It's our pleasure to cook it for you.

name: George Harper
text: BBQ was real good. Would recommend this place to everyone who likes BBQ.

resp.text: Thank you!  Glad you liked it!

name: Sherry Dalton
text: Got the order wrong, made out as if we were an inconvenience. Did make it right, but overpriced overall. We will not be back. Side note: had up a hiring sign, I inquired about the position. Claimed she owned the place, but I have previously met the owner. She tore down the hiring sign right in front of me. Said she hired someone already. Just skip this place, over 18.00 for 2 barbeque sandwiches, who has time for that...

resp.text: She does own the place, along with me, her father.  She had already hired someone earlier that day and had not taken the sign down.  If we make a mistake on an order, we certainly want to make it right.  Thank you for pointing out that we did.  I'm sorry that your experience was less than satisfactory.

name: Steve Bond
text: Great hole in the wall place for authentic Texas barbecue and Southern home cooking.

resp.text: We appreciate that!

name: Kimberly Rollins
text:
It was okay. Disappointed in the slaw and potato salad.
Friendly people there.

resp.text: Hi Kimberly.  Thanks for leaving us a review.  It helps us improve our service and that is why we're here!  When were you here and what was it that disappointed you about our slaw and potato salad?

name: Lance Ollis
text: It was Absolutely Awesome

resp.text: Thank you!

name: George Dunn
text: Food was amazing

name: Janice Faye
text: Delicious!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Connie Flowers
text: Fantastic food and beverages.  Food prepared with expertise and fitness. My night at Smoke N Peaches was none the less memorable. Three courses expertly prepared. Each dish had a complementary beverage that paired precisely with the dish. Courses were served promptly and orderly by waitstaff.  I can't say enough about this incredible night of fine and pleasurable dinning.  Thank you Alex and Amanda.

name: Clare Hancock
text: Enjoyed the atmosphere, and the service was great. However, the BBQ was dry, and the mac and cheese was grainy. BBQ sauce was acidic. Sweet tea was the best thing we consumed. Added a star for the service!

name: Kreig Embriano
text: Quality ribs and fun and easy place to get tasty grub. They have a nice indoor and outdoor space, although I haven’t been able to sit outdoors as it was raining - will be amazing on a nice day though. Food is reasonably priced and yummy. They have an indoor bar with some nice brews on tap.  Not crazy busy for lunch on the weekdays so it’s kind of a hidden gem.

name: LeejaClane
text: We've been here twice, and if we had to lose Mike 'n Ed's, this is the best restaurant to take over the space! We'll be back again soon!!!

name: Lindsay Crosby
text: This food is some of the best BBQ in Auburn. Whether it's ribs, brisket, or pork, you can tell that Rob's Ribs knows and cares what they're doing. The sides are fantastic and even the desserts are great! I haven't had a bad meal here yet.

name: B Batt
text:
With the Butcher Paper reputation, I tried the brisket… They thought they didn’t have enough to supply the pound, but lucky me they did! Most people including myself love burnt ends, but not the entire edge of each slice burned so much that you can’t chew it. Good brisket doesn’t need sauce, and I smothered this just to get it down. (Brought my friend the other half pound, and he confirmed awful).
If it is bad food, don’t sell it.
My buddy loved his ribs.😆

text: Appearances can be deceiving. You might think this place is on fire. When open there is a small smokey fire burning out front of the business to send a signal to passing customers. I suggest you stop. Great things of the culinary kind can be found.

name: Mark Edwards
text: Still in search of an outstanding place to eat Bar-B-Q I went over to Smokin on the Boulevard to give them a try. After conversation with the owner he informed me if his ribs werent the best around he would give me my money back. I ordered a full rack of ribs, a whole chicken and a head of cabbage. I drove home to Muscle Shoals and had to watch where I put my hands. EVERYTHING was still very hot. Plenty of meat on the ribs, that were moist and seasoned just right. The chicken was moist and tasty. I like my white sauce more watery not like pudding but I make my own so thats not an issue. The cabbage was seasoned very well too. I highly recommend  Smokin on the Boulevard. You cant go wrong. Went back today to try the Brisket. It was juicy and seasoned just right. We have found our Bar B Q spot.

name: Michael R Ballard
text: Best BBQ by a landslide

$$$

text: Awesome in every way. I have only tried the pork and brisket but both were superb. The outdoor seating is decorated very nicely with flowers and they have trash cans out there so you can throw away your garbage without having to go back inside. This is surprisingly missing from some places. And unlike most every bbq place we have had in Auburn, they serve alcohol. 🍺

text:
Tough dry rubbed ribs. Too tough to pull off the bone.

The potato salad was the worst I’ve ever eaten. The potatoes were spongy, like old potatoes that get soft, and then they were cooked.  Each person in the house complained that the salad was drippy, like undrained potatoes.

Not their best showing today. Sorry 5/21

text: Messed up our order twice. Husband got a free beer out of it. Ribs were tough. Potato Salad and collards had no flavor. Brunswick stew only had pork and corn in it. Hush puppies were just ok. Pickles just tasted like cucumbers, not pickled long enough to get any flavor. The best thing we tasted were the bbq beans and their sauces. Waste of time and money, not worth it. Moes BBQ is way better.

If they can clear up the menu confusion, give more value and reduce the wait times it would be a stellar restaurant.

Food is AMAZING! peach... frickin.... cobbler!!!!!!
On a serious note, food is really great. Staff is always friendly and can make great recommendations. And it's always a warm friendly place great for family sit downs.

But seriously..... Try the peach cobbler. You'll thank me for the review afterwards.

name: David Campbell
text:
Shane’s Rib Shack is located at 4800 Whitesburg Dr, next to the Bonefish Grill. It is in the vein of the not quite fast food establishments where you order at a counter, then they bring the food to you.

I had the Sampler Platter, which included 4 ribs, pulled pork, 2 tenders, fried okra and baked beans. The entire meal was very filling, although across the board bland. The pork and ribs lacked any smoke flavor, and the chicken tenders, well they are chicken tenders, hard to mess up.

The sides were pretty much identical to what I would by in a can for baked beans, and the frozen section for okra.

They offered four sauces, Original, Mustard, Spicy, and Hot. The Original is a vinegar-based sauce, with a sweet back taste, over all very tasty. The Spicy and Hot taste similar with addition of additional black pepper to the Spicy, and possibly chili pepper to the Hot.

Overall I found the food to be very middle of the road, even for a chain, but service was friendly, and the food plentiful for the price.

name: caleb atnip
text: I "won" a free rack of ribs meal on a social media contest and was very excited to use it since I used to love Shanes. However after me trying to contact them over the period of a few months they never would send me the prize I won and no apology for stringing me along. It's a shame because I used to enjoy eating here but I don't like being lied to. More than likely won't ever go back unless I hear new management has taken over.

name: Bob Harnery
text: Drove all the way to Shane's and they were out of ribs. The place was dirty with tables needing cleaning all around us. The food was good when it arrived but they need to work on the cleaning.

name: Dorothy Peters
text: We like coming here, but the food is average. It's usually not too crowded which is nice and for a quick service BBQ place it's pretty good.

name: tammy
text: It is really nice. Down home people very friendly and wonderful  food.

name: Carolyn Barnes
text: Was disappointed in our food. BBQ tasted like it was left over & reheated... couldn't even finish my plate. Ribs were just OK. Service was good... everyone served with a smile & was very gracious. Yay to the employees but food was blah...

name: Raymond Shaver
text: The ribs and smoked wings was very good snd the staff was great as well. Cortney and her crew are doing a fantastic job.

name: Lester Combs
text: Loved it. Good value and great food. Staff was great and place was clean. Definitely going back.

name: Deanna Patterson
text: It was great good and service! I got the big dad bbq pork sandwich it was the most bbq I've ever seen at any restaurant on any plate and this was on my Texas toast sandwich! It's kinda high price I thought until I saw how much near was on my plate! my husband got the sampler he loved it His favorite part was the pork but the ribs beans and gets were great also!!! We will be back thank you for coming to Huntsville shanes run shack!!!

name: Temple “Cole” Pate
text:
The food was okay, although there was many things that deterred me from being four stars.

One, The food was okay, wasn't delicious, or anything honestly. It was simple and something i could take ten minutes to fix myself better at home for cheaper.

Second, and most importantly the service. I walked in there, and she was loud and never interacted with me. I asked for barb que sauce, instead i did not receive them. She only noticed me when the register required it. I then asked her for dr pepper, well she had to go laugh with her friends to then to return and tell me that they don't have dr pepper, after the drink machine was right in front of me, which is when i said mr pibb would be sufficient. But she then had to ask again, because her laughter only made her hard to hear. I then asked her little to no ice, she then turned to talk yet again, and fill my cup full. Least to say when I finally got home, i had to pour it out because it was flat.

aesthetically the food was appealing, and after hearing wonderful reviews from employees, i was very unhappy that it ended up the way it did. I would like to come again, but I will not choose the same cashier, nor order the same thing.

name: Jenny Combs
text: This was the best bbq I've ever eaten. The atmosphere is wonderful, the staff is fun and nice and they are very clean!

name: Daniel Champion
text: I eat at Shanes any chance I get. I should be some sort of paid spokesman for the amount of people I have brought into the place. My personal favorite is the ribs covered in the spicy sauce. Kinda got a sweet burn to it I cant get enough of. At first I was made fun of for talking about the place so much, but now I am being invited by the same people who poked fun at me. I highly recommend you at least try it for yourself. If you dont like it you always have bonefish grill next door. Try there hamburger and bang bang shrimp. But seriously, if you try Shanes you might throw rocks at the other bbq joints.

text: I work there and I make sure everything runs smoothly

name: Jessi Miller
text: Yum!

text: Love the hickory smoke wings

name: DJ Croft
text: I saw miss piggy in there once and she was chopped up.

name: janis whisenant
text: About time eat there now!

name: Rob
text: Great ribs and great service!

name: Tom Liddle
text: Reopening after the first of the year according to phone voice mail.

name: Gladiator Gaming
text: The ribs fall off the bone but no smoke flavor,the pulled pork was dry, the chicken was okay but again no smoke flavor. They don't serve baked beans but the potato salad & coleslaw were great. As far as sauces I tried the white & hot sauce. The white sauce was very vinegar-y & the hot sauce tasted like vinegar with cayenne & other spices mixed in without being simmered. Would I go back? Yes,just for the ribs but I'd get everything else including sauce from elsewhere.

name: Jim Bloodsworth
text: Been there three times and still can't figure out why there's always a line at the drive-through. Three visits, three meats, same dry, flavorless result; honestly, I've had jerky that was more tender and flavorful. Maybe they're giving away something valuable at the drive-through, it's certainly not the food.

name: Jeff Fro
text: While the BBQ pork wasn't bad, the 45 min wait was not worth it. On the cooking side i wouldnt change much. Needs a manager who knows how to keep things going on the business end. Lawlers here I come.

name: Jim Craig
text: Hanging onto their reputation?  I'm convinced this place is making it off its stubborn customer base.   I was one of them.   I took a friend the other day and he was, like, "What in the world?"   When I went next door to Smokey's, I found out why.   Thomas' has ONE sauce.   Smokey's has SIX.  Thomas's has a very limited choice of sides and mediocre fries.   They need to step it up.

name: Brian Morris (c4brian)
text:
I ordered a half pound of pulled pork for sandwiches.  I ate these on the same night I also picked up Smokey's pulled pork and pulled beef.  If you want my thoughts on Smokeys pulled beef, read that review (it tasted like a garbage can).  Anyway, Thomas' pulled pork was definitely better than Smokey's, but not by a large margin.  I definitely abandoned Smokey's pork once I tasted Thomas'.  The white sauce was mild and good, and the hot sauce had a lot of flavor and zing.  Both were definitely interesting, although not incredible.

I won't be back to either place for pulled pork when Lawler's Express is right down the road (it's better than both), but perhaps some of the other items are better.

As I said in the other review, Chuck Wagon would put both of these restaurants in some serious trouble ( if they could keep up with demand ).

name: Clay Renoit
text: The meat was frozen it had more ice inside the meat then you got inside a drink.I love bar-b-q but over the years this bar-b-q place is close. So thinking at some point something would change. But every time after eating here I have to pick me up some PEPTO BISMOL.

name: Earl Brinkley
text:
6/17/14 To go order ticket #128 Rib & Chicken Combo -
Disappointed. The fact I asked twice for white sauce for the chicken after declining hot sauce twice and being assured it was in the bag to get home with none was only surpassed by my surprise to find that the ribs (bones, grisle and cartlage) were chopped upinto one big mass of STUFF. If I had wanted chopped meat I would have ordered the pork, it would not have came with bone shards and hunks of grisle and joints
I guess the $14 spent was a lesson learned. I do not recommend eating here unless you can specify how you would like your food prepared.

name: Mikey P
text:
Went here on 4/4/14 at around 5:30PM.  My fiancée and I had always seen a ridiculous line inside and in the drive-thru for this place.  We decided to give it a shot.  Well, we went to the drive-thru and didn't get to the window for 35 minutes (there were only 2 cars ahead of us).  We ordered the chicken, ribs, and pulled pork with potato salad, cole slaw, and hush puppies.

We were disappointed in everything.  The potato salad was more of a puree than actual salad.  We got the impression that we missed the description for it on the menu somewhere ("take out your dentures and gum on this!").  It was roughly 98% mayo with 1/16" pieces of potato and such in it.  The cole slaw was marginally better, but still lacking larger pieces in it.  The taste was very strong with vinegar as well, which soured your tongue a bit.  The hush puppies were surprisingly good, but still really dry and expensive (6 for $1.50).  The BBQ bread looked and tasted like it was rushed as well, with no butter or real cooking that took place prior to being given to us.

Now on to the meat.  We are from Georgia, and have had some amazing BBQ over there and in Huntsville.  This has to be the second worst meat we have ever had (Golden Rule BBQ was the worst by a country mile).  The chicken looked good, but was super dry and tough in spots.  The pulled pork was dry and mushy when you started chewing on it.  The ribs were so hard and dry that my knife sounded like it was cutting through cardboard when I was trying to make a small piece.  They were also full of small cartilage pieces and bones that you couldn't see once cooked.  Once we got to the actual meat of these items, there wasn't any flavor.  It literally tasted like we were eating plain meat that we didn't even think about seasoning or tenderizing.  Keep in mind, all of their meats are served without sauce on them at all, but we will address that next.

Last, but not least, THEY DON'T HAVE THEIR OWN BBQ SAUCE!  They try to sell you a mild, medium, or hot sauce, but its all vinegar based and really watered down.  The girl at the drive-thru window even admitted that it was "super watered down" and that they give everyone Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce with their meals (no sauce comes on the meat)!  What proper BBQ business doesn't have their own sauce?!  They will even sell you 1/2 pint, pint, quart, half gallon, and gallon containers of Sweet Baby Rays at an increased price!  You could go to Publix/Kroger and get a gallon for half of what they are charging!  And what BBQ business uses pre-made, marketed sauces for their BBQ?!  This is the most ridiculous thing I have ever seen at a BBQ business.

Overall, we won't be going back.  The wait was horrible, the food was dry and tough, and the sauces aren't unique to them in any way.  I am confident that I could go to Publix/Kroger, buy all of the ingredients they use (just low grade meat and Sweet Baby Rays), set up shop right next door, and you wouldn't know the difference. Save yourself the time, money, and disappointment and go somewhere else.  Lawlers has a pretty solid lineup.  Moe's BBQ in Providence has a great menu as well.

When you're driving by and see the line of cars and retirees, laugh as you pass them to go to any other BBQ restaurant in north Alabama.

name: Matthew Hamm
text: Bland. Great looking place, but disapointing food.

name: Mark Wehrwein
text: Good bbq

name: Marianne Costes
text: We traveled up to visit the ava maria grotto and the most blessed sacrament cathedral. I ordered q pulled chicken sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese. It was grilled chicken not pulled but I wasn't informed of this. It was good quality chicken but there was a hard cartilage/clump in it I couldn't eat. The BBQ sauce was fine. The Mac and cheese was above average and I added a little salt and pepper to it. They were out of kielbasa (polish sausage) and potato salad which were two things my bf wanted...but he ordered a chicken sandwich with baked beans and coleslaw. The coleslaw was a little watery but had very good quality ingredients. The baked beans were alright but I expected a sweet or spicy taste to them not more so plain. They have a nice outdoor seating area and nice staff as well. So it is a decent place but not super scrumptious. Worth a stop by for a quick bite. It is affordable as well and has quick service.

name: Trey Short
text: This is a very small hidden place in Blountsville Alabama. If you're a fan of real Southern BBQ this is the place for you. They freshly BBQ everything on a real wood grill right out front of the store. The owner is very friendly and the local to the Core. He will gladly catch you up on the news around town and you can sit with the locals or you can sit on your own and enjoy a meal. Love this place and will definitely make it one of my weekly visits. And in case I didn't mention it every single dish and every piece of meat is made from scratch every single day.

name: Bill Poole
text: Food always good. Fast service very polite. Love eating here when I can.

name: Matthew Bambarger
text: This guy can smoke pork as good as it can be done, but that smoked chicken can't be beat...

name: Richey Boyd
text: This place...this place....there's magic here.  I can't emphasize the aura of the owner, Josh, enough.  He has a hold on this town and is loved by all.  The pure goodness if this man cones out in  his cooking. This man gets no sleep because he smokes his meat every single night.  I had pulled pork which was some of the best I've ever had.  The mac and cheese, made by Ms. Olivia, CANNOT be overlooked.  But let's talk about the turnip greens:  the taste is i describable.  What this man does to those turnip greens should probably be prayed over in church because I believe he made a deal with the devil to get them to taste that good.  I woukd go there just for them.  His special that day was smoked turkey and he let me have a sample.  If you like smoked turkey sandwiches, you need to come here on thursday.  I was there a couple of hours and customer after customer came in ordering the smoked turkey sandwich.  He has a smoker going on the sidewalk in front of the restaurant.  He's about to build an outdoor stage next door for live music.  Let me tell you, Josh is starting something magical and I am so glad that I get to witness it.  Do yourself and your family a favor, make the drive to beautiful Blountsville, and experience this little piece of small town country heaven for yourself.

name: Richard Jones
text: Great BBQ, love this place! The BBQ baked sweet potatoes on Wednesdays are the best!!

name: Jimmy Singleton
text: Josh is the best! We love his BBQ and his genuine southern charm

name: Bob Hoglan
text: One of the best places to eat and get good conversation.  The owner is a top notch guy.

name: Icysnoow S
text: Thought it was not cool to charge 2.99 for Mac n cheese side when it comes in a small sause like cup. Wouldn't have paid that much for such a tiny cup..

name: Nick K
text:
I don't normally leave reviews, but I felt that they have earned/deserved it.

I was raised on old style BBQ. Something that is becoming exceedingly rarer to find these days. The pork sandwich I had took me back to the old days of my grandfather getting BBQ with me in West Tennessee. It was perfectly done. The sauce and coleslaw was a nice touch, but in my mind,
didn't even need it.

I also had a side of Turnip Greens. Turnip Greens are easy to make and you don't expect much from them. However, I would have to say these are the second best Turnip Greens I have ever had. I only say they are second because if the women folk in my life found out I like someone else Greens more than theirs, then my soul would not be long for this world.

Being s small business owner myself I know how much hard work it takes to keep a business going, and these good people have done a grand job.

I only wish I had tried their food sooner and that I passed thru more than 4-6 times a year. Keep it up and God bless y'all!

name: Uncle Brad
text: Great place for 'Que... can't wait to try the smoked bbq sweet tater crack plate! Awesome folks to deal with,  also. Top notch, good people behind the counter--- this is the type of place you don't even look at the prices it's so good.

name: Monique Corban
text: Wow! I wish I could rate this restaurant 10 stars! The pulled chicken sandwich was so Smokey and paired perfectly with their house made BBQ sauce. The Mac & cheese was so good I had to take some to go! I didn’t get a chance to try the loaded sweet potato but the locals raved about it so much that I think I need to make the 3 hour trip back just to try one! The food was terrific but the customer service is what brought me to write a review. The owner Josh and sweet wife Olivia showed us what true southern hospitality really means from the very moment we walked in to their warm welcome and kind smiles. He prepared our food with a genuinely great conversation. If we lived in the area we would definitely be regulars and if we should find ourselves passing through Blountsville again (or anywhere near, really) we will have to make our way back to Deep South BBQ!

text: Probably the only place to get Filipino food in BHM right now. The folks are really friendly and accommodating. The food is awesome and priced really well, serving size is on the bigger size. name: Lexii Jackson
text: What a GEM! I came across Ricarda's food truck once while at Home Depot on 280 and just had to find out where they were located to give them a try. I am so glad that I did! Saturday's are naturally days that I load my gf and my dog in my car to do something random or try something new. Ricarda's got to be our new thing today. I am already very familiar with Filipino BBQ, but had zero idea there was Filipino BBQ in Bham. We opted to try the pork adobo that came with rice and marinated cucumbers/peppers. The pork was super tender, juicy and flavorful. The rice was perfectly cooked and the marinated cucumbers was that perfect bite of crisp freshness to balance the plate out. We also had an order of the pork dumplings with the spicy sauce. I personally wanted more kick in the sauce, but mannnn were those flavors all there. All of the food had great price points, portions were perfect, and everything was piping hot. Location is easy to find and I love how it just gets you away from the city. Enjoy the picnic tables and fresh air. Above all the owners and service just made the experience that must more enjoyable. They are so sweet and welcoming. I would come just to speak to them, it's just a plus that their food is bomb too. Can't wait to go back and try the kabobs!

name: Jessica Harper
text: The worst experience with a restaurant EVER! When I first come in on my lunch to pick up a call in order there was a young girl that was openly was discussing that she would rather serve dogs than children as they were discussing family night. Someone that PAYS their hard earned money to come in and eat with their children I was instantly disgusted. Then I get back to work and find that my food was undercooked (still bleeding) when I asked for well done. The gentleman that was the manager condoned her remarks as she is just young. Well sir my young children come in there to eat and I am utterly applaud that you stand behind her remarks. I will never spend my money at this restaurant simply because of the manager and the way he handled this situation. So I missed my lunch and had to do without. THANK YOU! Word of mouth is the best compliment, to bad you left me with only negativity.

We ordered the fried green tomatoes as an appetizer, got them AFTER our main course was eaten.  Server continually blamed the kitchen staff for the half and hour wait.  The restaurant wasn't even packed.  We ordered corn dogs for the kids, yup half and hour wait.  Server completely forgot the diet coke and screwed up the chicken order.  We asked for legs and thighs, got beast and wing. Argggh.

name: nate J. pooh
text: At the start the service was questionable. We're getting seated and the first table she wanted to seat us at was directly in front on entry way of kitchen. Second spot  was directly next to a couple. Mind you the place was very unpacked maybe 10 guest at best 5 of 10 were at the bar when we got there. The table  had not been wiped clean. The whole area had not been clean since whoever left. It was so slow that the associates were  just standing around talking . The bathroom  looked like a club bathroom on a Saturday night at 2am. Floors were very sticky for some reason. Like when you go to a club and its really hot  and people have wasted alcohol and it's been trampled on. NOW the food was good but the chicken strips and 2 sides was very over price at $13! Three strips fries  and a small  dish  salad. Strips and fries were good tho. I got the Nashville Hot Chicken with two sides.  That was a whole chicken breast and wing for $10 and change. It was very good. Now our waitress was a different story. She was unenthusiastic and very dry. We had completely  ate our food but she had the nerve to ask if we wanted to-go boxes. Um... for the crumbles of curly fries ??? She also didn't check on us till after  we were 80% done eating.

text: Meh....I walked in right to place a to-go order for a Nashville hot chicken platter as they were opening for the day. I was told that they didn't have any chicken halves so I had to get the tenders. I took a seat at the end of the bar to wait on my food. The bartender (a very petite brunette) never acknowledged my presence. I would have had a cold beer while I waited to no avail, she was too preoccupied with her cellphone which she had hooked up charging next to the register. (Who shows up for work at 11am and has to charge their phone?) I suppose I may return one day due to the chicken being pretty good but that bartender should understand her personal phone takes a back seat to anyone who sits at the bar. I'm sure she saw me it would have been impossible to miss me. Everyone else was fairly pleasent. Took off 2 stars for not having what I wanted and the unattentive bar keep on duty that day.

text: I eat here regularly and I love it.  I always order the baked potato with nothing on it but chicken or the pork sandwich with inside meat and no coleslaw.  Never had a bad meal.  If I order desert it is always the lemon ice box pie.  So yummy!  The waitresses are down home friendly.  Best barbecue in Madison County!

name: Nate Hubbard
text: It's edible. This place has a long reputation in town and I think they're just trading on the name right now. There was nothing technically wrong with it, just pretty bland all around. The one high point is the vinegar and black pepper white sauce. I personally prefer Moe's because they have a very good rub on their pork, this place didn't seem to have any seasoning at all. I probably won't go back.

name: Lee Byrd
text:
I recently moved in to the area and decided to give the tired looking BBQ joint down the road a try. I was pleasantly surprised.

It was about 2:30pm and they'd just finished wiping down from the lunch rush. The friendly counter staff asked us to watch our step on the floors when we walked in and we approached the counter. After placing our order for two catfish plates with hush-puppies and a baked potato we took a seat and were promptly brought our drinks which included a soda and some fresh-brewed coffee. The coffee tasted like it should, like the machine was kept clean.

After a reasonable amount of time the food was brought out. The catfish had a crispy crust, the meat flaked perfectly, and the taste was how a catfish should taste. The baked potato was close to a pound-and-a-half and they brought plenty of hush-puppies. The hush-puppies felt like they'd been held for a bit as they weren't exceptionally hot, and the texture was only ok.

In the end I had to look for a reason to take a 5-star rating down to a 4-star rating. I'd recommend this location to any of my friends and I'd happily take them there myself.

name: MaryJane Stricklin
text: From Texas and wanted to try local BBQ. A local referred me to this place. Quaint little place. Staff was pleasant. BBQ is fantastic. Had the Gibson's Sampler plate with a selection of pork, beef, and ribs. Yum.

name: Ben Lucke
text: I got a "large" pork plate, drink, and order of hush puppies. While the flavors of the food were pretty decent, the value is just not there whatsoever. The pork and sides are so meagerly portioned. For 17 dollars, you can go to Lawler's or Moe's and get much more bang for your buck. I don't see how or why this place costs so much; I won't be going back

name: Kindell Jackson
text:
****EDITED 6/1/18****
I called tonight and I believe the owner answered the phone and I asked for Darrell. He said he wasn't sure where he was but would take a message and have him contact me ASAP. I explained that I was calling based on the response I got off our review and he went to find Darrell for me. Darrell immediately apologized for everything and I told him we understand that things happen and that we have never ever had a bad experience with them except for that one time. I even told him that we had switched to them from Dixie Wings due to some bad experiences with them and couldn't have been happier. My husband gets there to pick up our replacement wings and just the look and smell of them was back to the quality of what we were used to. The taste of their wings makes you want to cry they are so good. I'm so happy we gave them a second chance and so happy that they are dedicated to make sure that their quality exceeds expectations. Thank you Jose, Darrell and the rest of the outfield staff.

We usually get wings from here at least once a week and have never had a problem with our wings. We got a 50 PC wing last night, mild and extra crispy. We live almost near big smoke diesel down hwy 80 so it's not a quick trip. My husband got home and when we went to eat some of our wings the first thing we noticed was there was hardly any sauce on them. Then there were only four flats and we were offered to pay an extra for only flats. That's not what we want....just half and half would be sufficient but 4 flats out of 50 wings is a bit ridiculous. But we were still going to eat them however as we were eating them they were extremely dry. We ate maybe 10 out of the 50 and when we called and spoke with Darrell we were assured that it would be made right. We ordered another 50, mild and extra crispy and took the other 40 from last night back to them. Brittany who works there said we've got you we will take care of it. Well when I get back from taking our daughter to the bathroom they wanted $28.50. So we said they could keep the ones we brought and the ones they just made for us. We aren't going to essentially pay twice for wings that should have been made correctly the first time. They've lost our business for good. On the hunt for wings somewhere else.

name: Ethan Goodman
text:
Hell yes!
The food here is amazing and the staff and fellow customers make this place welcoming. You can sit back and have a meal with family and new found friends.
All-you-can-eat wing night on Mondays and other buffet options throughout the week are available but the barbecue is why you should take your first visit. Get the ribs and pulled pork. Thank me later. Extremely military friendly restaurant as well. Get out of your comfort zone of chain restaurants and give this little local dive a try.

resp.text:
Ethan
We thank you for coming out to give us a try.  Hopefully this will be your future stop with family, friends and co-workers.

We're proud to support our military guests that make it possible for us to be here living free.  Thank you for your service!!!

Jose Sierra

text: This was an unpleasant experience. My family and I went off of the reviews, which were 4.5, and thought we were in for an authentic barbecue experience. The brisket was not brisket, it was chipped beef. The potato salad was overpowered by mayo. The meat was bland and was only saved by the BBQ sauce. The fries were fresh and seasoned. The sweet tea was super sized.  My recommendation would be to keep driving when you see this little 🐷 on the side of the road.

text: Real BBQ. Best pulled pork in Dothan. Smoke flavor and bark abound. The large pork sandwich is worth the price. I’d give this place 5 stars, but the sauce could be a little better... also a little on the pricey side. Will definitely be back.
