text: My hubby and I came here on a weekend get away to AMI. We stopped by here and loved the food! Service was attentive and food came out mighty fast and hot. Hubby says he loved the pineapple in the cole slaw! Will be back when we find ourselves in Bradenton again.

text: The food is absolutely terrible. It was not fresh. The guy working at the window for the pickup was rude, he slammed the window 3 times after asking us questions about our order. Then pretty much threw the food out the window at us... we did not even eat the food. It was so bad we just threw the food in the trash!

name: Jarrod Tidwell
text: The man that runs this place knows what he is doing.   They always have ribs ready, sometimes I get a slab at 10:30 am.  They are cooked perfectly.  You get a full slab of meaty, juicy ribs for $20. That is a very good price for the quality of the meat.  He also sells the sauce by the bottle,  I recommend buying a bottle when you get a slab. This place not fancy, but the food is really good.  Easily the best ribs in Dothan.

text: I don’t even want to give a star! After waiting over 30 minutes they still had our order wrong three times, plus had the audacity to blame the people ahead of us waiting just as long for “additional orders”. Oh and when the guy came to the window assuring us order was right after the second time, because he personally made it... guess what wrong again and wanted to charge us more and still left with the wrong kind of sandwich. Ridiculous slow service and poor poor customers service skills. Will never be back!

name: Shirley Hogg
text: These pork BBQ nachos are AWESOME!!!

name: wes davenport
text: Best barbeque in dothan! Ive tried them all

name: bryan w
text: Good food for a good price. I'll be back.

name: John Webber
text: Great bbq and great service!!

name: Robert Watson
text: Hands down best BBQ in Dothan.

name: Aaron Hurd
text: Diamond in the rough, and what a diamond! Fantastic wings & ribs, and the best home made ranch I've had. Definitely be back.

name: Blue Pixel Works
text: This place is absolutely phenomenal!  I was so impressed by the food I got to day From pig out. My ribs arrived hot and perfectly cooked they were also individually separated which I loved many places will not do that for you. The meat was fall off the bone delicious. Truly honestly the best pork ribs I ever had in my life. I am a customer for life.

name: Jeff G
text: While the ribs are big, getting only 4 in rib platter falls short for me. Thus the 4 stars. IMHO, it should be 5 or 6 ribs. Food/service is great.

name: Thomas Heisner
text: Called order in via phone. 15 minutes later arrived to pick up. Order never assembled. Had to wait for order to be filled. Quality was real good.

name: Denetrius Butler
text: Great lunch!

name: Oak Miller
text: Friendly staff but the cue wasn't my bag

name: Patrick Rice
text: Had a large bbq sandwich combo with fries and a sweet tea. Sandwich had cartilage chopped in with the meat and seemed like it was made over the weekend. Very dry!!! Fries were the best part, but they’re just crinkle fries with a ton of dry rub dumped on them. Nothing special. The tea was no good either, first time I’ve had gross sweet tea in the south but they figured it out. Save your $9 and go get bbq at a local Dairy Queen, it’s that bad.

name: william smith
text: Very good place to eat drive up but very good food

name: Rodney Burgess
text: Best bbq in Dothan

name: LISA BUTLER
text: Didn't get to try the Bbq sauce because they forgot to put it in our pickup order, but it was good and not fatty.

name: Jennifer Wakefield
text: Very, very disappointed with the supposedly “smoked” pulled pork sandwich - y’all absolutely no smoked flavor in the meat and the baked beans were out of a can....

name: BB
text: Man! I only get Pig Out once a year and he has no stew! Ok.. a little stew but I need LOTS!! I still love you though.

name: nathan martin
text: This is the smallest large BBQ I ever got

name: Jason Tew
text: Great food.

name: Anita Allen
text: Best ribs I’ve ever had in Dothan! Kind people, generous servings

name: David Mott
text: It was good bbq. Sides not much to my liking

name: ChaCha Fance (Mrs. Fance)
text:
This is by far the best BBQ place in Dothan. The pork is tender and flavorful. The sauce is sweet and satisfying. The fries are seasoned, crispy, and delicious. Prices are fair, especially considering the large portions.

If you go an hr or so before closing time, they're often out of 50% of the sides, though. However, the amazing taste of the food makes up for it! You'll definitely be back again once you try it.

name: David Morris
text: Great food; great staff!!

name: Sherry Simpler
text: Stopped in today based on reviews and we will definitely be back. The ribs were delicious. Extremely tender and juicy.  Not much to look at from the outside but I’m glad I didn’t let that stop me from trying it!

name: Unicorn on game’s 1234
text: Amazing a true game changer

name: Walter Davidson
text: great bbq taste great great service

name: Adria Campbell
text: We’ve stopped here 5 years in a row going to and from Panama City Beach. The best bbq we’ve had. Ribs are great. Wings are great. Even the hot dogs are great!

name: Chris Watson
text: If you want good bbq this is the place to go

text: Great pork sandwich and sauce options. Excellent service!

name: Alicia Kidd Nyborg
text: Pork sandwich and Brunswick stew are terrific!

name: Rickey Morris
text: Great food

name: Kayla Minger
text: I ordered the rib plate and it was terrible! The ribs had no flavor or smoke on them.  The pork sandwich was ok. I feel like they should have more pride in what the sell. My rib plate had a piece of garlic toast and the toast was hard as a brick.  They are always very friendly but the food just isn't good.

name: kel lori
text: BEST BBQ IN DOTHAN!!! I'm not a sweet BBQ fan and they have a variety of sauces, hot, mustard, sweet, Carolina, etc.. not only is their BBQ the best in this world but so are their french fries! Perfectly salted with a hint of pizazz!  Fast service, friendly cook, we went back the next day and were so sad it was closed!! LOVING THIS PLACE!!!

name: David Marshall
text: If your rollin through Dothan, this is a must try.

name: Meems
text: Some of the best  bbq in Dothan.  Great prices. Excellent food!  We will definitely be making them one of our regular BBQ places to eat!

name: Sid Braswell
text: Best BBQ in town.  I had the pulled pork and stew, both were well prepared.  The pork comes without sauce, and they have several to choose from! This place looks kinda run down, but if you know BBQ in the south-those are the places you SHOULD be looking for.  The service was good, and they have a well rounded menu.  If you're wanting BBQ, don't waste your time anywhere else around Dothan, these guys have them beat.

name: Trace Patrick
text: Excellent food

name: Tanya St. Amant
text: Food and Service is A PLUS! Prices are fair. The chicken was so good, tasty and moist and doesn't have that overpowering smoke taste that stays with you all day. Has a great variety of tasty sauces. Nice to see a place that cares about their service and the food they serve to their customers.

name: Clarinda M
text: I loved this place! Staff was amazing, nice vibe inside, ribs were tender and juicy, plus they have a variety of sauces. I liked the North Carolina amd their sweet sauce mixed.  No doubt when I am in the area we will be stopping there.  Seriously some of the best BBQ I have had.

Best ribs ive ever had in my life.. Hands down.. Amd Im from south florida... I also ordered a bbq shredded pork sandwich.. ...bbq is a dry rub and they also make their owm sauces.. I like the sweet sauce.

My wings were so hard & dry I couldn't eat them, potatoe salad was more like mashed potato salad. My husband said his sandwich was ok. Won't be back.

Great food, great prices, and very friendly staff, a must go to place if you find yourself in Dothan, Alabama.

name: Krista Robinson
text: Great food, good prices, and very friendly staff. We had eaten at their food truck and were excited to try the restaurant. Most expensive thing we ordered was the BBQ nachos, which came smothered in cheese sauce, pulled pork, and BBQ sauce (jalapeño optional for no extra charge). It was just over $10. Our kids loved the mac n cheese and banana pudding. It offered a cute little dine-in area in the AC, which was important to us, or you can sit at a shaded picnic table outside and enjoy an ice cream. They offer free refills on drinks as well. Mostly, they just have great customer service. Was a very good experience - it's a shame we live so far.

name: Robin Walker
text: Pork was kinda dry.. but it was ok..

name: Tiffany Reed
text: My husband and I absolutely LOVE this place.. The food is fantastic& the friendly service is even better. Not to mention they have really affordable prices. They also serve super delicious milkshakes that come in all sorts of different flavors.. The only bad thing is that they are only open at certain times & only on weekends.. They accept donations from others so that they never have to turn anyone away if they can't pay.. Its such a heart warming & absolutely phenomenal place that's full of great people. By far one of our favorite places to eat..

name: Morgan Collins
text: Found this place on Google and it had a 4.7 rating. I give it 5 stars! There were 6 of us and everyone enjoyed their food.

name: Bobby Rosson
text: Absolutely Delicious

name: Michelle Martinez
text: Delicious BBQ and excellent staff!  The place is clean with super fast service.  Ribs are THE BEST!  A family from CO will drive all the way back for this place.  Note, they are open Thursday, Friday and Saturday only.  You can buy a meal ticket for someone that needs a meal but is a little short and pay it forward.

name: Stuart Donald
text: This place started out as a food truck and is now a brick and mortar operation. The barbecue here is outstanding.

name: Muriel Wages
text: Oh my what a great place to eat. Best BBO I've ever had. And wonderful ice cream cones too. I do wish they were open more than 3 days a week.

name: Wendi Wiggins
text: Great food, great prices, and friendly faces and atmosphere. I highly recommend !!!!!

name: Butch Lewis
text: Great customer service and even better BBQ. My favorite is the giant baked potato smothered in cheese and tons of BBQ pork. My daughter loves the BBQ  Nachos!

name: Deborah Haefner
text: Passing through on my way to Missouri. Ribs and pork were very good,  side were good,  slaw is sweet as they advertise,  only thing, fries could have been cooked crispy,  might be a southern thing. Then, these  deliciously made extreme shakes  in a Mason jar. Place is worth a stop and having eat outside combating flies.

text: Delicious food, and nice employees.great service.

name: Elizabeth Downey
text: Their bbq pulled pork sandwiches are da bomb along with the baked beans...n the sandwiches are large too

text: Woke up did not want to cook then Grillbillies BBQ came to my mind been a week since I last had a meal from there so I got my parents plus sister a meal while I was waiting for my order 2 elderly ladies were describing a dessert they had seen on facebook after seeing what they were talking about  I had to have one plus my mom  and dad  one as well needless to say I should not be hungry till tomorrow

text: Not impressed pork was dry something that you would cook in a crock pot, hush puppies were not cooked all the way through and had no flavor, the catfish didn’t have any flavor either.

text: Its usually really really great but the last 3 visits, the meat was pretty dry.  Won't be going back for a while.....

resp.text:
Hey Tori. Thank you for your honest review. We reallly do appreciate you as a customer and want to make things right.  We will take care of your next visit if you come back to see us again.
BTW,what was the meat you had today?

name: Mary Cook
text: Delicious! The milkshakes are like no others! It's a must to try this place out! However, the flies were awful when we tried to eat outside. Like relentless. They need a mosquito spraying service.

resp.text:
Thank you for the kind review Mary!
I certainly cant disagee about the flies. We have been fighting them for weeks now. Ive spent alot of money trying to get rid of them and will try a pest service this week to hopefully get rid of them. Thank you for your business.

name: Elvira Carter
text: The food was delicious. The ribs were just falling off the bone. Th slaw was a little to sweet for my liking other than that I would have given 5 stars.

text: We went about an hour before closing, all they had was pulled pork and sausage left. So we got a plate of each. I love the pulled pork. Hubby said the sausage was good and so was the baked beans and potato salad. They have sweet coleslaw.... love it, my favorite!! We didn't try their new specialty shakes but lots of people did and they looked amazing!! We'll be back for sure. My advice... Don't go near closing time!! LoL

name: Jasmine Bowman
text: Wow, is the expression I'm left with after finally trying this place! Do not let looks deter you from stopping by. The 2 folks running the show were so friendly. The food was hot, fresh, delicious and the bread pudding with rum sauce was to die for  My boyfriend and I are definitely going to be repeat customers.

name: Heather Jackson
text: Stopped in for a quick lunch today. We drive past this place all the time and it smells so good. I don’t know why we waited so long to try it. The lady working was super sweet and it literally felt like we were at her home and it was a family cookout. Laid back, absolutely delicious food. I had a sausage dog with their spicy BBQ sauce and sauerkraut. My husband had the pulled pork plate with potato salad and baked beans. Both were delicious but even better was that they were piping hot. Freshly made and didn’t have that I’ve been sitting all day feel. Even had a lady with a rush order for pork pull up while we were eating and they handled it quickly and with such kindness. We will definitely be back.

name: Ruth Freeman
text: The experience was excellent. Excellent service and menu items. The location was convenient and  the atmosphere was perfect for enjoying the excellent food. Definitely recommend this place!

name: Brian Fernandez
text: I passed this spot several times before I made the effort to try their menu.  I picked the Pulled Pork sandwich and sausage for a side bite.  Their selection of sauces I picked was their Mild/Original and the Spicy.  Both meat servings were excellent in flavor without any of their sauce added.  Then I tried both meat servings with both sauces I selected.  Both sauces had great flavorings with the meats with the Spicy not being a "hot" sauce but had that flavor kick one wants in a sauce.  The outside sitting area is a small great spot to eat their menu items and share conversations.  If you want a great priced BBQ spot with a small home feel served by some great people of Alabama stop here.  Give them a try!!!  I'm going to stop again for other menu items to sample.  Stay tuned for updates!

name: Diana Alvarado
text: Everything was phenomenal. The decor, the food, the staff, absolutely everything. Wonderful food experience. Guided by a friendly and knowledgeable server, we had a fabulous meal.

name: Zach Nicholas
text: Just had lunch here- very fun. The screened in eating area is home-y and relaxing. The folks behind the counter are incredibly nice as well!  Just happy to see you and they take good care of you!  Food’s great too- had pulled pork and sausage!

name: Edmund Tucker
text: Amazing place. Services was on top level. Everything was well organised. Staff were professional and greeted us very well. Environment was great. Food was delicious. I liked the dessert.

name: BB Mahoney
text: What a little BBQ Gem! The smoke hit us at the 4 way and we just had to stop in for a bite! Wonderful tender food and the Hosts were even better! Southern hospitality at its finest!

name: Andy Ho
text: You'll feel like it's the middle of nowhere, and this is the highest compliment I can pay: it's worth the drive. This is the real deal. Everything is just right. The pork tastes like it spent the perfect amount of time cooking, not a minute less or a minute more. The sauce was served on the side and is the right combination of sweet and spicy. Even the sides are delicious. The beans are so sweet and umami, you'll wish you ordered the large instead of the small. The mac and cheese will leave the cup with a "cheese beard" on the way to your mouth. It's hot and the perfect temp so you're neither scorching your mouth nor stabbing a congealed lump. In my 15+ years of living in Alabama it's the best barbecue I've ever had. It's what non-Southerners dream about when they dream about barbecue. Highest possible recommendation.

name: Jeffrey Brown
text: So glad I stopped here! Food is Excellent! The owners are very nice. Will be my stop for BBQ from now on....

name: Craig Austin
text: Awesome food, you must get the potato salad as a side, pulled pork smoked to perfection, owners on site, to cater to your every need!

name: Ethan Torres
text: The experience was excellent. Excellent service and menu items. The location was convenient and  the atmosphere was perfect for enjoying the excellent food. Definitely recommend this place!

name: corrin lee
text: The owners are lovely and make you feel like you are eating with family and love to talk with their customers.

name: Stephanie Lee
text: The food is excellent and at very reasonable prices.  The people are very friendly.  There is a small screened in area if you want to stay and eat or you can just walk up and place your order to go.

name: sashalsimmons sls46060
text: Best coleslaw I've had in a while!!!

name: Jeff Stabb
text: This place is awesome. Brad and his wife are really nice and the food was fantastic. Get the pulled pork, Mac, and potato salad

name: Stephanie Lee
text: Delicious food.  I had smoked sausage on a bunand mac and cheese.  My husband had the bbq sandwich and Mac and cheese.  Best macaroni in Alabama!!  Everything was hot and fresh and to us quickly.

name: Dan Shepherd
text: This is very good barbecue the chicken is to die for . The potato salad is very good southern style.

name: Barry Hopper
text: These folks are so friendly and the food is excellent! Don’t miss a chance to try them out!

name: Chris

name: Noah Longshore (Cooljerk69atgmail)
text: Best barbecue on the coast...this place hasn't been here long but once you try it you won't go anywhere else...prices aregreat and thefood literally melts your taste buds...

name: Connie Brooks

name: Nancy Statham

text: Love this place!

name: Stacey Vitell
text: Epic

name: kenny watts
text: I got 20 wings for $17 and I'm glad I did cause the wings were small. I mean 2" flats and no meat on them or the drums. I will admit, the sauce was by far some of the best sauce I have had. I got the medium, was actually medium and not to hot or mild. And a great flavor too. It took 17 of them to fill me up and I'm a 12 wing guy if they are normal size. All in all, I would definitely recommend the wings but if your like me get the 20, or smaller but with a side. I heard there spicy bbq is good too. I'll try that next.

name: Paige Divins
text: Fries were bleh. Even if the fries were super fresh when I ate them they still would have been bleh. They didn't have any color to them and lacked salt or any type of seasoning at all. The chicken strips had like some burnt crispy bits stuck to it like maybe the grease was really dirty. They do not have the good ranch, but they do have that good Honey Mustard.

name: Albert Wapples
text: Fair prices, but you get what you pay for. The fries didn't have any seasoning and the wings were small. The wings were the size of a pinky. Also idk if the cashier was rude or just honestly couldn't hear me threw the face mask.

name: MSG Taylor
text: I ordered the ten piece bbq wing combo which was pretty good I would change flavor next time tho I didn't really like the bbq ...

name: Ceaira “CCnQuotations” Walton
text: My fam and I love the wings and fries here. We've tried nearly every flavor. My recent visit was about a week ago. I ordered our usual 50 piece and fries and noticed that the price had gone up a substantial amount. I thought the cashier made an error but I was told prices had changed. I was not informed of the changes when I called my order in nor did I notice any signs indicating changes. Wings get a 5 but the business itself get a 2. I'm not sure if I'll be back anytime soon. Prices are too ridiculous for me.

name: Garihanna & Gary
text: Very polite and clean also speedy. And you get nice portions also!

name: Jayy Elijah
text:
*FIRST TIME CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE*

I ordered my food via DoorDash and I called to let the company know my order wasn’t prepare correctly. The cashier that answered the phone was rude and very inconsiderate. I spent almost 30 dollars with this company. my chicken wings were over cooked and my egg rolls were burnt. The cashier let me know the egg rolls come frozen and it’s nothing they can do about them. Additionally, she told me there is a no refund policy so me even calling to complain about my order was pointless. Her exact words were “there’s nothing I can do for you.”  I will never shop with this restaurant again.

name: Leticia Soto-Burton
text: Since I moved to Phenix City I been coming here getting there wings..They have the best wings. The staff is kind and sweet. Me and my family enjoy this place so Five Stars from me

name: LilliJo Elle
text: Came in to order & asked for a large drink with my food. Waited for my food and when I asked for my drink I was told that she forgot to ring the drink up (which I wouldn’t know since the receipts have no info on them). No problem.. I ordered the large drink again and my Paymemt was refused because it wasn’t 2 dollars and I wanted to use a card. I understand it cost money to run CC transaction that are less than a certain amount but I think since the cashier admitted to forgetting to ring up my drink an exception could have been made I had just spent 25 dollars on wings. 😤

name: Tonya Clements
text: Wonderful! The food was absolutely tasty! The service was ok. They could be a little more friendly, other than that though, I'd eat here again

text: Great food and atmosphere!! Also budget friendly!! I love the lemon pepper and teriyaki wings!!

text: Decent food

name: Ashley Chapman
text: If you're big on customer service, this is not the place for you. We're rushed to order. Wings are small but good. Fries are decent. Place is clean. The wait is up to 15 minutes.

name: Greg Hardy
text: This place is a hidden gem.  I was craving buffalo wings and luckily stumbled into Dixie wings.  My family came in and took a few minutes to decide, but we decided on 30 mild wings, 10 teriyaki wings, and a medium French fries.  The total came up to around $30, which seemed really cheap for the amount of food.  I drive it home and it took all of my will power to not eat it in the car.  I got home and destroyed the food, it was amazing.  I will visit the place many more times, check it out!

name: Kenzie
text: Horrible! The chicken tenders are so dry and so small... as for the hot wings they are so so tiny and gross. And it’s ridiculous you pay 16$ for it just to be a waste and no drinks came with it if I could rate this place a zero stars I would...

text: Paid $15 for tiny wings that are not filling at all. Even Buffalo Wild Wings, a place that I consider overpriced, gives you 3 times more for $15...

text: Pretty good wings. Good flavor and nice specials. They keep the doors open all day and night the couple times I've been and that allows bugs to fly in. Should probably keep them closed.

text: VERY LAST TIME GETTING MY MONEY. Very Dry and overcooked. I had the lemon pepper, and you cant taste anything, ranch is watery (cheap) . I live in columbus and come pass this place when im in the area. This is my 3rd and last time giving them a try when im over in this area. Wing city is good thats also in this area. Other than that wings cafe in columbus ga are awesome (airport)

name: Sammantha Fietzek
text: Worst wings in my entire life! I've never seen wings that small, ever. The restaurant was uncomfortably hot (the window unit registered 85°). And there was something wrong with the sauce that I can't exactly figure out. The consistency, color and taste were....weird.

name: Jasmine Adams
text: Dixie wings are one of the best wings I have ever had I only go there now for my wings every time I call and place a order they pick up and once i get there my wings are ready the staff is great I love this place keep up the good job!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review! We appreciate your business and looking forward to seeing you again!

name: John Anderson
text:
Eh, could have been better. The wings were really small, "tiny" would be a good word to describe them. Could have left less sauce in my tray as well. My Tweety Bird wings were literally swimming in sauce. (I'm wondering if they give extra sauce so that you can drink it to fill you up?) They only gave one Ranch Sauce with my order of 10 wings but with the size of the wings, I had plenty left over for the Zalad I got at Zaxby's.....
Overall, I'm not satisfied and won't be coming back.

text: I love the wings and love the staff. Sam does a good job with keeping it up. I think their lemon pepper wings are to die for.

text: Great BBQ. Loved the mustard sauce with the chopped pork. Eric is friendly and fun. Definitely recommend!

text: I would have taken a photo of my plate to share with this review, but honestly it smelled too good to wait. Food is excellent and service was fast. Just a heads up to those looking for their location, they are located across from the Walnut Hill Eagle gas station on AL-50. If you're in the area looking for some good bbq, this is the place.

The Best Da*n BBQ in Alabama!
Trust me! I know BBQ! Generous helpings, Good Honest People!!

text: Great food and service! 100% on food score!! Stakes are great and everything we have tired has been good. Friendly people!

name: MICHON MAIN
text: Excellent!  The lemon pepper wings that Eric and Yvette gave me complimentary to taste bc I love them were literally falling off the bone and I can say without hesitation that they were the best I've ever eaten ..I've eaten alot of them! The BBQ sandwiches with the tangy yellow BBQ sauce were comparrible to none...more than a meal!   We also went back and had a potato the next day at the recommendation of April at holiday shores...again not disappointed....and way more than a meal...if you have not tried it then I insist that you do ....you will be glad you did! Amazing food...reasonable prices...and more food than you can eat....if there were more stars They would get them all!  Thanks Lil' Smokey's..your rocking Dadeville with some fire food!   Killin it!

name: Danna Kanizai
text: My husband's family owns the business so I'm a bit biased but they have great boneless chicken and white sauce(and I don't really like white sauce). Ricky and the gang always strive for excellence and aim to make your meals memorable.

name: Robert Jones
text: JB's Butt House is the perfect stopping point if you are traveling south on 85. Not far from the first exit in Alabama, the 15 minutes to get there is worth the trip. Pulled pork, ribs, burnt ends, Brunswick stew and hand cut fries are the best! But save room for dessert because they have pecan pie, coconut pie and several other desserts that are to die for! What is even better, take some home and warm it up the next day. It tastes just like it did when you picked it up. You have to try it!

name: Kelly Meacham
text: Excellent BBQ! Variety of items on their menu as well as a Sunday special. Dine in, or take out. Friendly staff and good prices.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, glad you enjoyed it.

name: Clue Wyatt
text: Love the loaded baked potatoes

name: James Ivey
text: The best BBQ in the county if not the state of Alabama! My favorite are the brisket ends. They also have wonderful burgers, their fries are home cut and delicious and the sweet tea is perfect! Highly recommended!

Great friendly service.
Portions are HUGE! DELICIOUS!
home town friendly faces

name: Contessa M
text: The first is from scratch, even the desserts. It's what I would make if I had the time. The BBQ is amazing. But their daily specials are my favorite.

name: gary norrell
text: Pulled pork was good. Collards, Mac &cheese,potato salad was very good with collard rating a 10. Will definitely go back. Owners were super nice and hospitable. Recommend going there. Gary norrell - tallassee al.

resp.text: Thank you for coming in, i enjoyed talking with you about old Skinner days.

text: Good food, great service.

name: Thomas Daugherty
text: Best BBQ around!

name: Ellen Newell
text: Delicious

name: Eric Spratling
text: Finally tried this place and glad I did. Fries were crispy & tangy, pork was rich & generous, mac & cheese was creamy (made with gouda, which more restaurants should do). All for a reasonable price, considering how expensive BBQ usually is. The owners were also incredibly friendly, and not in a phony way you often get with restaurants. Hope I get the opportunity to cater something soon so we can hire Blue Line!

resp.text: Thank you, Eric! It was great meeting you yesterday, and we’re so happy you enjoyed your food!

name: Stephanie Langley
text:
This is by far one of the best food, friendliest and clean restaurants that we have found on google and stop to eat!!!
Such an honor support American heroes!!
They should consider bottling and selling their Bar B Que Sauce. It’s really great!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Stephanie! We’re so happy you enjoyed your food, and it was great getting to meet you today!

name: Leon Nunez
text:
Drove twenty five minutes to try this restaurant for lunch. Based on WEBSITE, OPEN and closing at 7pm.  Upon arrival, restaurant hours posted on door CATERING ONLY on Saturdays.  Why in the world do yo even have a website if such pertinent info such as YOUR HOURS OF OPERATION ARE INCORRECT!!!!!
REally upsetting!  Will not return

resp.text: I’m sorry you found the need to leave a one star review based on our hours of operation. Our normal to go hours are posted on the door.  Due to the staffing issues in area, we can not man to go and provide for committed catering jobs. Last weekend we were open Saturday, as we had no catering or events. My apologies that it did not get changed back on the website.

name: Brandy Kane
text: Enjoyed great food and great company tonight at a retirement party. Check them out you won't be disappointed!!

resp.text: Thank you, Brandy! It was wonderful to have you all, so glad you enjoyed your night!

name: Heather Long
text: Amazing food and wonderful people. Definitely a repeat customer!! So far nothing on the menu is a disappointment.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Heather! We appreciate it!

name: Houston Barnhill
text: Cubano is awesome. Love the fries.

resp.text: Thank you so much! Glad you enjoyed the food :)

name: Virginia Swift
text: We ordered food for rehearsal dinner and everything was delicious. Food arrived on time, the pork and chicken were moist. The potato salad and baked beans were the best I have had from any catering service that I have ever used. Thanks for making the wedding rehearsal dinner a success.

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate the business and the very kind words!

name: Donna Chandler
text: Mike was wonderful helping me line up our food for my son’s wedding rehearsal. He responded back to me very quickly when I had questions. The food was awesome and plenty of it. Highly recommend!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words. It was a pleasure serving you and providing the meal for your rehearsal!

name: CHUCK Chavis
text: Thank you Mike and family for a great birthday meal . ALL the food was delicious!! Hands down best steak I’ve ever had . My birthday cake was so yummy . I’m so thankful for your generosity to my family and I. If anyone is looking for a great place to go , this one is it . I promise you will never be disappointed . THANK YOU SO MUCH !

resp.text: Thank you! It was a pleasure serving you and your family, and we appreciate you choosing to spend your birthday meal with us!!

name: chad harrelson
text: Absolutely amazing experience! We rented a beach house with 20 other people and we were responsible for dinner one night of the week. I talked to Mike and told him what we were looking for. Everything was delivered to the house on time and the food was amazing. Total crowd pleaser! Would fully recommend this hidden gem!

resp.text: Chad, thanks for the kind words! Let us know in the future if we can be  of service. Stay safe.

name: Tyler Stephens
text: We had a large group vacation last month, and we all pitched in for catering. Turned out to be the best bbq we had ever eaten, and it fed our group of 30 for two days. They made everything so simple and all for a great price. Feeding that group for that many meals would have cost 5x what we paid. Highly recommended!

resp.text: Tyler, thank you so much for the review!

name: Weldon Tanner
text: We had food catered during a trip with a large group of people. Service was excellent, staff was friendly, and food was spot on. Absolutely fantastic BBQ, will 100% eat again next time I’m there

resp.text: Thanks so much! Give us a call next time you are in town!

name: Mallory Blakeslee
text: We had them cater when we came to gulf shores with a large group. They came and set up all the food. It was delish and very reasonably priced. We will always have them cater before we try to take a large group out to dinner.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: chuck chavis
text:
This company is a hidden gem. I really wish I could do more than just a 5 star rating. If you are looking for high quality taste and food, this is it. ...I could not recommend another company any higher. The owners have top of the line customers service. You cannot ask for more when the customer service and the food is 5 star.

I myself read reviews when in search of something. Please give this company a try. I promise your reviews will probably be just as strong as this one.

Thanks Mike for real quality food and the highest customer service!!

The shrimp taco bites were amazing. Even the seafood haters ate them,lol!

You will always be our first to go to for food and service!

name: cody belkoff
text: Phenomenal bbq food. We had them cater for a group of 20. The bbq was delicious. Would highly recommend them and will definitely be using them again when we go back to gulf shores to visit

resp.text: Thanks Cody! It was a pleasure cooking for your group!

name: Barbara Preston
text: Excellent food, excellent communication, prompt delivery and clean up, would definitely recommend.

resp.text: Thank you so much! It was a pleasure assisting you and your party.

name: Rebecca Shaw
text:
Not only is the food amazing but so is the customer service!
I have used Alabama Blue Line BBQ numerous times for private and company events and the food is always AMAZING! My favorite is the pulled pork, but the ribs are awesome, oh and the homemade sauce - it's all so very YUMMY!
Trust me you won't be disappointed!

name: Christina Adams
text: Wonderful experience! They catered my son’s bday party and the pulled pork was the best I’ve ever had! Quick response time and very friendly! All sauces and sides are homemade with perfection!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to post a review, and for the 5 stars! Your family was a pleasure to cook for!!

name: Constance Simion
text: The best of the best. And if there is something you want that nobody else does just talk to them and they will do their best to get it done, that's how now I have delicious smoked pork belly option 😋. If it's a meat and it fits the smoker they will smoke it 😋😋😋. And not to mention  the best custumer experience ever.

name: dora cherian
text: Delicious food!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: nicholas goble
text: Fantastic barbecue

name: Terry Butler
text: Sunday buffet is great! Usually they have a choice of 3 meats, often chicken tenders, as well as some country vegetables, usually fried okra, beans, mashed potatoes, and other options. They have a choice of cornbread, Mexican cornbread, or roll, and you can have tea or a soft drink. Desserts are often cobbler, cake, banana pudding or other pudding. You can also order off the menu. Very friendly and helpful family-run business.

name: Ashley Foster
text: Very friendly owners and wonderful food and service. If you are looking for great country food, this is the place to go. The grilled chicken plate is my favorite.

name: Blake Taylor
text: We are from North Carolina but were in the area for a wedding and were looking for a good place for lunch. We found this place on Google Maps and decided to try it out. The food was delicious and the staff was VERY friendly. Definitely recommend the Smother Fries and Banana Pudding! We love little country places like this and will definitely be back if we are ever in the area again.

name: Vickieq33 Darnell
text: We pick this for our group if 16 sight unseen.  It was great-service, food, banana pudding, friendly too.  Thanks.

name: Kathryn Tucker
text: The best bbq!  You have to try the banana pudding!  Homemade!!

name: MyTopflyer
text: Good food , good prices

name: Joshua Brooks
text: Good food. I reccomend the Jimbo sandwich!

name: Neil Phillips

name: Mandy Nall
text: I've been a loyal patron of Country's BBQ since they opened their door for business on Zelda Road. It's truly the BEST BBQ locally.  Everything on the menu is homemade.  They offer everything from the best variety picks of vegetables (sweet potato is the bomb and HUGE, fried okra, corn on the cob, great fried green tomatoes are so yummy, field peas, mashed potatoes, cabbage… all recommended). The Q stew, i.e.:Brunswick stew is a winner. ALL PORK AND BEEF platters, inside or outside chopped, served with 1 or 2 sides,  French bread or cornbread will fill you up with a to-go box for sure. The ribs fall off the bone,  and I truly recommend the chef salad.  All dressings are homemade. Price per person is about $10-14 for a full meal. Homemade lemonade and sweet tea are outstanding. Don't forget dessert.  The pecan pie and lemon pie are the best around. If you've got the time to wait, their steaks are excellent too. Chopped steak is my favorite, the fried chicken fingers are so crisp and tender. My kids love them. They cater too, and do a very good job. Try a nearby Country's,  you won't be disappointed,  I promise.

name: Jeremy English
text: Had the special, pulled pork plate. It was honestly great, sauce was pleasing and not too sweet. The sweet tea was outstanding, service was good, it wasn't crowded at all when I went. A little pricey at $13+, though.

name: Linda H
text: I am very impressed with the owner of this establishment. If for some reason you have any problem, he will immediately take care of it for you. I suppose any of us can have a less than favorable experience, anywhere, at any time. I know first hand that Mr. Powell appears to care that his customers have a favorable experience!

resp.text: Dear Linda H, I greatly apologize for your experience this weekend with Country's Barbecue. That is not how I want our customers to be dining on a holiday! Please call me at the corporate office so I can make it up to you. Sincerely, Mark Powell 271-2017

name: Cynthia P
text: Can't wrong with Country's BBQ.  I've never ordered anything I didn't enjoy.  They have a great club Sammy, a great (big) salad, great chopped pork, delicious sides and so much more!!  If you don't give them a try, you will be missing out on a great meal.

name: UnicornPoo OnU
text: This is the second time me and my girlfriend have eaten here. The first time it was ok but nothing to write home about and tonight made the first time seem like a great experience. She got the pulled pork sandwich and fries. The pork was tough and cold and the fries were cold and covered in grease. I got the Larry's Special which is supposed to be tenderloin marinated in special sauce, and fries. The meat came out just slightly warm and the fries were cold and covered in grease. When they refer to their special sauce, what the menu should say is that the meat has been swimming in Dale's Sauce for about a week and is almost too salty to eat. The waiter asked how the food was, which was obviously a formality because when I told him he acted as if I'd said the food was great and walked away. That's the last $30 this place will ever get out of me.

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, I am sorry you were less than happy with your recent experience at our Zelda Rd. location. Everyone can have a bad day and maybe you caught us on one of ours. Please call me at the corporate office (271-2017) so I can make it up to you. I hope you'll give us another try. Sincerely, Mark Powell - Owner

name: Brian Wilson
text: Loved our experience at Country's BBQ on Zelda Road in Montgomery!  Highly recommend to anyone for some of the best BBQ in the River Region.  Wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the food and the sauces were to DIE FOR!

text: Ordered to go at Zelda Rd. I give a 2 star only because the stew and the tea was good.  My fiance order was messed up she ordered Okra and got fries cold fries at that also we didn't get the bread with our order. We changed from the Atlanta Hwy location to Zelda Rd because ATL Hwy messed our order up big time with my whole family it took us months to eat at Country's again probably will just cook my own from now on seeing the one place that had it together when I was growing surely doesn't have it any more

name: Pamala Howell-Paoli
text: We were travelling through and looked on our phone to see what BBQ places were here. To my enthusiasm n surprise, Country's BBQ. I grew up in Columbus, Ga and go back from time to time. And EVERY TIME I do go back 1st place I stop is Country's. I LOVE Columbus Country BBQ and longed for it. About 3pm when we first walked in, the Mgr told us "to walk over there, grab a menu and seat where ever we wanted". There was 2 other couples in dining area. The waitress was outstanding!! I don't remember her name, but she was super bubblely. But we were so disappointed with the food. I ordered my usual; pulled pork platter. Husband ordered his usual; 1/2 chicken. Well the pork was drowned in chutney n coleslaw juices, which totally ruined the taste mainly b/c I don't like chutney. I used a numerous amount of napkins to dry up the juice. Husband's chicken looked liked it was cooked the day before or real early that morning. The BBQ sauce was dried and skin was wrinkled up and some spots were burnt. It was very dry. Husband informed waitress and she was very helpful and offered another one, fresher or something else. He ordered another chicken. The 2nd chicken was a more moist but didn't compare to the taste of Country's in Columbus. If Jim is affiliated with this establishment, he would be ashamed. Also, the Mgr had fixed a plate for herself and sat and ate. Not once did she come over to ask about why we sent it back.  How convenient it would've been since we travel through Montgomery often and it's closer than Columbus for us. Needless to say, we won't be coming back or if by some chance we do, we will hope to remember and not order the same thing.......

resp.text:
Dear Pamala,

I am so sorry to hear about your recent experience at our Zelda Road location. I am glad your waitress was wonderful, but I am disappointed to hear about your food experience. Thank you for bringing these issues to my attention so I can address them immediately. I would like to make it up to you! Please give me a call at the corporate office... 334-271-2017

Sincerely,
Mark Powell, Owner

name: Jim Davis
text: My wife and I have been stopping at Country's for over 25 years when traveling between Atlanta and Pensacola FL. The BBQ is excellent, sweet potatoes are hugh, the backfire slaw is tangy, and the fried green tomatoes are outstanding. We love this restaurant.

name: MARJORIE BAKER
text: Excellent, excellent barbecue, great brunswick stew, top notch chef salad and good southern sweet tea.  Would just ask them to work on appearance of restaurant, particularly the drive thru area.  Needs a bit of cleaning at the window, outside and inside.

name: Robert Smith
text: This was the first time we have eaten at (take out) Country's BBQ (night of 23 Feb 2015).  I am not sure if the staff was just busy at time of order or what.  While calling in the order the person taking the order seemed inpatient. We picked up the order 10 minutes later and noticed there was only one person dining in Country's BBQ, 4 staff in the kitchen and one or two staff in the dining area. About 4 orders were picked up while we waited 10 more minutes (added item to order) for our order. After getting home I realized my 1/2 and 1/2 order of fried pickles and onions was far from being fried.  In fact it was very clear they had gone straight from the container to my take out container. Not cooked what-so-ever. I was soo disappointed. Was really looking forward to trying the side dishes. Now I travel a lot and have been to great BBQ places across the US and outside the US and this is definetly not one of them. Anyone who says Country's BBQ is great has not had good BBQ. Aside from the poorly prepared side dishes the BBQ (chicken and beef) was just okay, definetly not worth mentioning. Being that the food was just okay at best there was no reason to call and complain as we would have only gotten more phone attitude.  Would not recommend this place.

resp.text:
Dear Robert,
Please allow us to apologize. We get a lot of good comments about our marinated barbecue onions. We have garnished our plates with these for 33 years. We only started frying these a short while ago. I have found the ticket for that evening and it is obvious that we filled the order with or regular marinated onions not fried… The order the chef got reflected barbecue onions and pickles, not fried or half-n-half. A simple miscommunication.  Please feel free to call the corporate office anytime you are not satisfied. 334-271-2017. I would be glad to forward you a replacement coupon or a refund. Thank you for taking the time to advise us.  Your business is sincerely appreciated.
Sincerely,
Mark Powell, Owner

name: Steve Kerden
text:
I was told about the OK Corral by a guy that works at the Microtel that I was staying at. He gave me the insider track on the local bar bq scene and said that his favorite is the OK Corral.

The OK is a non-discript little place that you can easily miss, it is set back off of Woodward Ave. and the sign is quite faded. There is no place to eat because it is a drive thru only.

Once you find the place you are going to be treated to some mighty fine fall off the bone ribs and to the most delicious chicken that you will ever wrap your lips around. Like the guy told me the way they smoke this chicken gets the subtle wood smoky delicate flavor into the meat. It was so good.

They also have a really great sweet cole slaw, and make some excellent sweet tea.

The OKC serves some really exceptionally delicious que and you will be mighty happy if you give it a try.

name: Brian Bannister
text:
This is my favorite place to eat in Alabama. I love the owners and the staff. They have always been first class and served delicious food. The food truck was my first
encounter with this business and I fell in love, not only with the food but the staff and ownership as well. The restaurant is just as good!! Do not hesitate to hit this spot up!!

name: Jackie Turman
text: The food is delicious!  I went on Taco Tuesday.  They have so many options to choose from.  I had the fried cauliflower one along with a southern belle that's chicken and bacon by the way.  I also had a fried shrimp taco which was taco of the day.  I loved each one.  I will be returning to try all of them eventually.  3 tacos and a side dish for a little over $10 bucks you can't beat that!  There are lots of other sandwiches and meals on the menu.  I recommend this spot to expand your taste buds. Great staff and great food! Brisket, Pulled Pork and mahi mahi here I come!

name: Jessica Yurkin
text: Food was delicious! Both vegan and non vegan options were so yummy. The staff was nice, good atmosphere, and food came out quick. Definitely recommend stopping here!

name: John Muhlhauser
text: The customer service is top notch.  Very accommodating! There tacos are Instagram worthy! They do a great job at maximizing the amount of food per taco ratio.  However I only give 4 stars, I felt like the food was a but bland. When I look at these amazing looking tacos I expected a burst of flavors, but they all just mashed together.  Other than that not a bad little place.

name: Jeri Remley
text: We loved this resturant! The food is great and the service was outstanding. As far as social distancing, they offer outdoor seating although no heaters for chilly evening. The tables inside are spaced appropriately and they leave the door open to allow fresh air to circulate. Try the brisket...so good👍

name: Hunter Holland Medders
text: We booked the Fire & Spice Food Truck for our wedding and it was a major success! We are STILL getting compliments from guests on how amazing the tacos were! Thomas and LeAndra are so cool and easy-going and rolled with all the punches when we had to postpone our wedding and move to a new venue. We always wanted a food truck at our wedding and Fire & Spice exceeded all expectations. The tacos came out quickly for all of our guests and no one left hungry! Seriously, one of our favorite parts of our wedding was having Fire & Spice there. If you’re considering booking them, we cannot recommend them enough!

name: Daymis Kimbrough
text: Best tacos in town!! The BBQ is pretty awesome too. You can't go wrong with this place if you like Tex- Mex.

name: Andrew Tykol
text: I used to live in Texas and grew to love Tex-Mex (especially Torchy's Tacos). Fire and Spice totally nails it and is the only place in the Huntsville/Madison area that offers Tex-Mex (try the southern bell taco). They have a large variety and I've never had anything I didn't love. They have amazing sides, try the poblano potato salad. Also, did I mention they have amazing BBQ as well? This place is truly amazing. One of my favorite restaurants in the area!

name: Andrew Tykol
text: I used to live in Texas and grew to love Tex-Mex (especially Torchy's Tacos). Fire and Spice totally nails it and is the only place in the Huntsville/Madison area that offers Tex-Mex (try the southern bell taco). They have a large variety and I've never had anything I didn't love. They have amazing sides, try the poblano potato salad. Also, did I mention they have amazing BBQ as well? This place is truly amazing. One of my favorite restaurants in the area!

name: Blake Malone
text: The place is a great concept. Clean and looks incredible. The food however was just ok. The pulled pork had no flavor. The brisket was decent. The sausage was ok. The chips and Queso tasted warmed up and store bought. The fries were very underwhelming. Solid concept , but for the food quality it is overpriced in my opinion.

name: Nathan Burley
text: Fire & Spice didn't disappoint. The mix of spice and flavors was amazing. I had one of my tacos with smoked sausage. Unbelievably good. My niece and nephew loved their meals, and they can be picky. This is the best taco I ve ever had in my life. The restaurant was warm, friendly, and they are following the Madison county covid mandates.

name: Joe Pierce
text: The best tex mex in the area, hands down. Get the Santa Fe taco, you won't regret it. Brisket is excellent also. This may be one of the best kept secrets in Huntsville but they deserve to be mentioned among the valley's best dining experiences, IMHO.

name: John Muhlhauser
text: The customer service is top notch.  Very accommodating! There tacos are Instagram worthy! They do a great job at maximizing the amount of food per taco ratio.  However I only give 4 stars, I felt like the food was a but bland. When I look at these amazing looking tacos I expected a burst of flavors, but they all just mashed together.  Other than that not a bad little place.

name: Brian Moore (Armyballer)
text:
Grab a seat, this gonna be a long one.  Born and raised in Texas, I know my Tex-Mex-BBQ. If I could give a 4.25 stars, I would.  Being my fist time there, I had the BBQ sampler with potato salad and ff as sides.The sides were perfect.  Flavor was off the chain and the amount given was more than enough, thankfully.  The sampler comes with brisket, pulled pork and sausage.  For the price, I could have used a bit more brisket and a lil less pork but I was completely full at the end of the meal, as I mentioned before the sides were ample.  The flavor was perfect, my only complaint was the brisket was a tad on the dry side, I know brisket is tough to get right fresh off the grill, much less hours or the next day.   I didn't get any desert, I asked where the pecan pie came from and was a lil disappointed to learn is was from Sam's rather freshly made, especially at $6.00 a slice.  My wife had the Southern Bell and Brisket tip Tacos and she said they were amazing.  To finish up, I'll definitely go back, the atmosphere was great and the staff was amazing.

UPDATE: I went back this past weekend and ordered just a brisket plate and it melted in my mouth.  Full of flavor to the last bite.

name: Amelia Hooper
text: Got takeout for my boyfriend and myself. He really liked his fish tacos. I was impressed by the vegan options! I ordered a vegan quesadilla and while it was good, it was painfully spicy. Like enough to make Fuego Takis cry. My boyfriend didn't like mine at all, but I handled it okay. Good food, but because the menu gave me no indication it would be so hot, I'll be very careful when ordering next time.

name: Woodard Family
text: This was good! I mean really really good. I'll definitely be back!

name: M K
text: Hands down a go too!! 🔥 You will not be disappointed. A must try 👌

name: Bret Griffin
text: One if the best bbq Tex-Mex places around. If you have'nt tried their food yet then you're missing out. Homemade margaritas with anything on the menu will make your day!

name: Laurie Holbert
text: Food is always fresh and amazing! You may have to wait a little but it's worth it.

name: Nick DiBiasi
text: Food was delicious! Don't let your appetite deceive you, there are items that ARE still hot, so be aware. Definitely a must return spot to try the various items on the menu. Happy hour is from 2p-5p, and drink specials are half off. The Russian Roulette taco is very hot! Try the Mac n' cheese, it's awesome.

name: Kendra Castillo
text:
Working with this establishment has been a total NIGHTMARE. I never leave bad reviews BUT our experience with these people for the past year working with them has been awful! We sat down and spoke with the owners Thomas and Leandra about catering our wedding. We had several encounters afterwards that we got “attitude “ from Leandra. When our wedding got cancelled due to Covid they weren’t originally able to accommodate the rescheduled date and told us that we wouldn’t get a refund. Afterwards they told us again that they could cater our new wedding date so we were relieved despite the several run ins and issues we had.
Well 25 days away from the wedding they asked that I call and go over wedding details and so I did. I had what seemed like a normal call as she explained procedure and I agreed to accommodate all requests including masking our guests and ect. Leandra said she would email over the contract to abide by their covid guidelines. Around 30 minutes after the phone call they emailed us stating that they would be backing out of our wedding.
I am absolutely disgusted by the customer service and integrity that this company has offered us.
We have been pleasant and have paid everything in full. Luckily they are refunding us but hey! 25 DAYS UNTIL OUR WEDDING.
There is a happy ending , we called Hops and Guac and they are more than happy and willing to accommodate our big day.

Horrible business, horrible service and I hate to give even a 1 star on this review because they don’t deserve it.

resp.text: What Kendra failed to mention is that we have never done business with her. She just copied and pasted the review from her friend Jordan. Thank you for bashing a local business because we made the decision to keep our employees safe rather than attend a wedding that will not be up to the health standards.

name: Ralph Cantrell
text:
I'm not sure I can do this place justice with my limited vocabulary and writing skills, but here goes:

This place is truly a Huntsville treasure. It is easily one of the most unique dining experiences in town. The menu is unlike any other, and EVERYTHING is good. This is not fast food, and it isn't priced as such,  but the value is definitely there and I think anyone who tries it will agree. It does come to you fast enough however, and it won't cost you an arm and a leg or anything, just don't expect average, low-rate mexican food prices as that is absolutely not what you will be getting.

The brussel sprouts are to die for. I already liked brussel sprouts, but I've never had any anywhere that are even close to theirs. I can't even begin to describe them, but take my word for it. Even if you think you hate brussel sprouts, you will probably love them. The soft tacos are big and they are lovingly put together and presented "gourmet-style" on a large, metal tray that is then covered with wax paper. They're not just slapped together all haphazard and plopped on a cheap plate like at everywhere else. You can mix and match them for a chance to try several different ones in a visit too. There are lots of different ones to choose from and they all are awesome, with like 6 or 7 different fresh ingredients each and then drizzled with unique spices and sauces. The different meats in each one are not ground or shredded into oblivion, but are thick pieces that need to be bitten into, which is good because you can better appreciate the exceptional taste and texture that comes from the extra care that went into cooking it.

There are also burritos, lots of different sandwiches, and even some more traditional items like BBQ and such. It takes a few minutes to study and understand the menu before you can know exactly which items will be perfect for you personally, but I'm pretty sure it will happen for most everyone just as it did for me.

Well, I tried. Thanks for the great dining experience, Fire & Spice!
f

name: Murad Abu
text:
It one of the best restaurants in town
I highly recommend this restaurant
The burger is so good and the owner and the staff is so friendly. All homemade
The chef is so professional
ما شاءالله

name: Nia Burns
text: Wonderful service, amazing food. We drive 40 minutes just for the food. Their menu is extensive and unique and they have alcoholic beverages along with Piper & Leaf tea products with specialties specially made for the store. Brunch server Saturdays and Sundays 10am-2pm with great, unique tex mex choices. Best tex mex in Northern Alabama.

name: Jordan Wenzel
text:
Working with this establishment has been a total NIGHTMARE. I never leave bad reviews BUT our experience with these people for the past year working with them has been awful! We sat down and spoke with the owners Thomas and Leandra about catering our wedding. We had several encounters afterwards that we got “attitude “ from Leandra. When our wedding got cancelled due to Covid they weren’t originally able to accommodate the rescheduled date and told us that we wouldn’t get a refund. Afterwards they told us again that they could cater our new wedding date so we were relieved despite the several run ins and issues we had.
Well 25 days away from the wedding they asked that I call and go over wedding details and so I did. I had what seemed like a normal call as she explained procedure and I agreed to accommodate all requests including masking our guests and ect. Leandra said she would email over the contract to abide by their covid guidelines. Around 30 minutes after the phone call they emailed us stating that they would be backing out of our wedding.
I am absolutely disgusted by the customer service and integrity that this company has offered us.
We have been pleasant and have paid everything in full. Luckily they are refunding us but hey! 25 DAYS UNTIL OUR WEDDING.

Horrible business, horrible service and I hate to give even a 1 star on this review because they don’t deserve it.

resp.text: What Jordan failed to mention is that the wedding party did not want to wear face masks and social distance during the wedding, because it would “ruin her pictures”, and that her solution was to have a box of face masks by the food truck if people wanted to wear one to order food. As a business we have the responsibility to make sure both our employees and customers are safe and we follow health orders. We did not feel safe working a wedding that does not care to follow the rules placed upon us, so we backed out of the wedding, sent them a list of potential replacements for caterers and refunded 100% of their money. We feel great about our decision to do so and this review along with all the other ones left proves our point.

name: kye grisham
text: Great Customer Service. I ordered through Grub Hub and the service from Grub Hub was horrible (Not the Restaurant). It was well over an hour and they had not assigned a driver for the order. I was not even aware until the Restaurant called me to let me know that Grub hub was taking too long and wanted to know if I would like to pick up the order or wait for Grub Hub. They were closing in 10 minutes. Although I placed the order an hour before they closed they said they would wait for me. I decided to either let Grub Hub get it or refund me. The restaurant called me 30 minutes later to let me know the driver had picked up the order and was on the way. The entire time Grub Hub would not assist. I finally talked to someone at Grub Hub and requested a refund but only if the Restaurant would not be taking the hit. I called the Restaurant and spoke with Leandra. This was after hours and well after they closed. She answered and was excellent to talk to. Even through it was not their fault she was concerned about the service I had received because of Grub Hub. Needless to say, the Food was excellent and the customer service and true concern from Leandra and the staff was overwhelming. Thank you.

name: Kevin Dover
text: Food was absolutely delicious!!! Probably the best tacos I’ve had in Huntsville.

name: Wendy Shuey
text: OMG OMG OMG best food  I have had since moving here  to Huntsville. I had the Burnin Love. I INHALED it! Literally you could not pry it from my hands. It was fantastic. Will definitely go here again ( often!!!) and definitely recommend for everyone to try it.  Thank you for delivering it to my work place. It was hot and delicious. TY TY TY

name: Tammara McLin
text: The food is always fresh and the service is amazing.

name: Shannon Christman
text: My Coworkers and I ordered from here for lunch and it blew us all away!! I have had tacos from the food truck when they were downtown Huntsville about two years ago so I knew it would be good. BUT today, the food was hot and fresh when it was delivered. I made a mistake on our order and called to fix it and they were fantastic about it!! I will definitely be coming more often and supporting this local business!! Thank you for all you are doing during this crazy time. It is VERY much appreciated!!

name: Tonya Baessler
text:
Appearance A+ however the Fiesta Chicken Bowl has been on the decline since I first ordered it two years ago. Not sure why I continue to get the same think knowing it's going to be a disappointment. The chicken taste like it came straight from a boiling pot, the entire bowl was watery. Really strange considering previous visits the meat actually tasted like it was smoked. It was also shredded, usually the fiesta bowl consists of chunks. As usual, nothing is ever as good as the first time right?!

THE OWNER OF THIS COMPANY needs to understand that the reviews are for the customers to REVIEW THEM! I was not late picking up my food, you are sadly mistaken. The quality of your food has gone down hill since you opened IN MY OPINION. I also stated that in recent visits, it was the same as well. You can see/read that with what other people are saying as well. You should respect the opinions of your customers instead of ALWAYS having some smart reply to everyone's review. I'm sorry but it doesn't look good on your part, and it's obviously a pattern.

resp.text: We apologize for your experience. With that being said, you were late by 45 minutes to pick up your order so yes, nothing will be great when it sits in the warmer for 45 minutes. Next time we would love to make it fresh for you, if you are running late all you have to do is call us and let us know and we can work with that.

name: kyle brown
text:
Nothing to write home about.

Atmosphere: This type of business sets itself up for a very fun and attention grabbing atmosphere(like you would see at taco mama or hops & guac) but they fail to do anything interesting with the space inside which makes it feel stale and awkward. There's random classic funk rock like old Zeppelin and cream playing very quietly as a backdrop to the one tv above the bar with a game on. It feels like the restaurant was decorated for something else and halfway through they gave up and turned it into a taco joint. Identity crisis.

Customer service: Not impressed. The cashier or server or whatever he was didn't seem to know much about the menu which is a pretty big deal when your making food as specific as this. They also give you a buzzer to let you know when the food is ready... Which is fine if I have to come get my food but if you're going to bring it to me anyways then what's the point of giving me a buzzer? Just seems like a pointless extra step. Once my food got to me I asked which taco was which because all 3 were very different and the server said he didn't know and walked off. That's unacceptable. I had to get up and look at the menu in the storefront again to remember which was which.

Drinks: My date and I each had a margarita. She had the special of the day and I had the catalina. They were both delicious but very alcohol light. They were also served in plastic cups which seemed cheap for a not so cheap drink. There is also the added inconvenience of having to order each drink individually and then get up in the middle of your meal, walk to the front of the store, and pay for your next drink. ??? That is a really bad business model for selling alcohol. As a restaurant your highest profit margin should be from your alcohol sales. You should make ordering alcoholic drinks as easy as possible to maximize your revenue and customer satisfaction.

Food: The food is quite possibly the most disappointing part of my experience. Not because it was bad, but because it was nothing. I ordered 3 tacos with chips and queso. I had the Russian Roulette, The Outlaw, and The Lonestar. Each pretty unique in their overly complicated design and odd amalgamation of ingredients that are essentially slopped into a flour tortilla in an effort to ensure I have the messiest taco eating experience of my life. There was so many different ingredients in these tacos that I was expecting to have a symphony of spicy flavors and aromas accompany these gorgeous tacos, but there were so many random ingredients on each one that just don't work together that I couldn't taste anything. So many flavors working against each other just for the sake of having more "artisanal" ingredients on your taco. I had 3 very different tacos and they all tasted the same... Like paprika sprinkled on cardboard. That may sound harsh but it's honestly the closest comparison I can make. You would also think that at a place that serves a cuisine known for its spiciness that I would expect to get a good kick in the mouth out of 3 of its spiciest tacos but I'll be honest.. I had hot wings from zaxby's last night that were far hotter.

Overall not the worst experience I've ever had but this seems like the type of place that trendy hipsters frequent so they can make instagram posts about "artisan" tacos and feel Californian for a day.

name: Josh Roberts
text: This great food truck finally found a fixed location. I had the special which was brisket burnt ends on a brioche bun with pickles and slaw. It was really really good, incredibly decadent well seasoned meat inside a pillowy buttery bun. I had chips and green salsa as the side. Everyone there was friendly and the restaurant was really clean. Highly recommended

name: Chris S
text:
It's always good! The Cattleman Bowl is great for takeout and even good the next day reheated. They put enough in it that you can definitely have it for lunch the next day.

Everything I've tried here has been pretty good. Tacos, burritos, and the brisket. And their staff seems to pretty helpful also!

name: Jennifer Champlin
text: Absolutly delicious local spot. After living in places like Phoenix and Sand Diego, I have snobbish standards for tacos. This place was amazing. It has a great variety of things fresh and inventive and unique.  It's a little unimpressive in the counter and bar area, but ignore that.

name: Rodney Danbery
text: I do not recommend this eatery! Customer service, worst I've ever experienced! Food so, so!

resp.text: Mr. Rodney, it is difficult for me to read this review you have written after our history we've had for so many years.  Honestly, at first I didn't believe this was you.  You, the man that would hang out our bar and talk motorcycle travels, family, and military.  Mr. Rodney, we'd spend plenty of time talking about food and our passions.  I'm saddened that you wouldn't recommend our eatery after eating here since we've been open.  You know us.  You know that if there was ever any issue with ANYTHING what so ever that I would want to hear about it straight from you, person to person, and you should know after ALL these years that I would make it right, to anyone, but especially to you.  Mr. Rodney, you know that our staff (my restaurant family) has been through hell this past year due to COVID.  We appreciate you and have always appreciated your support.  If you were trying to get my attention as an owner by writing a vague one star review, well you certainly got it.  But I ask you, as a long time patron and as a person I considered a friend, that you reconsider your review and speak to me in person about your experience.  From a veteran owned business, family owned business, to you a local veteran... at the very least, give me the opportunity to speak with you and try to fix whatever issue might have occurred tonight.  Afterwards if you still feel the exact same as you do now, you may write whatever review you'd like; but I would appreciate the opportunity to try.  I look forward to speaking with you soon, sir.  - LeAndra P. (Owner)

name: Shawker 71
text: Unfortunately I have not tried to many items from the menu yet. The one thing I do love that they have is the brussel sprouts. It sounds crazy but they are amazing.

name: Theresa McIlwain
text: WOW!  I just tried the Fire & Spice burrito with pork, and it was really incredible!  Just the right amount of heat, packed with meat and rice and beans....so delicious!!  Strongly urge you to try "the best mac and cheese" I have ever had, also!  A wonderful meal!!!  Thanks so much!

name: Justin Cousineau
text: Ordered the Hot Mess burrito with a side of queso fries to-go right before my car broke down right about 300 yards away in the street the restaurant faces. My car was literally a hot mess, but having their food to eat while I waited for some help made the whole situation better.

name: john shallenberger
text: Safe place to eat ! Great staff and food

name: Brian Moore (Armyballer)
text:
Grab a seat, this gonna be a long one.  Born and raised in Texas, I know my Tex-Mex-BBQ. If I could give a 4.25 stars, I would.  Being my fist time there, I had the BBQ sampler with potato salad and ff as sides.The sides were perfect.  Flavor was off the chain and the amount given was more than enough, thankfully.  The sampler comes with brisket, pulled pork and sausage.  For the price, I could have used a bit more brisket and a lil less pork but I was completely full at the end of the meal, as I mentioned before the sides were ample.  The flavor was perfect, my only complaint was the brisket was a tad on the dry side, I know brisket is tough to get right fresh off the grill, much less hours or the next day.   I didn't get any desert, I asked where the pecan pie came from and was a lil disappointed to learn is was from Sam's rather freshly made, especially at $6.00 a slice.  My wife had the Southern Bell and Brisket tip Tacos and she said they were amazing.  To finish up, I'll definitely go back, the atmosphere was great and the staff was amazing.

UPDATE: I went back this past weekend and ordered just a brisket plate and it melted in my mouth.  Full of flavor to the last bite.

name: Kathleen Myrick
text: Great experience!!! Good clean crisp eating!  Great service, very clean!  Had nachos and Fire and Spice burrito with adobe rice!  Lots of flavor and portions were proportinate to the price!  Is this a comeback to place? Heck yea!  Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!

name: William Rogers
text: Great place, friendly staff! Really appreciate the overly   employees that really went above and beyond.

name: Melissa Funkhouser
text: Great food and quick friendly service!

name: Daniel Rhodes
text: A coworker recommended Fire & Spice and I finally got a chance to try it. I wasn't disappointed the service was great and the food was amazing. I will definitely pass on the recommendation

name: Latoya Nance (Toya)
text: The food was good had never heard of this restaurant they had a variety of food to pick from had the honey barbecue chipotle next time I come may try the tacos

name: Chung-thuy Pham
text:
We tried the FS Burrito, fish taco, and the chorizo taco. Everything was so delicious, I love the brussels sprout side that we got too.

One thing I want to mention is their to-go packaging! Their packaging was very streamlined to minimalize waste, it definitely seems like they have put thought into this and I appreciate their solution. If possible, they should include an option in their online ordering to exclude plastic utensils as well

name: Matt McKechnie
text: Ordered food from DoorDash on a whim because we wanted to try something new. And this did not disappoint. I was completely amazed by the quality and flavor of the food and highly recommend. I'll be coming in to dine now also -- amazing; thank you.

name: Rick Nickel
text: Food was excellent and price was reasonable considering the amount of food. I will be back to try some of the other selections.

name: Tyler Parker
text: The most unique tacos around! The food hits the spot Everytime and the staff is extremely friendly!
