text: The food was good had never heard of this restaurant they had a variety of food to pick from had the honey barbecue chipotle next time I come may try the tacos

name: Jessica Spivey
text:
Please do not waste your time or money here! Sure, the food truck may be awesome but the restaurant is terrible! I waited 40 minutes for 4 tacos and a quesadilla and they only had two tables in the restaurant. There were 4 employees. I kept asking how much longer, and one girl said "I'm not sure, we got backed up and I realize you may be in a hurry but it'll be ready soon!" They desperately need to work on their customer service and staff. I can't imagine how long the wait would be if they actually had a full restaurant of customers! Its a good concept but I dont think they were ready for a full service restaurant or all that it entails. I won't be back!

Thomas, you are absolutely right! I was in your establishment as a door dash driver. Your employee advised me of your policy and I left and returned 10 minutes later with my insulated bag, per your policy. Upon arriving with the bag, I waited 35 minutes for the food to be ready. It took your employees a total of 45 minutes to make 4 tacos and a quesadilla. Your delivery driver left and returned and I was still waiting for the order. Another door dash driver came and left and I was still waiting for the order. A car side to go came and left and I was still waiting for my order. It became increasingly frustrating because while waiting for the order I was assigned to pick up, I was unable to be available for other orders. This one assignment took over an hour of my time and ultimately messed up the potential money I could have made because the service at your establishment is negligently noteworthy. If I was a paying customer I would be furious to wait an hour for over priced food and mediocore service. First impressions are everything and everyone that visits your restaurant is a potential paying customer. If my experience would have been different, dont you think I would have returned as a paying customer? I can understand why your employees are uneager to service patrons, as the owner has repeatedly rudely reacted to all negative reviews, this pattern, as another patron noted, is highly unprofessional! The restaurant business is not easy and making responses to negative reviews such as you have will not help your business. I'm so glad you contacted Door Dash so I had a chance to respond to your threatening Facebook message for me to take down my negative review.

Ladies and gentlemen, please be weary of writing negative reviews to this restaurant because the owner will threaten you privately. The time you took to look me up on Facebook and message me could have been spent training your employees to be more attentive to any person entering your establishment. I am appalled that a restaurant owner would conduct themselves in such an unprofessional manner. The right response would have been, "I'm sorry you had a bad experience, please let us know what we can do going forward for you to possibly return." However, your response solidifies the unprofessionalism and disregard for others opinions and ultimately their money. I wish you the best of luck, as you are going to need it to stay in business for the long haul.

resp.text: Jessica. Thank you for finally adjusting your review to reflect the truth. We apologize you feel like you waited so long but our longest wait time that night was 25 minutes. Our direct paying  customers have priority over any 3rd party deliveries, we did no such thing has threaten you on Facebook, merely asked for you to take down your fake review as a customer point of view. Now that you changed your review, it finally reflects your true point of view. I will always defend my business when I do not believe I was in the wrong. If this was such a bad issue last night, you should have asked for a manager instead of constantly complaining and raising your voice in our establishment.

name: Matt McKechnie
text: Ordered food from DoorDash on a whim because we wanted to try something new. And this did not disappoint. I was completely amazed by the quality and flavor of the food and highly recommend. I'll be coming in to dine now also -- amazing; thank you.

name: Chung-thuy Pham
text:
We tried the FS Burrito, fish taco, and the chorizo taco. Everything was so delicious, I love the brussels sprout side that we got too.

One thing I want to mention is their to-go packaging! Their packaging was very streamlined to minimalize waste, it definitely seems like they have put thought into this and I appreciate their solution. If possible, they should include an option in their online ordering to exclude plastic utensils as well

name: kenric smith
text: Loved the truck and love the physical location!  Their creations are amazing.  I will a frequent customer.  My only negative is they are a little pricey but overall, completely worth the price.

name: Tyler Parker
text: The most unique tacos around! The food hits the spot Everytime and the staff is extremely friendly!

name: Loves to Travel
text: This is not a Mexican Resteraunt and not a Bbq joint a better name for the place would be straight out of Austin.  Brisket was perfect and all ingredients very fresh.  I hope Huntsville is ready for them I will do my part!

name: Brady Doepke
text: Always a great place. Their items marked spicy aren't too spicy, except the Russian roulette. That taco deserves another pepper marker on the menu. But I do love it too.

name: Zach G
text: The food is okay but the experience leaves much to desire. Expensive menu for what you're getting. You can expect to spend close to $20 for a lunch with a drink (after tip). Also, this is one of those places that charge you for each soft drink you order. Luckily I ordered sweet tea (which was actually good) but my friend had $5 in charges for two Cokes when the bill arrived. We won't be going back.

name: Justin Greene
text: Tasty food!

name: William Moore
text: Everything I had was great. There green chile Mac and cheese is to die for

name: Weston Uptagrafft
text: Love having a local Tex Mex place in South Huntsville. We were hooked on their food truck and couldn't have been more stoked when they opened a brick and mortar location so close to us. Great specials that at to their variety. Chicken and waffles is awesome, Russian roulette, etc.. support local!!!

name: Jr Kelly
text: Highly recommend everyone try this place.

name: Neil Young
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful and the portions were very good for the price.  The atmosphere was very friendly and fun but the service was a bit slow on the food coming out.  If you are drinking and chatting it isn't bad but I wouldn't expect the food to hit the table fast. The drinks were good and had some good options and it was a really nice place to visit.  I'll definitely go back and see if things get better.

name: Marie McNew
text: The service and food are excellent!! The atmosphere is very chill, theres bar type seating as well as tables with both chairs and booth seating. They also have a really nice outdoor seating area that had a few small games the kids could use while we waited for our food. I'd definitely recommend to anyone who likes flavorful and spicy foods, yum! (They also serve alcoholic drinks and have a nice kids menu...great for the whole family!)

name: Matthew Henry
text: The food is really good. The spice isn't hot for the sake of being hot, but actually has a nice flavor (also, not very hot - you may want to add some spice.) I particularly appreciate the dedicated vegan section, and I'm looking forward to the weather cooling down because the patio looks really nice. Pay attention to the hours - they're not open on Mondays.

name: Katy Frees
text: Got it via Grubsouth tonight and the ETA was quicker than expected. The food was as good as ever (which is REALLY REALLY good) If you have not tried it, I’d recommend the Southern Belle taco or really anything else in the menu.

name: Messi Jessi
text: Get the BBQ brussels!! They are incredible! Their piper and leaf tea is delicious.

name: Wayne D Chappell Jr
text: My first time to eat dinner here was great!  All of my selections were fabulous and the service was great!

name: Marsha Atchley
text: The service was the worse I ever had. The waitress wanted us to wait to order because they did not have enough cooks and there was 8 of us. So all the people that came in after us got to order first. Does that make any sense?  That was 5 table before us, some got there order, paid and left before we even got to order. We were there over 2 hours for a tacos and burritos. Not good. Can't say I will ever be back. Way to pricey for what we got.

resp.text: Thank you for bringing these issues to our attention. It is too bad you told us everything was fine while you were here and talked to the owner directly. We could have fixed whatever the miscommunication was while in the restaurant.

name: shasta kimeo
text: Give them lots credit for original recipes.

name: James McKeen
text: I seriously can’t say enough good things about Fire & Spice!  I was briefly in Huntsville visiting family and working.  This place was just down the block, so I decided to check it out for lunch.  I got the smoked bologna sandwich and was totally blown away!  The meat was incredible, and the combination of their sweet slaw, their pimento cheese, and the mustard was the perfect complement to this hearty, comfort-food sandwich.  While complimenting the owners, they told me about some cool sounding tacos they make with fried chicken and pimento cheese, but they only make it as a special.  They are planning on adding it to their permanent menu but hadn’t done so yet.  I asked them if they would consider making it for me if I came back for lunch the next day, and they totally did!  It was fantastic!  These guys have a real gift for flavor.  And just when I thought they couldn’t be any cooler, they doubled down and made me their fried pickles as a side (also something they have only experimented with so far and wasn’t on the menu yet).  They make their own pickles, they are spicy and thinly sliced and perfect!  Since they are so thin, they fry up like chips and are mind-blowing good!  On top of all of this, they have many gluten free and vegan options.  So cool to have a place with options that my family members could eat and still serves food that I actually WANT to eat, as well!

name: CGL Phattimus_Prime
text: Had the southern Bell Taco today, the best taco I've ever eaten in my life started out with two ended up with three. And the service was excellent. I highly recommend coming here any chance you get for lunch or dinner.

name: Christopher Yates
text: The staff is always super friendly. And the food. The food is so good! 10/10 would recomend.

name: Haley 'Jonas'
text: This is a very great restaurant! The staff is absolutely amazing, they are super friendly! I’m obsessed with the fried pickles they make in house! I honestly can’t have enough of them!!

name: Heath Skelton
text: The food was pretty good, not outstanding, but quite overpriced. $14 for a pretty standard size burrito is pretty crazy, and while I enjoyed it, I can't imagine paying that much for it again. I don't think I will go back here. The appetizer we got (Fire and Spice Dip) was also fine but undersized for the price. The happy hour beer deals (50% off drafts) are good.

name: Lora King
text: Keep finding more and more on their menu that I like! (And I'm very sensitive to spicy food.) Rice bowls, good! Brisket, good! Kid meals, good (and cheap)! Seating is a little uncomfortable, especially for someone with shorter limbs. No free refills on sodas, but they come in glass bottles. Always clean and good service each time.

name: Chuck Graham
text: The tacos were outstanding. Santa Fe was incredible,  Southern Belle was scrumptious, and Texan was excellent. A most enjoyable dinner! And the service was pretty good too!

name: blondo4620
text: Wow! Delicious food and really nice staff.

name: Robert Culver
text: Love the Rattler.  Food is good.  People are nice.  Strange you can only order a bloody Mary on Sunday!

name: Curtis Lindsay
text: Best brisket in town — light years beyond some chains we could mention — and both the macaroni & cheese and the brussels sprouts were out of this world.

name: James Ian Dunn
text: The food selection was awesome. Quality was top notch. Good beer selection too.

name: Aurora Yancey
text: Can I say WOW?!? What an awesome gym for South Huntsville!! If you haven't been here then treat yourself to what you deserve. This is a very unique place that supports a great experience.

name: ashley lowder
text: This is easily one of the best places to eat in South Huntsville. It's clean, the staff are friendly, the owner is great to talk with, and the food is incredible! I'm from the southwest and have been searching for a place that I can call "good". This place is great! Go try it!

name: Chuck Graham
text: The tacos were outstanding. Santa Fe was incredible,  Southern Belle was scrumptious, and Texan was excellent. A most enjoyable dinner! And the service was pretty good too!

name: Chris Alan
text: Friendly staff. Great help with the menu. The Rattler burrito was awesome. Little spicy, but not too hot. Was there for a business lunch, but I will definitely be bringing my family back.

name: Robert Culver
text: Love the Rattler.  Food is good.  People are nice.  Strange you can only order a bloody Mary on Sunday!

name: Curtis Lindsay
text: Best brisket in town — light years beyond some chains we could mention — and both the macaroni & cheese and the brussels sprouts were out of this world.

name: Aurora Yancey
text: Can I say WOW?!? What an awesome gym for South Huntsville!! If you haven't been here then treat yourself to what you deserve. This is a very unique place that supports a great experience.

name: James Ian Dunn
text: The food selection was awesome. Quality was top notch. Good beer selection too.

name: jett West
text: This was a special surprise.  Awesome food! Service was great they were so nice and polite.  Such a great experience.  We are taking food to go it is so good. I can't say enough about this place. Now the Russian Roulette is hot as hell.  They tell you it is but I have heard that before.  They are telling you the truth but so flavorful. The Lone Star was very good.  Brisket was tasty

name: Natasha Baker
text: Nice and clean restaurant. The aroma that hits you when you walk in is incredible. The owners are super nice and the mac & cheese and poblano potato salad are delicious!

name: James Kemp
text: The brisket is off the chain!!!! Everything was awesome!!!! Will be back for sure!!!

name: Shauna Riden
text: Great food! Fast and friendly! Phoned in our office lunch today and it was ready in about 15 mins. Highly recomend Fire and Spice!

name: Lauren Ruffner
text: One of my favorite places!!! I take everyone I know here!! I love that they have vegan options for myself. Taco Tuesday is really cool too, you can mix and match any 3 tacos for a discounted amount!! I love the staff and crew that works here they are always friendly and nice!! I HIGHLY recommend trying it! I personally walk around with to go menus to let my friends know to go try it out!!

name: Rachel Hawke
text:
I love their food! They do deliver which is nice (although I don't live in the delivery zone anymore 😭) Since we live in Madison and their storefront is in South Huntsville going there is quite a trek. Some pilgrimages are worth it. Fire and Spice offers a unique twist on TexMex and I love a good twist. A new perspective on comforting flavors.

The serving sizes are definitely large and can rarely finish in one sitting. Same with my Husband. Definitely get your money's worth.

UPDATE 3/30/21: This was my first visit since COVID and this place is still amazing! I have not eaten anything I don’t like. The staff was friendly and everyone was practicing safety precautions. I felt comfortable eating on their patio.

name: Chantaine Rhoe-Bulluck
text: Awesome inspired food menu, great prices and   welcoming staff

name: Nick Vaughan
text: I loved the food truck so naturally the restaurant should be just as good if not better right? Wrong! There is no reason this place needs servers first of all. Second the quality of food send to have taken a significant dip upon transitioning to brick and mortar. Lastly the burrito had a "squeaky" chicken texture. We will not be going back.

name: Jon Brown
text: Very good, unique flavors! Excellent service. The smoked bologna is delicious!

name: Alex Patterson
text: Great food and kind employees!

name: Scott Moss
text: Let me start out by saying I admire anyone who has the gumption to make a go at running a restaurant. Maybe I am just an old man who likes the chain burritos. I ordered the fire and spice chicken burrito, wife ordered a taco (brisket). My wife thought the brisket was delicious. I would say the burrito was not as good as Chipotle  or even Moes. Just my opinion, not that good for the money. It took us almost an hour to get our food, it was busy not crazy. The restaurant appeared very understaffed, I felt for the waitress.

name: Kandi Nichols
text: The staff was awesome: friendly and attentive. The food was fresh and cooked well. A healthy alternative. The prices are higher than I expected: about $30 for two to eat there. We have leftovers for another meal, but overall I do not think I'd go back again. We were disappointed with the food: we expected higher quality at that price.

name: Adam B
text: Got the brisket and egg burrito off the brunch menu was it was Delicious! The salsa was good. Maybe a bit pricey but high quality food.

name: S T
text:
BEST BRISKET IN TOWN! HIGHLY RECOMMEND
Small but cozy clean well maintained atmosphere. Staff very friendly and prompt. No waiting on a Friday night! The brisket platter was exceptional! Very fresh, juicy, flavorful, and fork-tender with just the right amount of marbling. Entrees come with Texas Toast and two sides. If you like BBQ style Fried Okra, Charro beans, guac, and potato salad then you're in for a real treat. They are amazing! Customers would be better served with fountain drinks/refills instead of bottles. But its a small inconvenience considering the great BBQ quality. Unfortunately, ribs are not on the menu.  Entree prices range from $14-$18. Definitely looking forward to our next visit hungry for more.

name: Jon Fox
text: Large portions of spicy, smokey Tex Mex with a scrappy food truck heritage. Great vegan options. Go here and eat happy. Casual dining. Prepare to be messy and satisfied.

name: Troy Dunning
text: First time in the restaurant. The Rodeo brisket burrito was decent (too much pinto beans for me), service was good, and the place was clean. Looking forward to trying more from the menu.

name: Chris Hall
text: Excellent selection of interesting tacos, many of which feature house-made bbq. I found the brisket and pulled pork to be excellent, and the fried chicken taco is awesome as well. They also have a selection of beers on tap as well as cans and bottles. I really wish they had a soda fountain, and the price is slightly steep, but the food is quite good.

name: Matthew Jaeger
text: Great brisket and salsa verde! You've gotta try it!

name: Desiree Gaiser
text: Lovely service, great selection for all tastes. Had a good time!

name: allen H
text: Absolute melt in your mouth Brisket, my wife and I will return and bring friends.

name: Taylor H
text: Disaster service, over priced food, SLOWWWWW with an empty store, but it does have good flavor. Skip this place, there are plenty of other taco joints much better.

resp.text: Thank you for brining this issue to our attention. Next time you have an issue, regardless of where it is, you should probably ask to speak with someone in charge so we can help take care of the problem at its sources.

name: John Madderra
text: Barbecue brussels sprouts rock!

name: Justin Williams
text:
Great food and friendly staff!

The a la carte menu is a great change. You can pick your own mix for lunch or dinner and get exactly what you want. The Russian Roulette is excellent with pork. It's hot, but the flavors come through without being overpowered by the heat.

Thanks for another delicious meal. Fire and Spice is one of my top three favorite places to dine.

name: Dan De Jong
text: The staff was phenomenal. Even so much as to help me decorate my wife's birthday cupcakes that the store didn't have time to. I would recommend Fire & Spice to anyone looking for a great meal and friendly staff.

name: allen H
text: Absolute melt in your mouth Brisket, my wife and I will return and bring friends.

name: Madison Bowersox
text: The flavors were there but serving warm food in a cold metal bowl therefore makes it colder. The food from the truck is definitely better temperature wise. They don't really have a true mild option for others that have issues with the spice, but the food over all is great and their cilantro salsa is WONDERFUL and not at all spicy. I could definitely find a cheaper texmex restaurant  elsewhere and be hotter food temperature wise, but the food from the truck is definitely on point!

name: Justin Williams
text:
Great food and friendly staff!

The a la carte menu is a great change. You can pick your own mix for lunch or dinner and get exactly what you want. The Russian Roulette is excellent with pork. It's hot, but the flavors come through without being overpowered by the heat.

Thanks for another delicious meal. Fire and Spice is one of my top three favorite places to dine.

name: John Madderra
text: Barbecue brussels sprouts rock!

name: Moose Trust
text: Good food but bring back the salads!

name: Dean Cooper
text: Very tasty tacos 🌮!!

name: Philip Busk
text: Excellent. I had the Lone Star tacos and thought the flavors were wonderful; just the right amount of spicy. Friendly, clean, fast. They took the time to make sure we were enjoying our meal.

name: Matthew Jaeger
text: Great brisket and salsa verde! You've gotta try it!

name: Michael Morris
text: Have eaten here a number of times and staff is always friendly.  Food has been very good and is a good serving size.  Really like the green salsa service with chips.  Love the tacos.  Good selection of local beers.

name: Randy Bafford
text: Great service and really good food also really clean thanks for everything

name: Philip Busk
text: Excellent. I had the Lone Star tacos and thought the flavors were wonderful; just the right amount of spicy. Friendly, clean, fast. They took the time to make sure we were enjoying our meal.

name: Shelly Tanner
text: I have been wanting to try this place forever....my new Chiropractor is two doors down from them. So today went in ordered a Longhorn salad(I'm gluten free) I was surprised at the bowl being smaller, with mainly spring Lettuce mix, the brisket 🤔 was dry (sigh, dry brisket)  I'm talking a spinkle of cheese. It was $10.20 with tax. I would post a picture but it's not giving the option.

resp.text: I’m sorry that your salad was disappointing. Our salad bowls are industry standard 32oz bowls filled with 6 oz of brisket along with other fillings. Our brisket salad does not come with typical cheese, it’s just a dusting of cotija. With that being said we would be more than happy to take care of you next time you come in. Being gluten free is not an issue here as we serve corn tortillas and corn tortilla chips along with many other gluten free items that are not salads. Hope you gives us another try and ask for the owner next time you are in.

name: Jolene Dean
text: Good grub.. But be prepared for indigestion!   It was worth it.  Took a star away because the fried pickles had so little pickle, they tasted like deep fried batter.

name: Stephen R
text:
The food and atmosphere here is great. Love the vegan options, especially the quesadilla, lots of flavor

One star off because sometimes getting food or ordering to go takes a while. Worth the hassle but would love to have speedier too

name: Michael Morris
text: Have eaten here a number of times and staff is always friendly.  Food has been very good and is a good serving size.  Really like the green salsa service with chips.  Love the tacos.  Good selection of local beers.

name: Will Payne
text: The fish tacos, aka Finding Nemo, are delicious. Spicy slaw is so good on these tacos! Clean restaurant. Friendly and fast service. HIGHLY recommend this place. There food truck is on point, too.

name: Moose Trust
text: Good food but bring back the salads!

name: Cary Long
text: Very good BBQ. The BBQ Brussels work great. Had bacon and BBQ sauce on them. We will be back.

name: Ashley Marlar
text: Went to Fire and Spice for the first time tonight. Service was super fast, and staff were very friendly. Among our group we ordered tacos, a burrito, brisket plate, and pulled pork plate. Everything was very good and tasted fresh. Don't miss out on the cheesecake chimichanga! We plan to go back soon and try their brunch menu.

name: Kris Kasprzak
text: I thought the food here was very good. Daughter ordered the smoked brisket and it was unbelievable. I would definitely go back and recommend this place.

name: Amy Clemente
text: Service and food on point.  Great place for some awesome mexican food.  Burritos and nachos were on point.

name: k wohl
text: Yesterday my wife and I had the Texan (3 pulled pork tacos) and a side of adobo rice.  The tacos came with chips and salsa and were delicious, as was the rice.  The restaurant was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  I had been there last week and had a Rodeo burrito for carryout, and it was also delicious.  We will be back.

name: Shae Reeves
text: Great food but they did mess my order up. Also I called in my order and they said 10-15 min. I went there 25 minutes later and my food was still not ready

name: Penny Wetterer
text: Best part was the waitress was friendly. The chicken was very dry and no flavor. Brisket had no smoke flavor. Pulled pork was greasy and had no taste other than the grease. Kids were not a fan of the small selection of soda, since there was no fountain drinks. The soda bottle drinks are 2.50 per bottle.

name: Jeremy Childers
text: While it took a while to get our food(they were busy), the food was delicious and the service was friendly.  I had several tacos, one of which had texas brisket on it.  It was the best taco I have ever had and I have visited Mexico, southern cali and lived in Texas.

name: George Olden
text: Great food and drinks. There is a decent beer selection for such a small place.  I recommend trying the brisket or anything with the chorizo.  Also, they are willing to kick the spice level up and add habeneros to your dish.

name: christian collins
text:
So let me say today i have literally had my standard of mac and cheese raised dramatically.
Over time I've tried this locations food and for price it is solid but what will always keep me coming back is the flavor on any item on their menu.
Every thing tastes like there is true care when preparing these dishes and it impresses me everytime i get the privilege to eat there.

name: Briana Garrison
text: Excellent Texas and Mexican fusion. NOT TEX-MEX.

name: Jason Wiersma (Karmicbrutality)
text: Amazing Food and Great People, they turn it up to 11. Five stars is not nearly enough.

name: Nathan Childers
text: Great place to try, you won’t be disappointed. The staff is super friendly, the restaurant is very clean and most importantly the food is fantastic. My favorite thing I order is the brisket sandwich add house made pickles. This is the best sandwich I have ever had.

name: Lane Martin
text: Good food with a nice twist. Great service.

name: Jason Wiersma (Karmicbrutality)
text: Amazing Food and Great People, they turn it up to 11. Five stars is not nearly enough.

name: Anne Flatcher
text: I witnessed the manager yelling at a crew member and that’s just so disrespectful and totally ruined me and my daughters lunch. Food was decent but too expensive.

resp.text: This matter has been taken very seriously, as of tonight that team member was let go because of that accident. Thank you for brining it to our attention and we will thrive to do better

name: April Scott
text: Love this place! The food is delicious!!

name: Linda Powell
text: Sarah is awesome and friendly. Ordered lamb tacos and their side of mac & cheese.  A little overcooked on the lamb, but they were still delicious. The mac & cheese, was to die for.

name: Christy Olszewski
text: Food was awesome! Environment was fun! I love how fresh everything tasted!! It was our first time & we will definitely be going back!

name: Amy Kibbey
text: My fiesta chicken rice bowl was great!  It had just the right amount of heat.  The menu has a wide variety of choices.  I want to go back and try other things.

name: Ian Kinner
text: The food here is incredibly good. The custom piper and leaf tea was amazing. I'm glad we got an awesome new place in South Huntsville!

name: Angela Grant
text: Pineapple Jalepeno Margarita!!! Delicious!!! The brisket is soooo tender!!!

name: josh whisenant
text: food was really good, but was on the high side 4.50 for a 6" taco is kinda steep

name: Nathan Childers
text: Great place to try, you won’t be disappointed. The staff is super friendly, the restaurant is very clean and most importantly the food is fantastic. My favorite thing I order is the brisket sandwich add house made pickles. This is the best sandwich I have ever had.

name: Jason Zarrilli
text: Went in for take out and was very impressed. Location is clean and the staff was very accommodating. Provided guidance for a first time customer. Food was fantastic and packed very well for take out. Looking forward to my next visit.

name: William Dodd
text: The food is always really good. Not as good as the food truck, but still good. I had the southern belle, original gangsta, and mahi tacos this last visit.

name: Andrew Judge
text: Fantastic food and excellent service! Muy caliente!

name: Jennifer Taylor
text: Amazing restaurant and staff!

name: The Life
text: Fast service

name: Kristi Kendall
text: Great food and super fast service. They are happy to accommodate my weird requests and always pay special attention to ingredients for me! Food is always fresh and perfect!

name: Markie Leigh
text: Great food, great service!

name: Miranda Kennedy
text:
over 60 bucks and the food is nasty the mac and cheese is done in the microwave .
We will never be back

resp.text: Thank you for the kind comment and supporting local during these times. Just a heads up, we do not have a microwave anywhere on premises, but we appreciate the kind words

name: Michael D'Auben
text: Fast friendly service and the food was amazing.  I can't wait to go back again.

name: laurie wright
text: Really good food but portions are too small for the price you pay

resp.text: Our apologies for the small portion served. If there was an issue we would have loved to take care of it at that moment. We hope that you gives us another try at a later date

name: Andrew Taylor
text: Huntsville has a lot of great food, but Fire & Spice stands out. The food is delicious and unique with good combinations of great ingredients. Tonight I got the pulled pork sandwich. Most have ok meat, slathered with sauce because it has no flavor, and thrown on a cheap bun. Not Fire & Spice! Their meat tastes great, mixed with slaw to give it a great crunch, on top of perfect Texas toast. I had a side of poblano potato salad (which isn't ruined with relish!) and a dessert of their amazing pecan pie topped with ice cream. And the presentation of each fish was amazing. Are you hungry yet? I can't wait to go back.

name: Jennifer Taylor
text: Amazing restaurant and staff!

name: Bradley Dean
text: I’ve enjoyed everything I’ve ordered there. I’m a big fan of spicy food. Awesome success story from food truck to a restaurant location.

name: Markie Leigh
text: Great food, great service!

name: Ray Toth
text: As usual, excellent food.  If you like their food truck then you need to get to their location on South Parkway.  Not one thing in the menu that hasn't been fantastic so far!

name: Chris Turner
text: Fresh, fast and delicious. The sides are very good as well. New vegan menu and BBQ. Good local craft  beer selection. If you want delicious fresh Tex-Mex, this is your place.

name: Calvin Fox
text: I ordered the 256 nachos with no guacamole or cilantro, and the staff gave me the salsa in a little cup so I could choose whether or not I wanted it (Because it had cilantro). The food was delicious and the staff was thoughtful.

name: VBCMEDIC
text: Great place, great staff and delicious food!!!

name: William Kaukler
text: Got signature fire and spice burrito and while good, not hot nor spicy. Had to add sirracha for each bite. Ingredients suggest spicy but those were lacking but lots of meat and rice. Came for heat because of name.

name: Thomas Roberson
text: Terrible service. They had advertised 3 tacos and a side for 10 dollars and when I tried to order they wouldn’t let me order that and my bill for 3 tacos and a side was about 20 dollars. Worst service ever. False advertisement and overall bad experience.

resp.text: Our apologies. If you came on any other day but a taco Tuesday then the deal does not apply. With that being said the service was an issue lately and the cause of that was removed. We will do better job next time. And for that you can get a free meal on us next time you are in. And you will be taken care of by an owner personally

name: William Kaukler
text: Got signature fire and spice burrito and while good, not hot nor spicy. Had to add sirracha for each bite. Ingredients suggest spicy but those were lacking but lots of meat and rice. Came for heat because of name.

name: Ray Toth
text: As usual, excellent food.  If you like their food truck then you need to get to their location on South Parkway.  Not one thing in the menu that hasn't been fantastic so far!

name: Bradley Garrison
text: Love this place. Good atmosphere, and great food!

name: Jenna Dow
text: Great vegan menu :)

name: willyb
text: Taco Tuesday.  Three different tacos $10.  Great selection. I am a fish taco guy but the brisket is so good.  You need to try it!

name: Virginia Esslinger
text: Best BRISKET in town

name: Courtney Parker
text: We couldn't decide where to eat, so we kept driving and seen this restaurant. We gave it a try and it was awesome. Staff was friendly and helped us. We will definitely be back!

name: Katie Davis
text: Really yummy. I got the fire and spice burrito with smoked chicken. Perfect amount of spice. Husband got lone star tacos and the brisket was delicious. Will def go back.

name: Tonya Johnson (Sunshine)
text: The food ias always, fantastic, however don't expect it to be like the food truck.  At the restaurant everything is all a cart.

name: Willis Mayo
text: Good food, quality service. Friendly staff

name: Kelsey T
text: Oh man this place is a gem! We first ate here when their food truck was down at the park and then went to the actual restaurant. It was wonderful! We will be back!

name: Randall Birdsong
text: I have had the pleasure of eating here 3 times now. Love everything. You should come for taco Tuesday. Food is great. Freindly people.

name: Corrina Griffith
text: Always great food and service!

name: Canice Turck McGovern
text: Good food. Music was too loud

name: kt ktg
text: omg the food sooooooooooo good

name: Dennis Weldy
text:
They were 25 mins from closing and asked if we could get it to go. We decided to leave and go to Rosie's cantina which stayed open longer and even let us stay while they were closed and cleaning up.

The young lady we spoke to while waiting for our friends was very friendly. We'll give them another try at some point.

name: David House
text: Amazing food, amazing people!   Fire and spice give incredible attention to all their products, the quality and originality are certainly a welcome addition to South Huntsville. You have to try the Sicario pepper sauce!

name: Chris Hunt
text: See picture, ordered the "Texas sampler plate"

name: Robyn Vicuna
text: This is one of my favorite restaurants.  Lauryn is amazing.  Everyone there is Awesome! Love it!!!

name: Bruce Woody
text: Really awesome! Will definitely be coming back.

name: russell lane
text: Expensive for lunch, and it took an unusually long amount of time to get our food (only 4 customers there at the time). When the food (brisket plate) finally did get there it was ok.

name: Maurice Weems
text: great food great service

name: Chris Lindsey
text: First time visiting the brick and mortar version.  I've eaten at the food truck during the food truck rallies in downtown Huntsville.  This time I got the Lone Star Taco which is smoked brisket, hot sauce, cheese, spicy slaw, onions, jalapenos, bacon, cotija, and creamy bna sauce.  And the Finding Nemo Taco which is blackened MahiMahi, hot sauce, spicy slaw, onions, sour cream, cilantro, and line wedge.  These were great.  I have tried different items and they all have been great.  When talking with my waitress, she suggested that next time that I try the Southern Belle Taco which is fried Chicken, pimento cheese, bacon, jalapeno jelly, green onions, and chipotle sauce

name: Matthew Stewart
text: Fantastic restaurant, incredible food, amazing atmosphere aaaaaaaand while much of other compliments. If you want a good place to eat don't hesitate to give then a try.

name: Devin Posey
text: Great food and great staff.

name: Tyler Lynn
text: Great food and better people, and the drink selection is amazing.

name: Amber Montgomery
text: Always amazing flavorful food and friendly staff.

name: Geoff McElroy
text: It was really good and yummy. Give it a try and I bet you will like it too.

name: Matthew “Matt S”
text: Try their brisket on tacos. I assume it's just as amazing on a burrito or salad or the plate. Now they have margarita's also. If only they had some special deals on a pitcher of margarita.

name: Dan Quinn
text: The pulled pork tasted like it had been taken out of the fridge and reheated in the microwave.

resp.text: I’m sorry to hear about your experience in our restaurant. I can assure you that our pulled pork is smoked overnight daily. We also do not have microwaves in our restaurant.

name: Robert D.
text: Over priced. Does not have 2 meat plates like the Chuck Wagon. I got almost totally fat brisket and paid a over 20 dollars for a 2 meat plate.I will not go back. Get me 2 times but not a third. The Charro beans are way off on flavor. The brisket had no flavor other than oven and fat. I like Chuck Wagon much better.

name: James Johnson
text: Good food and flavor

name: Dave Kwit
text: Nice place for a quick bite to eat.  Dining area is very compact, and not really designed for a large group.

name: AuthenTech - Ben Schmanke
text: Actually quite delicious, I'd recommend checking it out

name: Gideon Ochako
text: Friendly staff, good food selection. If you love spicy food this is the place for you.

name: Megan Caudle
text: I thought the food was really good. Nice smoked flavor. Also the cheesecake chimichanga dessert is amazing! We need more places like this on southside. I hope it makes it.

name: Sara Coble
text: Good food, great service.

name: Clint Camealy
text: We love Fire and Spice!  It’s  becoming a Sunday tradition.  My favorite is the brisket, fried okra and chitpotle ranch.  However, y’all need a white sauce!

name: Rose King
text: Kinda expensive for the food. Queso not the best.

name: kris kepley
text: waaay too expensive for what you are getting - Taco Mama gives you the same meal for 9 dollars vs 13 ... and taco moma is arguably better.

name: Lindsey White
text: Absolutely outstanding! The bbq Mexican fusion is very interesting and satisfying. And I am crazy about the brunch!

name: Joe Heiman (MixDJ1)
text: Everything I've ever had there is amazing! My favorite is Deadpool's Chimichanga! Yum! To top it all off the staff are super friendly!

name: Obed Blas
text: The manager was very friendly and, I had some chicken nachos that where very well made. I would visit again soon.

name: Benjamin Luthy
text: Some of the best food in Huntsville!  Go check out their shop and also the food truck!  They have the schedule posted on their Facebook page!

name: Emily Zickefoose
text: Everything we've eaten here has been fantastic, but tonight we had vegan options & they are phenomenal! I had the piñata quesadilla & my husband had the 256 nachos. The piñata quesadilla is my new favorite here. My husband's nachos were also tasty & it was a ton of food. We'll be back to try more of the vegan options.

name: Jason Johnson
text: Always fresh and fantastic. Work checking out multiple times

name: Sara Walker
text: Awesome food and awesome service :) will deffinetly be going back to try everything on the menu!

name: Adam Landingham
text: Terrific tacos and queso. Can't wait until they have beer.

name: George Burruss
text: Very friendly staff, but food that left me wanting something else. The burritos are ginomous which makes up for them being so pricey. However I can get a better burrito elsewhere for less than $5.

name: Matthew Damuth
text: Love this place!  Food is amazing, service is great.

name: Dan Merenda
text: Great food. I've loved every meal I've had both at the truck and now in the restaurant.

name: Jonathan Hurd
text: Lone Star Brisket Tacos are amazing. The customer service is out of this world!!!

name: James Kemp
text: The brisket is off the chain!!!! Everything was awesome!!!! Will be back for sure!!!

name: Esra Árnason
text: Good options for vegans! Margaritas are delicious as well!

name: damonotdavid
text: Excellent casual spot for spicy mex and Smokey tex food. Not a whole lot of bbq choices, but the mex food is tantalizingly fiery and very delicious! Perfect place for heat lovers, just don't expect top spot bbq. Great salsa, not so many drink choices.

name: Christine Gordon
text: Great food, friendly staff

name: Tamy Joseph
text:
I drove all the way from meridianville to south parkway to see what this place way about. I’ve always seen them down my IG timeline (_tourdefat) , and i was like man I’ve gotta try them on my cheat day one day. Low & behold i don’t  regret driving down to this restaurant.
First the service is great, AND the place doesn’t smell weird like most restaurants. I got a great 2 in one with this restaurant.
Secondly, the menu is so nice and simple PLUS the food is actually good and flavorful.
Pictured here i have the fiesta chicken bowl. This is better than moes, chipotle, qudoba (for anyone from up north), this thing is so delicious and hefty. Usually I have a mans appetite and can eat something like this in one sitting but not this time! Worth the drive, money, & time!
Definitely visit here, so worth it!

name: Kyle Schroeder
text: Awesome Brisket, burritos are on point.  Good service.

name: Dan Williams
text: Such a great fusion with Mexican and Southern BBQ!! Yum!!

name: Willie Lee
text: Food was not good at all, a total waste of money!!

resp.text: What was wrong with the food tonight. Would love to know so we can do better  day after day

name: Margaret Contreras
text: Brisket tacos are amazing!!

name: Jeo Snek
text: Wonderful food, Great friendly service just amazing overall!

name: Joy Grace
text: A friend of mine went with me & we walked inside & was not sure what to do at all-there needs to be a sign saying to order at the counter before sitting down. We got our food before they even brought our drinks to us & when we ordered desert- they said they had turned off the fryer cause they were closing soon-so we didn't get desert.  The people were friendly but just seemed very unprofessional. We won't be returning for sure & I would NOT recommend that store to anyone.

resp.text:
Good Evening Joy,
Let me start off by apologizing for this horrible experience. This is not the Fire & Spice way and as owners we are shocked and appalled by how you and your friend were treated. Even though it definitely wasn’t you’re ideal evening, I want to thank you for bringing it to our attention. Without being told about issues there would be no way of knowing what we need to focus on, so thank you. We would like to know what night you and your friend came in so we know who to personally address and retrain. Also, please accept our deepest apologies and offer for a free meal on us. We understand if you’re hesitant on coming back anytime soon, but please trust me when I say this shouldn’t happen again.
Our email address is: firespicefoodtruck@gmail.com
Please feel free to contact us so we can work together on helping us become better. Thank you again.

text: Best dam Tex-Mex you can get east of the country of Texas!

name: Eriq
text: First Time visitors. The staff is very attentive 😷😷and friendly. Very  clean social distancing restaurant. I was  on a mission to find the best ribs in Alabama and it seems this is #1 on my list. I knew this had to be true because the drive through was lined up around the corner. For a sure sign of good food!   We chose to get our order to go. Our food was hot 🔥 well cooked if anything was thrown away was some empty containers with bones of course. My family 👪🏾and I will highly recommend their services.

name: Bill Freeman
text:
Got the Half Chicken, Collards and Beans.
Collards and Beans were excellent.
Chicken over cooked and dry. You know when put heavy sauce on their hiding something. Like Dry Chicken.
When you order Half Chicken, you expect, Leg, Thigh, Wing and Breast. Received Leg, Wing, Breast and Breast. All over cooked...

name: Jack Davis
text: I stopped here for the first time on Saturday evening 17 April 2021.  I ordered the puled pork plate as was looking forward to some good pulled pork.  Unfortunately I did not get it here.  The pulled pork is probably the worst I have ever had.  The slaw was inedible.  In fact, the slaw was horrible.  I do not know what all they put in it, but whatever it is, they need to stop.  Get a real slaw recipe.  The only reason I gave this two stars is the baked beans ands I have had better baked beans.

name: Nicholas Jordan
text: The food is DELICIOUS.  Nothing bad to say about it whatsoever.   I really enjoyed my barbecue pulled pork sandwich with pickles and a side of baked beans.

name: K9 731
text: The pork baked potato was enormous and pretty good. I haven't had a potatoe that large before but I have had better....still good and filling.

name: Sara K
text: The only thing worth getting is the chow chow salad/Cole slaw they make. The pies suck and the BBQ is mediocre. If you're looking for something better than Sonny's BBQ, don't come here.

name: kamaya kay
text: Overall, not bad. The potato salad and coleslaw need some help. The ribs were undercooked. But baby the brisket sandwich and smoked chicken were delicious. Don't know what chow chow is, but it's made perfectly with the brisket.

name: Lala Singletary
text:
Great food, bit customer service need a little work mainly food preparation..
Only because drive-thru was messed up that day couldn't use it had to go in place your order or call it in before you get there and I still had to wait and while waiting I noticed some people that were there before me and some of the orders were getting mixed up and it progressed was moving or rather slowly!!
So full moon only gets four thumbs up 👍👍👍👍

name: Davis Short
text: Very good but they neglect to give you sauce. Been about 4-5 times and got sauce once. So be sure to buy your own or ask for extra. Very dry without sauce.

name: tory white
text: Well after waiting an hour, after placing our order and sitting at our table with our numbers, someone came and checked on us. 20 minutes later they came and checked on us again. 20 minutes after that they finally brought our food. Mine was still warm, but I was the only one. Every one at our table’s food was cold. So not sure if they were short handed or disorganized. Just curious why we had numbers placed on our tables if they come over to use 3 times to ask what we ordered and our receipt. So I would not recommend dinning in, might have better luck with drive through.

name: Qiana Law
text: I went for Mother’s Day and it was messy. The front wasn’t clean. All the workers arguing and not wanting to come to the register to assist those coming in. One customer did an online order and he had been waiting over 30 minutes just for an employee to catch an attitude with him about HIS order. And the same employee decides she was going to clock out and go home in the process of taking orders. I wasn’t satisfied as they messed up my order and I tried calling Corporate and got no response either. I would honestly never go back and being Corporate never reached back out after I left two voicemails I will be sure to let family and friends know this is not the place to go.

name: David Nelson
text: Have eaten here many times and always had excellent food, today the bbq wings were cold, soggy and the taste was off, I wouldn't even give the wings 1 star. Everything else was 5 stars.

name: judiharden
text:
Saturday Night. Crazy busy.  Large order. Great Food.
Thank you.
See you soon

name: Carla Michelle
text: This food is delicious. We were road tripping and I will be sure to pass through there again.  Forgot to take pictures. 🥰🥰🥰🥰

name: Dani Koson
text:
Overall, a pretty solid place! Greens were good, the baked beans were smokey and addictive, and the breading on the catfish was flavorful. The house made tartar sauce had a nice zesty kick to it. The cornbread was just sweet enough (though it could've been a little bigger). Pork and ribs were smokey, tender, and delicious. The chow-chow was spicy and so good! There were only a couple detractions. One was the fact that the chow-chow didn't seem to come with every dinner plate (or at least not the fish?). The other major flaw was their mac & cheese and french fries. A little bit if Cajun seasoning or anything beyond salt and pepper would've made these sides more interesting. Instead they were quite bland.

But again, for the money you pay, it's not a bad meal. Most of your options will have your taste buds doing a happy dance.

name: Jim Williams
text:
Went there last Sunday afternoon about 4pm
Very disappointed with the food.
It was our first visit there.
Ordered the baby back ribs and loaded baked potato
The tray our food was served on were warped and our drinks spilled everywhere.
Baby back ribs were not even close to being warm, and were dried out. Some were only 11/2 “ long...
Baby baby baby back ribs.
The baked potato skin was so hard I broke my plastic knife trying to cut it. Could not even stab my fork into it.
It had been sitting for a long long time.
We were very surprised the food was so bad, the reviews were good.
Never again will we eat there, first and last time...
Don’t waste your money.

resp.text: Hi Jim, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Molly Cox
text: Why oh why can’t I post 0 stars. I paid $23 at this restaurant only to be given raw, pink meat?? My husband works night shift at the medical center and I grabbed him his favorite food which is bbq chicken so he’d have something filling before work and now he had to throw it away! On top of the fries being cold, old and without any salt and he couldn’t even tell his macaroni and any cheese on it smh 🤦🏽‍♀️

name: Stephan Myers
text: Wanted a quick bite to eat that wasn't a hamburger.  Full Moon BBQ fit the bill.  My son and I both got a big baker with BBQ pork.  They were both huge potatoes stuffed with pork, sour cream, butter and chives.  The food was ordered at the counter and brought to the table by a friendly server.  Meat was perfectly smoked a the sauce tangy but not overly spicy. Great food but be prepared to be stuffed when you leave.

name: Meagan Watson
text: Great BBQ! Portions are HUGE! Cookies are the BEST ever!

name: W A
text: Always good food! Friendly service as well. Fairly quick with food delivery except when super packed. I definitely suggest giving it a try.

name: Tabitha Hunter
text: The food was okay. I had the bbq pork sandwich with baked beans. The sandwich was okay but the baked beans were horrible. They smelled and tasted burnt! I’ve never had burnt baked beans.

name: Pilot Alabama
text: This place used to be awesome. It’s REALLY gone downhill. I couldn’t eat half the meat on these spare ribs because they were stringy and the consistency of jerky. That’s NOT an exaggeration. And the Mac n cheese was bland and dry. I won’t be coming back here again and will recommend to everyone that asks to go elsewhere for bbq. It’s disappointing, but I really can’t believe it’s this bad. I don’t remember having worse bbq anywhere from the west to east coasts. Management really needs to get their quality under control.

resp.text: Hello Pilot Alabama, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Cecil High
text:
The selection of food items is outstanding. We like the  giant loaded baked potato. Loaded with
chicken or BBQ pork and everything thats makes for a great meal. One potato feeds two hungry people and its very reasonably priced.

name: James walker
text: It's a shame that I had to come back and edit my review. Whoever is in the kitchen cooking today needs to be fired. The ribs were hard and you guys potato salad tastes like you bought it from Walmart.

name: marc powers
text: Great food. Most employees are nice and caring

name: NicoOutside
text: Ribs were decent. Food was hot and fresh. Drive thru guy was very helpful and friendly.

name: Mike Simon
text: Great food. Loved the bbq pork plate. Clean place.

name: jc's so good kitchen
text: Terrible service I waited 30 minutes on 4 hot dogs and it was flies everywhere I thought a dead animal was in there 4 people just walked out before me the was messing up every body's order I just told them keep them lil 8 dollars they just need to close down a lil girl at a lemonade stand is more organized than them throw the whole store away

name: Peter Lacroix
text: Pulled pork sandwich was excellent with the baked beans. And pulled chicken sandwich was just that's good mac and cheese very good. And the deviled eggs

name: Mike Simon
text: Great food. Loved the bbq pork plate. Clean place.

name: Tracey Trammell
text: I recently stopped by Full Moon in Dothan Al. For lunch. I  proceeded to pay with gift card, had an issue with card and I  gave the manager, Jermal the receipt and he handled the situation very quickly and professionally. It is so hard these days to find employees that care and respect their employment but Jermal was exceptional. Definitely enjoyed the food and  great hospitality.

name: Christopher Parker
text:
This place is amazing...
The chicken and brisket...OMG

name: J E
text: Such great food at reasonable prices.  Fast service and friendly people.  Lots of sports channels on the large TVs.

name: Lesli Turner Vance
text: Chicken sandwich made to perfection.   Tender as it can be.

name: Bob Boyle
text: The food is great but when the drive through attendant can't wear a face mask correctly it makes me wonder about what they think of their customers. I would have given 5 stars otherwise.

resp.text: Hi Bob, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: David Hanna
text: Awesome food wish we had one in California

name: Donna Lehneis
text: First of all, let me start by saying my food was delicious.  I loved the brisket, and the riblets.  The sauce was fantastic.  That being said, management should take a long hard look at their customer care standard of treatment.   I place our dine in order and immediately after placed a take out order.  Spent $75 all total.  After asking a waitress twice about my to go order and then having to go up to the counter because they didn't come back to my table to advise status.  I recieve an attitude from the waitress working the pass that "they were busy", "I am waiting on these dine in orders" pointing to the front counter where 3 trays of food were sitting.  I said, "I've been waiting now for an hour since my order was placed, I would like my food so I can leave". She turned around and ignored me.  The manager came over and asked what I was waiting for and I told him, "My Togo order"  He said "we are behind on to go orders, I said I understand,  but I placed my order an hour ago when I place my dine in order and have been finished now for over 30 minutes"  he said "oh, your food should have already been up".  No kidding.  As much as I enjoyed the food, I will not return to this restaurant due to their poor customer service.

resp.text: Hi Donna, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Hannah Gilley
text: They served my daughter a extremely undercooked burger tonight. Will not be returning.

name: Bill Klein
text: You never know what your going to get. Ordered take out for Sundays NFL games. Ordered wings that were not completely cooked, ordered mac and cheese very bland. It’s a flip of the coin whether its going to be good or bad. When it’s good, it’s very good. We have received more bad then good I'm sorry to say. Zero consistency. I think we’re are done ordering from Full Moon Bar-B-Que on Montgomery Hwy.

resp.text: Hi Bill, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Cat Mama
text: The staff is always nice here and the food is amazing! Love that they have a convenient drive thru! Love the Chow Chow!!!!

name: Karen Parsons
text: A friend and I had great BBQ pork sandwiches, fries and tea the other day. The sandwich had an abundance of shredded pork. We had excellent,  personal service by Latasha.  She is definitely an asset  with her friendly and positive attitude! Will definitely be back!

name: Ed Egee
text: Simply some of the best barbeque anywhere. Food is excellent. We had brisket, spare ribs, deviled eggs, catfish and Mac and cheese. Everything is good. One minor suggestion: digital ordering. The wait in line isnt great. Tablets at the tables would be better.

name: Melissa Sawyer
text: Horrible customer service. I normally dont leave bad reviews but this deserves it. They would not take our order and ignored us.

resp.text: Hi Melissa, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Mr. D
text:
Full Moon is still my favorite chain BBQ joint, but we had the Big Baker potatoes yesterday and they were extremely disappointing. The potatoes were very dry and they were practically devoid of any pulled pork. Of course COVID-19 protocols made the visit far less enjoyable to no fault of their own.

We make the hour and forty-five minute drive from PCB once or twice a month and we dine here virtually every time. I think that’s going to change after this last experience. I’m not sure what has happened but it has definitely changed and not for the better.

On a side note. Both the men’s and women’s restrooms were absolutely filthy. There’s absolutely no excuse for that!

resp.text: Hi, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Emma Ritchie
text:
Overpriced & rude employees. No customer service attitude to be seen.
Lady in the drive through was in too big of a hurry to understand what my husband was trying to do with his meal in the two meat combo. Then acted like it was a problem to add in something at the window that I had already told her I wanted in the first place. Rolled her eyes and everything. Overpriced, again. And not worth the headache trying to order.
Came in 10/25 6:23pm.

resp.text: Hi Emma, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Kimberly Stewart
text: I don’t even know where to start really. We have ate here since it’s opened up. We will drive from enterprise just to get dinner or buy a whole pie.  But there’s definitely been a change since they have opened back up.  Food quality isn’t as good and today we drove 30 miles to eat here and got there at 140 stood in line as others ordered and sat to wait on there meals. We got to the register and a man came from the back and ask if we were eating there. Like that wasn’t obvious we were.so we said yes and he replied were closed. We thought he was joking with us as many others were eating and the people ahead of us went right over and sat down to eat. As he walked us to the door basically  pushing us out he said see it says we close at 230 on Sunday and went back inside.. it’s now 155 pm... I don’t know what’s going on here but they have lost my business...

resp.text: Hello Kimberly, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

It's a cute little BBQ joint right off the main rd.

name: Sandra Robertson
text: My husband and I get Full Moon every Saturday night, including this one. We have definitely noticed a decline in quality but tonight is the absolute worst experience so far. My husband’s ribs were extremely undercooked. I, on the other hand, had the potato with chicken. I noticed that the potato tasted like it had been rewarmed, and then I noticed that the chicken looks raw. I decided to save the chicken in a plastic bag in case I get sick. After placing the chicken in the bag, I smelled it and it smells rotten. I am praying we don’t get sick. I will NEVER eat here again.

resp.text: Hello Sandra, thank you for your feedback. I am sorry that your experience at our Dothan location did not meet our usual and expected standards. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

text: Excellent! Everything was fresh and tasted great! Pork sandwich was moist and very tasty. Steak fries and baked beans were hot and fresh.

name: Robert Parker
text:
Today was a disappointing dining experience beginning with the young lady taking our order.  During the order she’d taken our order incorrectly twice that we understood and then after lunch delivered to our table realized actually three times.  My wife had ordered Caesar salad with grilled chicken tenders.  The young lady taking our order even asked what kind of dipping sauce would you like?  The salad was delivered to our table without chicken tenders. The gentleman who’d delivered to our table said he’d be back in a few minutes with the tenders.  Twenty three minutes later we left without the chicken.
Perhaps extenuating circumstances lead to this extremely poor service such as masks muffling our voices, plastic partition, loud background music and maybe the young lady just didn’t care.  Idk.  But I do know we won’t be back. As in Dothan Alabama there are plenty of good alternatives to have a good meal with reasonably good service.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Shane Vann
text: Took a BBQ tour from North Florida to Memphis and stopped at many places along the way. Full Moon had THE BEST pulled pork sandwich. The "regular" was huge. It didn't n Ed a thing either, mark of good BBQ. But I did pick up a couple bottles of the white BBQ sauce and that went quick after the trip. The deviled eggs were also worth getting. We also tried the BBQ nachos, I am ready for that trend to fad it always ends up not what it could have been. Now if they did a shredded chicken nachos with that white sauce, we could talk about it. Sausage and cheese plate was exactly that, more tradition than anything, sausage was a little spicy. Also took carrot cake home, it hits it out of the park for sure!

name: Sam Davis
text: This is typically my favorite place to eat. When I walked in today things were different. It was a bit messier and had a slightly foul smell. I ordered a pound of brisket and a half pound of sausage. The barbecue sauce tasted scorched. The brisket was not fully sliced and was unusually dry and bland. The sausage lacked the snap it normally has. It was like an oversized Slim Jim. I was there at lunch, but I feel like I was served yesterdays leftovers. It may be a long while before I go back.

name: Christopher DiNatale
text:
After looking through the reviews it seems the majority of the 1 star reviews have come recently. It's a shame because we were told this was the best BBQ in Alabama. I unfortunately am going to disagree with that claim.

We ordered take out for a party we were having. Several pounds of pulled pork and pulled chicken. The BBQ was ok, nothing spectacular. We did however have quite a few bones in both the chicken and pork which was alarming since we have young children who were also eating the food. I will say that the sauce itself was pretty good. So there was at least one positive.

The real disappointment with this establishment came to the bill. Total for our order was $150 which was split with another party. Rather than charging myself $75 and the other party $75, they charged me $150, then charged me again $75, then charged me again another $75. The other part was double charged as well. Upon complaining to Full Moon, I was told that I was not charged multiple times and that it was an issues with both my bank, and the other parties bank. It's now the next week and they are still in fact trying to charge my bank the additional charges, that is per my bank.

Would you like to pay over $400 for only $150 of sub-par BBQ? Probably not. I'd make this restaurant a hard pass if I'm ever again in the Dothan area.

resp.text: Hi Christopher, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to reach out to our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com with your preferred method of contact to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Den Davidson
text: I've been to this restaurant many times and had a great experience each time but tonight was very different. The cashier that took our order was so preoccupied with complaining about another customer who complained about getting their order wrong that she didn't even ask us if she could take our order. After some uncomfortable wait for her to acknowledge us I finally gave up and just blurted out my order which she took while she steamed. We then seat ourselves at a filthy dining room table that we had to wipe off ourselves. So then we get our chicken sandwiches we ordered and discovered the buns were soggy because the person that prepared them was too lazy to toast the bun like usual. Didn't dare complain after witnessing how the other customer was treated . Besides I was worried they might do something bad to my food.  Doubt I'll be back even though my wife and I eat here at least 3 times a month. Would love to hear from somebody in management. I have my receipt and can tell you who waited on me.

resp.text: Hi Den, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing director at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We'd love to hear from you.

name: Tom Miller
text: When I was in Dothan traveling home I wound up staying at the Marriott so I asked the front manager where was a good BBQ place to checkout as I wanted to sample some Alabama BBQ and they told me Full Moon BBQ it's just around the corner so I went there based on their suggestion. I'm kinda open to new places and exploring as long as the food is great and the place is clean. Didn't take me too long to find it overall the place was nice and clean but it had a tourist trap vibe sadly most of the places in this area trying to compete for your almighty dollars. I'm more into comfort food cafeteria style food and awesome BBQ but none to be found that I knew about in this area so I decided for this place. Wish I could sample the food at places to decide what tasted awesome? I got a Brisket chicken platter. The food was not bad good portions self serve on drinks and BBQ sauces to me a little pricey but overall not bad but to me it kinda lacked a smoked flavor? I've eaten a lot of BBQ over the years and I know good BBQ. Overall, the place had a bunch of celebrity pictures on the wall with TV's in the corner kinda felt more like a sports bar than a BBQ place? The place was clean and probably not a bad place to take a friend or meet up with someone as it was convenient but depends what you are looking for and how picky you are in great BBQ. So the quest for better BBQ goes on next time I'm in the area for a better place.

name: Larry Clark
text: When my family came to visit from Kentucky they had a craving for barbeque. I knew just where to take them. Upon arrival you'll notice the smoke coming from the chimney, exhaust from the in house smoker, and a slight aroma of a outdoor style BBQ. When you enter the building you'll immediately smell the BBQ, the smell alone makes your mouth water. They have a large menu board and paper menus available to select from. The pricing is a little high, but the portions are large. Everything on the menu is delicious. You order and pay at the counter and are handed a number to place on your table. Then the food is brought to the table. Needless to say my family was very impressed and all agreed they would have to return to Full Moon next time they visited. Oh, and try the white BBQ sauce.

resp.text: This makes us very happy to hear we have new fans in Kentucky! Thank you for choosing our BBQ to share! See you all again soon!

I wouldn't go every time I needed a BBQ fix, but I would recommend it to anyone on that side of town.

Best Barbecue ever.

We come here every other week to eat all the way from panama city.

text: Pretty pricey for a simple meal and it was disappointing to be served our food on a peice of paper on the plastic red tray. For $25 for two sandwiches, fries and teas it would have been great to have had at least a plate. The food is good..but probably my last visit.
