text: The staff is so friendly and the barbecue is delicious!! The prices are also very reasonable.

name: Nichole Taylor
text: We love this BBQ place. Pulled pork sandwhiches are good. Jumbo baked potato is tasty. Bring a sweatshirt if you're eating in because every time we go it's freezing cold inside.

name: John Guisinger
text: The food was excellent! Was my first time there and I'll definitely go back again.

name: Aaron Bastian
text: The Ribs and Brisket were some of the best I've ever had. The sides can use a bit of work. Nice clean place with fast service. Great place to try.

name: Anthony Richardson
text: First, i would like to start of by saying, this is one of my favorite places to eat in Dothan. With that said, I had an experience there that has me rethinking my BBQ choices. My family and I went to Full Moom last weekend to celebrate my son's birthday. We ordered the smokey wings like we always do, as well as ribs, greens, mac and cheese, and fried okra. The sides were tasty as always, the okra cooked a little too hard, but edible. The wings however were smoked, but very raw inside. I am not sure why because it took them an hour to bring out the wings in the first place. When we brought this to the attention of the staff, they apologized and said they are not smoking anymore wings so we would have to choose something else. We specifically came for the smoked wings, but we had already been there over an hour at this point and just wanted to consume a meal. They were suppose to replace two 10 piece orders, buy brought two six pieces. Once this what brought to their attention the server got upset and said you need to go up to the register with your concern and they will work out a refund. So not only did they have cook my food, short me my food. I waited in a 20 min line to get reimbursed for services not rendered. This was my first bad experience at full moon, but sometimes that is enough. I sent a message to the survey on the back of the receipt and not one person's follow-up up.

resp.text: Hi Anthony, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Shane Angle
text: Always have good food at this place. But today the water tasted like dish sink water, nasty.

resp.text: Hi Shane, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: JJ M
text: The pork was great, however the bbq sauce was terrible. If you eat here have then leave off the sauce.  Buy you some Sonny's BBQ sauce that will do the trick! Sonny's needs to come to Dothan Alabama.

name: Kory Roberts
text: Clean restaurant, clean restrooms, great customer service. These guys have great food, and decent prices. Of the BBQ places in Dothan, they are one of the best. The stuffed baked potato can feed two people easily. The portions served here are huge.

name: FoulOwl
text:
Usually quite good. But the last two times was very sub par. The stuffed baker's are huge but l recommend the pork or chicken over the turkey, as the turkey tends to be quite dry. And c'mon guys, they're $10. Another fork-full o meat wouldnt break the bank.The Burger w pimento cheese is usually very good. But as mentioned earlier last two times l went, it was sub par. Overcooked and dry. And they ain't cheap, so again, it wouldn't kill ya to throw in some fries. If I'm gone have to pay extra for em they darn sure better be cooked to order with the burg, HOT and CRISP. Which they rarely are. Next time l will not be so polite about it. Rest assured.
My mother ordered the fried catfish last time on a whim. I realize it's not your signature item, but if you can't do any better than that, TAKE IT OFF THE MENU! Worst we've ever had anywhere! Inedible. Shouldn't have payed for it but did. Like l say, historically, has been quite good. So l give it 3stars. But if things don't improve after my last two visits... You're gone be off my go to list.

name: John Taylor
text: Good tasty BBQ, reasonably priced.

name: cindy miller
text: Love the fast service and delicious bbq, along with the most excellent sides here!! Make sure you are a sports fan when you dine in...the TVs are EVERYWHERE!!

name: Angie Brown
text: Yum! Everything I tasted here was delicious! Even the greens and the beans were full of flavor. Their special relish is good on everything. Service was very friendly. It's sort of cafeteria style so you can be as quick and casual as you like.

name: Bradford Riley
text: The BBQ is good. They have a unique type of coleslaw that adds to a good burger. Three stars because I think the price is inflated. Equally good BBQ is available at other places for better prices.

name: Randy Windsor
text: Food was excellent. I ordered at the drive thru and food was ready quickly. I would like to see an app for ordering.

name: Julie Paulston
text: Excellent food! I was doubtful being "fast" food. However it was really good!

name: Brian Parker
text: Everything is just ok. Nothing horrible, but overpriced for what you get.

name: Patricia Simmons
text:
The BBQ sandwich I got today was dry. The meat had no flavor whatsoever. The fries were cold.
When we went to the counter all of the workers were standing around talking and did not acknowledge us until I said, "excuse me." Then the young girl had an attitude.
This is the second bad experience I've had at Full Moon in Dothan, Al. Don't know if I'll go back.

resp.text: Hi Patricia, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: silva white
text: This worst customer service. I called my order in i waited in line for 30 minutes i get to window then they never started my order .  Then to tell me  if i want my order why would call if i didn't .  Food is good but service very poorly!!!!!

resp.text: Hi Silva, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Blake Sanders
text: What you need? Umm I would like to place an order.. lol this place is usually great but tonight the employees were super rude and most of the tables were dirty, and the sauce stand was disgusting.. going down hill

resp.text: Hi Blake, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Ronald Lingo
text: Drove 30 minutes stood in line for 25 minutes to get spare ribs and they are OUT of ribs on the 4th of July of all days. My last trip they were out of potatoes.... No sign to warn you or anything...

resp.text: Hi Ronald, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Candace Hatcher
text: Ice is the best n cheapest

name: Chris Thornhill
text: Lots of great tasting choices. Friendly people. Quick food not fast food

name: Justin Smith
text: Great consistent BBQ. Friendly staff and great location

name: Tamara Reynolds
text: The food was delicious the service was on point.

name: MIkal Mongoven
text: The service in Dothan is terribly slow. I sat in the drive thru for 22 minutes and asked for a refund. Ridiculous!!! What is even more aggravating the staff wanted to inform me it takes 10 minutes to cook the burger I ordered. Didn’t make it any better when I ordered 20 minutes prior. After requesting my refund they still tried to get me to take the food and leave after I insisted on my refund. Which took another 7 minutes to even get the manager involved. Considering this was between 11-11:30am this lack of performance is inexcusable. Thanks for wasting 30 minutes of my lunch break.

name: Burt Courage
text: Food is fantastic.  The brisket sandwich was the best I have ever had.

name: Danell Ouellet Baxley
text: Food is good, service is lousy.

resp.text: Hi Danell, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at erin@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: don bill
text: best Q I've had in years.

name: Charles Paulk
text: Delicious food! Prices outrageous. $34 for 3 sandwiches and 3 fries. No drinks. That's nearly 12 bucks for only sandwich and fries. Cmon full moon. Yall are great, dont bust heads!

name: Smith Christopher
text: The absolute best BBQ I've had. Staff is awesome and very helpful. Will always go back

resp.text: Hi Smith, we're glad you're a fan of Full Moon BBQ! We always look forward to having you back!

name: Alexis Adams
text: The fried green tomatoes and brisket are the best. We tried the ribs and they were yummy as well. The desserts are made in house (I asked) but I was too full for dessert. I'll be back for carrot cake.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Alexis! The carrot cake is one of our favorites!

name: Russell Braswell
text: Pulled pork isn't really pulled...it's chewed...but good. Brisket was pretty good as well. Not the best BBQ sauce which they serve on top of your meats bit overall good. Pretty pricey!

name: James Dillard
text: Great BBQ verity of sauces including Alabama white sauce. Good Waite staff.  Good place to eat.

resp.text: Thanks for the love, James! See you again!

name: Andrew Mckennna
text: Today me and my wife went in with our 2 year old. We ordered a big baker( wife couldn't finish it) and I got the chicken and rib plate. All of it was good but the one and only issue I had was the collards could have had a little less stems in them. Other than that great food a little pricey but pretty good bbq.

name: Lamar W
text: Baked potato had me with the itis

name: Jen Dyche
text: Over all it was very good. They were out of brisket so went with the pulled pork. A little dry though.

name: John Price
text: Good sides but the brisket and links were ok

resp.text: Hi John, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Cindy Manley
text: The Baker Potato was huge and delicious

name: Anastasia Pterudis
text: Always good food and very helpful

name: Juan Cepero
text: I come here to get the pimiento cheese burger. If you have not tried it I would highly recommend. One of the best burgers in town.

name: Alicia Bryant
text: Best Bbq I've had in a looooooong time!! It was highly recommended to me. So far I've only had their baked potato and I must say they are TOP NOTCH!! Great customer service, wonderful atmosphere. If you haven't tried it your missing out.

resp.text: Hi Alicia, thanks for the TOP NOTCH review! Come see us again soon!

name: Danny McLean
text: This place has the best barbecue and the best service. Tastes just as good here as it does at the original store.

name: ashley whitesel
text: Best BBQ I have ever had! Loved the chow-chow they ask u if you want! Had to have them explain it to me lol. Wish there was one in Colorado!

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Ashley! Come see us again soon!

name: Kristie Hunt
text:
I was very disappointed
You here barbque and you can taste it and smell it
I found nothing inside that said barbque
They have up cattle heard rails like burger king  to maintain an orderly line the menu is very lacking in southern food or barbque food
There is no aroma of cooking food you place your old at the register then given a number and your drinks pick a table to sit at and wait my grandson food came on a plate on a tray mine and my husbands food come out just on the tray with a piece of paper under our sandwhiches the potato salad was too sweet to eat drowning in mustard now for $30 i did expect at least the food presentation to be a bit more than we got may our sandwiches in a basket would have been nice i dont know how clean the tray was the sandwiches were not wrapped just helplessly setting on a tray hoping not to catch a germ
Now i was not born and raised in the south but i did marry a qood southern man from jackson ms my mother in law is a strict southern baptist bible belt woman i learned from her how to cook southern favorites with a hint of yankee in them every southern home i have ever been to never served any of thier side dishes the way this place did if your looking for a casual southern style barbque experience this is not the place its fastfood barbque that nukes thier food just like McDonald's
There is 1 positive out of the experience thier barbque sauce now thats to die for so the next time im cooking at home and need barbecue sauce i will drive 20 miles 1 way just to have thier barbque sauce

resp.text: Hi Kristie, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

name: Wes S
text: Decent barbecue, but WAY overpriced.  Why eat chain BBQ food when you could eat better local BBQ for cheaper? Ribs and pork were pretty good; brisket was dry. Sides were OK - either from a can or the freezer.

name: Adam Crooms
text: Good food, good service, good price

name: Bizzi B
text: Four and a half stars. Fast service.Decent food.Meats come medium rare unless requested well done.

name: Steve Sibley

resp.text: Hello Steve, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at emory@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience further. We want to hear from you!

name: Tina Reeves
text: They are getting better. However, I don't want to see people with pants sagging. They make things called belts!! It is my personal opinion that they need a refresher course in proper work attire.

text: Food was good and hot and you get plenty on food. I ordered bbq plate, husband ordered bbq potato and it was big.

name: jerry woodham

text: Food was horrible

name: Jospeh Starling
text: BBQ in a hurry. Got the pulled pork sandwich with fries. I got the chow chow sauce on the side because I don't care for regular slaw, and it's basically spicy cole slaw. Pork was juicy and flavorful. Good stuff. Not exactly cheap but very yummy.

name: Meredeth Green
text: I love the open face pulled pork sandwich. The spicy white sauce they give you is good on everything.

resp.text: Hi Meredeth, thank you for your feedback! Be sure and try our burgers and bakers at your next visit!

text: Have not received a bad meal yet! I believe it's my favorite spot to eat! My only problem I have is their regular drink is a small by any other food chain's standard. It also is grossly overpriced at $1.99 the manager told me it was a 16oz cup but I beg to differ...

name: Ron Catalano
text: Great BBQ, very pleasant atmosphere, employees efficient at their job but did not seem real happy to be there, no banter with customers, just took order and gave receipt and person delivering order did not smile, just asked who ordered what, sat it down and left.  Great sports memoralibly of all kinds, clean.

name: Jeff Dierberger
text: Good bbq, white sauce was interestingly good, portions were a tad small for what I paid. I would recommend people stop and check this place out.

text: Wonderful BBQ..  But we expect nothing less from them.  There was a large piece of bone/ hard cartilage in my wife's sandwich though.  She didn't want to say anything to the management about it.

text: The ribs were tender and falling off the bone. My food was fresh cooked, the bread was soft, the cookies were delicious and the service was pretty fast. I really enjoyed dinning here....👍

name: john gentry
text: Alot of food !

text: We've been here a few times now and it's been great every time. We usually something different everytime. Pulled pork sandwich is excellent with quite a bit of meat. Mac n cheese is great, so glad when restaurants don't serve kraft. Ribs were nice and tender. Each time we've gone the wait has always been minimal for food which is great when you have Littles.

name: BIGD3DMEDIA
text: Service is usually fast and staff is always friendly.  The BBQ Pork Nachos are a favorite that you can actually make a meal out of.  Pay the extra and replace the pork with the beef brisket.  You will thank me later.

text: This place has a HUGE menu. Almost too big. Youll be staring at it for a long time trying to narrow down what to get of ALL the things you want. The ribs here are really good. The other day i had their wings. They were

name: Doc Spook
text:
Worst pie crust ever
should have been 3.5-4 stars but the pie crust was the toughest and tasteless I have ever had.  could barely cut it with the plastic knife and can't break it with the fork.  the fillings were flavorful and also denser than any pie ever.

pork and brisket were very good!

fries and corn were average

too much money for this quality and amount of food

name: Chuck Walker
text: I usually get a potato when I visit and they have always been good. I thought I would try something different today. Bad choice. I had the large pork sandwich which was full of something inedible ( fat and gristle) and a broken bun which fell apart when picked up. Which fell apart on my piece of wax paper since it did not come on a plate. Very disappointed today.

text: Best BBQ in Dothan by quite a large margin. Great pulled pork and pretty good brisket. Nice, albeit small, beer selection, a ton of TVs for sports and you have to get an order of the Full Moon chocolate-dipped chocolate chip cookies. Great sweet tea too!

resp.text: Thank you for the love Debbie! You should always save room for dessert!

name: Malisa Cox
text: My daughter loves their loaded baked potatoes with the chipped bbq.

name: Melissa Pate
text: The best place!!!!! My husband and I have went here for our Anniversary for the past 2 or 3 yrs and we plan on stopping by on our way to the mountains for our 10 yr Anniversary it's so worth to go out of the way can't wait!!!!

name: Trey Brownlee
text: Full Moon has decent barbeque, wings and turkey. Truthfully, it is ranked 3.5 in my book but it is not quite a 4. The big baker potato is great and their sauces are good as well. Good place for lunch and some dessert.

name: cherry blossom
text: Very tasty BBQ. I had the pulled pork sandwich with Brunswick stew. The stew was a tad bland, but if you put the bbq sauce in it, it tastes good. I tasted my husbands mac&cheese and it was fairly good. Not amazing, but not bad. The pie however was bad. They added way too much sugar and not enough keylime juice. I could barely taste the keylime flavor, but it tasted and felt like they put 2-3 cups too much sugar. Overall the taste of the food was good.

name: Ryan Ferguson
text: Clean place, great service it's just the ribs tasted boiled, you have that great open pit and you're gonna fast cook baby back ribs, kinda sad

resp.text: Hi Ryan, thank you for your feedback. Please feel free to contact our marketing coordinator at kylie@fullmoonbbq.com to discuss your experience. We want to hear from you!

text: Food is really good, service has gone downhill. On our last visit, no one in line, we waited about 2 minutes and finally a girl sauntered up from the back, walked right past us without a word and yelled to another girl in the restaurant. That one came and stood behind the register and looked at us- no greeting. When she brought our trays, still not a word, just put them on the table - even shoved my hand with it.  We ate and left, walked past the girl- still not a word. Napkins were stuffed in the holder so tight we tore up three trying to pry them out- finally has to just pull out a bunch. I think I know why there were only 2 other people there.

name: Chris Butterworth
text: We go north thru Dothan, Ala quite often. Since this location of an Alabama original opened, we've stopped several times for lunch, never being disappointed.  Counter service only; bbq chicken, pulled pork, and beef brisket are all great. Really good sides. We love this location!

resp.text: We're glad we are your stop when driving through town, Chris! Thank you for the kind words! See you guys again!

resp.text: We love to hear that, Tim! Happy Birthday to your Mom!

text: Well, our first trip was September 7th. I got the Pork Nachos and my husband got a plate with ribs and brisket. The nachos were wonderful. My husband wasn’t a big fan of the sauce. We revisited Sept 14th to give it another try. It was awful. The Chicken Baker was ok but the sauce is not good. It’s tastes like a chili sauce. My husband got a brisket sandwich. It wasn’t good. Also, the employees were talking VERY loudly until one of the employees notice they were talking loud. Instead of talking, someone needed to be cleaning up the tea area and the sauce crock pot. Is that even up to the health codes? To end the trip, my husband vomited when he got home.🤷🏻‍♀️

resp.text: Hi, Amanda. We sincerely apologize about your poor experience. Could you please provide your contact information to fullmoonsocialmedia@gmail.com? Our manager would like to speak with you directly.

We share it every time and we're both full for apx. $10.

name: Jessica Farmer
text: This place is very expensive for the mediocre food, lack of customer service, and the menu is "all over the place" and what I mean by this is, there is absolutely no detailed information on any of the food they serve that is listed on the menu and you feel extremely rushed to hurry and order so your not holding up the customers behind you, in which lack of details on the menu run into tons of questions for the cashier which prolongs the process for you and everyone behind you waiting to place their order. Each item is an individual charge as in (1) cost for main course and if you want sides (which who doesnt?) Each side is an individual costs plus another additional cost for a drink(No combos offered at all). I ordered a "fine shredded" barbecue sandwich and I got "chunks" of barbecue with extra order of "chewy fat" with each bite until the 4th bite ruined it for me and I went and asked for a refund of $9.00 and some change just for this sandwich if I may add. When requesting the refund I was not asked "what the problem was?" Nor received any type of apology for inconvenience.  The manager or shift leader, simply grabbed my plate, chunked it in the trash behind the counter and ask for my debit card to proceed with the refund. I will not do business here again! For the price, the quality of food and service are poor and no extra added value.

name: taylor davis
text: Generally Full Moon doesnt disappoint but last night their management failed completely. We ordered 2 bbq chicken sandwiches, 2 fries, corn on the cob, and 2 drinks... Halfway through or meal, my boyfriend ate a nice long hair that was in his sandwich. I brought it back to make them aware, and that we wouldnt want another sandwich. The managers response was, "well I dont know whose that could be because no one has long hair back here." Seriously?... WRONG ANSWER! I managed a fine dining restaurant for 4 years and NEVER in my life would I question the customer over a hair being in their food. Please train your management better in responding to complaints. Needless to say, we werent compensated, or in the very least apologized to for eating your kitchen staffs stray hair.

resp.text: Taylor, we sincerely apologize about your poor experience. Could you please provide your contact information to fullmoonsocialmedia@gmail.com? Our manager would like to speak with you directly.

name: Donnie Gray
text: By far the worst bar-b-que establishment I have ever eaten at.  First the prices are ridiculous but I gave them the benefit of thought I'm willing to pay for some good bar b que.  I was charged 20 bucks for two ribs, some chopped up brisket( not slices) and two sides.  The ribs were tough with no season. The little brisket that I did receive was dry, okra and Mac and cheese had no flavor.  Most bar b que establishments allow you to put your own sauce on your meat if you wish but this place drowned the meat in sauce I guess trying to cover up the non season dry meat.  Would never go back here I could smoke ribs in my backyard better than this place.

name: N M
text:
It's not only this place. I cannot find good bbq in Alabama. I have been here 40 of my 60 years. Larry's BBQ is decent when it's sliced.  My local gas station has good bbq but I think they get it from Shwann's.
Why would someone chop up pork anyway? My search continues - not for the best but for ANY good bbq in Alabama. If I had a limb shredder to pre-chew it might rate one more star.
And please stop pouring that ketchup/pickle sauce over the meat. If I want sauce I will eventually learn what is in the little tubs and do it myself.
The guy that got a "huge amount" could have shared it with me and my skimpy plate.

name: Derek Robinson
text: Most likely the best sit-down in Jackson.    Great brisket, great steaks, wonderful sides.   Can't say enough good things about it!

name: Tim McMillan
text: Still as good as it was the first day that she opened!!  Friendly service, great tasting BBQ and great atmosphere!!  100% Love this place.

name: Joshua Lamb
text: Michael guy good place to stop

name: Ash xD
text: We arrived late, but it was wonderful service and amazing food. I love the pork chops, cream corn, and sweet potato waffle fries!! Good country cowboy atmosphere!

name: Jason G
text: From out of state, was looking for a nice local establishment. Food was great, nice atmosphere, reasonable prices. Server was very friendly and attentive. Would absolutely come here again.

name: Janiece Smith
text: OMG, the food is amazing! The owner and staff are super friendly and welcoming! We were running from Hurricane Irma and it became a great place to unwind with family and even play a game of trivia!

name: Sara Davis
text: You have to get the BBQ. That's the specialty. I had the BBQ sandwich and the okra. Such a great hole in the wall restaurant.

name: Tracy Sutor
text:
I am constantly looking for someone that can actually make a better pulled pork than I can, well, I am still looking.
I tried the fried green tomatoes and they were just okay, again, I do better.
The iced tea is weak, but, being generous most everyone's is, I like a strong ice tea.

name: Breanne Borlin
text: So good!! Great environment, service, and amazing food!! Will definitely be back.

name: Justin Parker
text: Holy cow! It's soooo good every time I come in! This is southern barbeque done right, out back in the smoker. Steaks are masterfully grilled. Pulled pork is to die for. Don't even get me started on the brisket... if you find yourself in Jackson, AL for lunch or dinner this place is a must. It's tucked away in the old downtown Jackson area. A perfect place to have a stroll with your friends or special someone after a great meal!

name: Cassie Sheffield
text: Great food & friendly staff in a laid back environment.

name: Jason
text: Awesome.   Everything you expect from a bbq place.   And Ashley, our server, is the sweetest girl I ever met.   I'd marry that girl lol

text: Awesome food in a local place in downtown Jackson Al

Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: Mike Hayes
text:
Me and my dad went here for lunch.
The service is located the African-American bus man that was helping bring stuff to the table was very polite had very very good manners.

But when I tell you the cook overcooked my daddy's fried shrimps until they were and cook my grilled strips until they were tough and burnt on the outside.

And my daddy's steak was tough..

Those are just the facts..

Get the cook away from the stove and maybe let him prepare salads probably won't be going back there

resp.text: Mike, we're so sorry to hear about the issue with the fried shrimps and grilled steak. Please know that we take your feedback seriously and we will be checking in with the Trussville store. If you'd like us to follow up with you, please reach out here: https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Sorry again for the inconvenience.

name: Mary Conner
text: Steak wasn't cooked medium rare the first time. We travel a far to eat here every weekend.  Spoke  to manager  Greg and he had our ribeye steaks cooked. The 2nd time cooked was medium rare.  Thank you Greg for making our trip worth it. Will ask for you.  No wait for my adopted Nither thats in a wheelchair with dementia.

resp.text: Mary, it was a pleasure to serve you. We gladly share feedback like this with our Trussville team so we can make your next visit worthy of 5 stars. See you again soon! 🍻🥜

name: mason Reeves
text: The food was great the server was really really great i loved my visit the place was clean just a wonderful place hi highly recommend

resp.text: Mason, we’re happy to hear that! We're glad you had an awesome visit 🤘

name: Tommy Morris
text: My wife and I decided to stop by after doing some shopping. We go in and the guy tells us it'll be 40 minutes.. well it's 8 p.m. on a Thursday night and they close at 9..We tell him no thanks and as we are walking out  we count 5 tables that just haven't been cleaned off and the bus boy is sitting in a chair playing on his phone. It's already limited seating due to the social distance. You'd think they'd be more focused on getting the tables cleaned faster.. maybe this is one reason why they have low ratings.

resp.text: Tommy, thank you so much for bringing this matter to our attention. Please know we take your feedback seriously and will be following up with the Trussville location. Rest assured that we'll pass your message along to our team.

name: Nesser C
text: Had two fantastic Ribeye Steak dinner for Mother's day and they were cooked perfect! Placed the order online and when I went to pickup my order, it was ready, waiting on me! Hats off to the chef! Job well done 👏

resp.text: Nesser, we're so happy that your ribeye steak was served to your satisfaction. See you again soon for another delicious steak day!🥩

name: Alandris Ferguson
text: So many things went wrong. I couldn't use my gift card online because it didn't have a PIN. That in itself wasn't a big deal. I called to place my order. Not only was my order sent to the wrong location, items I requested on the order were left off. When I got the confirmation email, I called the location that it went to, which was this location, and asked them to add what was left off. The person said she'd get it added. I showed up to pick up the order and those items were still not on the order. Also, part of the order was overcooked.

resp.text: Alandris, we're sincerely sorry about the issue with your recent online order experience. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again. Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: Ronnie Dalton
text: Baked sweet potato was hard, no taste, had to ask for refill on drinks, order of Cole slaw was left of tray, and cole slaw was bitter tasting

resp.text: Ronnie, we're sorry we let you down with our food and service. Please connect with us directly at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ so we can share this with the Trussville team and make things right.

name: Todd Peterson
text: Much better than the last time I was here, steak and chicken were great, server Daniel was very attentive to our table.

resp.text: Todd, we’re happy to hear that our steak and chicken hit the spot and that Daniel took good care of you! See y’all again real soon 🍻

name: Cherelle Randolph
text: We usually have a good experience eating here, but tonight was bad. I had some sort of spicy rice in my to go plate that I did not order. My fiance ordered his steak well done and it was rare. We didn't have all of our condiments for the sides, our food wasn't hot and the rolls were almost burned. I couldn't get in touch with anyone over the telephone that could possibly fix my issues.

resp.text: Cherelle, we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience. This gives us a better understanding of what we are doing well and what we can improve on. We’ll work on it in the meantime and feel free to contact us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ if you have more to share.

name: Eric C. Stewart
text:
Ordered sirloin tips. Steak was crispy burnt, and I ordered tips medium. It was ordered with the mushrooms and grilled onions.

The quality of the mushrooms compared to Texas Roadhouse was mediocre. The onions were not grilled they looked like they were thrown on there right before food was brought out.

resp.text: Eric, sorry to hear that the food fell short of your expectations. We would like to learn more and share it with our Trussville team. Please let us know the details by contacting us here: https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/.

name: corlis mccurdy
text:
Our hostess was Michael
He was very professional and really just kind and deligent in making sure our order was correct. We truly loved his attitude!!! He score 💯 all around

resp.text: Corlis, we’re glad to hear that Michael could help you feel right at home! We’ll pass along the kudos. See you again soon 👋

name: Becky Barnett
text: Enjoyed my visit to Logans. The steak and salad and potatoes was delicious.  I enjoyed being my family. It very usual for us to get to go out in this pandemic. Thank you for the great service.

resp.text: Becky, thanks for joining us! We're glad to hear you and your family had a great time. We hope to see you again soon for more of our delicious steaks and salad! 👋

name: Michele Reavis
text: Since they have reopened, the food is inferior to before. The steaks were smaller. The new appetizer we tried was tasty, but small. We got the supposed 1/2 pound bacon appetizer. Came with 5 pieces of bacon 4-6 inches long and maybe 3/8 inch thick on skewers with a small amount of fried onions and some BBQ sauce for $9.99. My chopped steak tasted like char in a few places. The 22 oz Porterhouse steaks my husband and son got were small looking. None of the steaks were cooked property. My Mom asked for Med Well and got rare. We had to ask for croutons on the salads. The waitress was apparently new because everytime we asked about something she remarked this was her first night serving. Did bring a new potato for my husband when he forgot to order it with no sour cream. Not impressed over all.

resp.text: Michele, we sincerely apologize that we let you down in preparing your steaks. Please connect with us directly at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ so we can share this with the Trussville team and make things right.

name: Haylee Hopper
text: I did a pick up order today and I had ordered two-dozen rolls. When I got home and opened the boxes they looked horrible. I wish it would let me add the pictures I took! Most of them were brown and hard. I’m sorry, but I’m not wasting my money on this.

resp.text: Haylee, oh no! We're very sorry to hear this happened to you. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again.  Can you connect with us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ when you have a moment? We'd like to get a few more details as we definitely want to address this with the Trussville team and make things right.

name: Pam Rhoton
text: Jessica was a great person considering look like she was the only one working we will be back as lot as she is our server thank b

resp.text: Pam, we’re glad to hear that Jessica could help you feel right at home! We’ll pass along the kudos. See you again soon 👋

name: Teresa Cox
text:
The food was good and the service was good.
However, we sat where we could see the open kitchen and we were watching a female server eating French fries while packaging up to go orders. The open kitchen area was very dirty. We asked for salt and pepper, they brought dirty unsanitized shakers that were definitely greasy snd dirty.

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear about your recent visit, Teresa. Please reach out to us by sending an email at GuestExperience@SPBHospitality.com and we’ll get this addressed immediately.

name: Evan Maltass
text: The manager is attempting to host and doing a poor job of it. Half of the tables in this building including and entire corner are empty, yet he says it's a 45 minute wait. Social distancing can not be the reason because this would be 12 feet apart. The tables that have dishes on them from previous customers are still sitting there and i been here for 30 minutes. So, no hostess, no busboy, slow service, unorganized and very frustrating. Ah and now I see the manager clearing off those tables I mentioned earlier. So he's doubling as a hostess and busboy. Get your restaurant together sir. 1 star.

resp.text: We're so sorry to hear about the service you experienced, Evan. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again. Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: CYNTHIA DAVISON
text: Waitress was nice young girl..helpful..kept checking on us...did not forget about us...

resp.text: CYNTHIA, glad one of our staff did a great job checking in on you. If there’s anything we can do to improve, kindly let us know by mentioning our Trussville Logan’s at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Thanks for stoppin’ by!

name: Orante Frazier
text: This may be the best service my wife and I have every had.

resp.text: Orante, we love hearing our Trussville location took care of you. Thank you for the 5 stars and see you again soon 👋

name: yolanda moore
text: Staff and the manager Tiffany were great  but you can't operate a restaurant with friendliness alone. The food needs to be half way decent  to balance it out. After eating at long horn steak house your expectations are set really high and unfortunately Logans didn't come close nor does saltgrass steak house . I did enjoy my drink at logans can't remember the name   ,it comes out of a frozen like smoothe machine and the rolls were good. My mom enjoyed her food, but she haven't been to long horn yet.

resp.text: yolanda, we’re sorry to hear that the food wasn't served to your liking. If you are willing to chat with a manager, please connect with us here: https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Your honest feedback is always welcome.

name: Brennita Bostic
text: Waited 45 minutes for a table after making reservations to having me n my kids sit a 2 different tables when there was plenty of booths that was not in use... They gave a booth that could easily fit 6 people to a party of 2 food came out cold... 1st and last time going to this location in trussville never again... Worse service ever amd im not the 1 to complain but my experience there was awful

resp.text: Brennita, we're so sorry to hear about the service you experienced. Can you connect with us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ when you have a moment? We'd like to get a few more details as we definitely want to address this with the Trussville team and make things right.

name: Briana Robinson
text: This place is awful. The food is always under-done or over-done and the bar tender didn't even acknowledge my friend and I while we were at the bar until I made a comment about us sitting there while he cleaned the bar top off. We had been sitting for a solid 15 minutes at this point. I do not recommend.

resp.text: Briana, we're very sorry to hear this happened to you. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again. Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: Tracy Estes
text: So my husband and I order from Logan’s (mostly in Mobile Al I 65 and Airport location.) but tonight we ordered from Trussville Al where we were staying. We love the Food and the rolls. But every time no matter WHERE we order my husband always order the chopped steak dinner and whether we order online and put notes or we call in the order and actually talk to someone and order. We always ask for the chopped steak to not have the mashed potatoes and no mushrooms....but apparently these folks that work for this company does not have the ability to do this. So my husband had enough picked up his order and double checked it. There it was mashed potatoes, ask the worker for a couple of napkins and scooped them out of the to go box and off the meat and payed it in the counter. But I doubt they will get it right next time either. . It is just frustrating to like the food and get the worst service. Ugh.

name: John Graham
text: Limited staff due to COVID-19, but service is STILL Satisfactory 👌

resp.text: John, we’re happy to hear that our team took good care of you! If there is anything we can do to improve your next visit, let us know at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Thanks for stoppin' in🍻

name: LSD Cat
text:

The rolls are to die for. I always have to get a dozen to take home with me. The daiquiri is mixed just right for my taste. name: Petit J
text: Incredibly, today around 12:15 pm I experienced the worst dining experience at any Logan's Roadhouse to date.  There were three factors. Baby Back Ribs were not properly cooked......an ongoing problem at all the locations in the Birmingham area.  I have learned to have a picture on my phone showing the proper preparation when I run into this problem.  As I was politely attempting to explain this issue with manager John Prince, Mr. Prince's attitude was hostile, uncooperative and confrontational. When I asked if he knew how they were supposed to be cooked, he replied, why don't you tell me how they are supposed to be cooked.    At this point I knew I needed to document the conversation and started my phone recorder.  Mr. Prince said I am not going to talk with that recorder on.  I asked Mr. Prince's name and he just stared at me.  I then prepared to leave and Mr. Prince said his name and walked off.  My waitress did a splendid job.  The issue with the ribs is they were pre-cooked as usual, but then they were not finished on the grill.  They were warmed up and BBQ sauce smeared on them. It appears that race may have even been an issue.......I am white and Mr. Prince is black. Mr. Prince never acknowledged the ribs were not properly cooked nor did he offer any apologies or consolation for my dining experience. At approximately 5:15 pm, Logan's District Mgr Charlie Eben called me in response to my complaint.  Mr. Eben assured me that employees would be retrained to insure that proper food preparation would result and the John Prince would also be counseled.  Sorry Mr. Eben!  I have heard promises like that too many times.  It is a roll of the dice no matter how many free meal cards you want to send me.  Your sincerity is in doubt.  There are too many good and quality companies out there with whom I will do business.  Just for the record, I am including a photo of your signature Baby Back Ribs when prepared properly.....and this photo was taken at the Trussville location several years ago when they were doing it right!

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave a review. We appreciate your feedback!

name: tiffany brown
text: Myself Husband and 4 children came to eat on December 16 around 6:20pm the hostess stated there would be a 15 minute wait, and we agreed to that. 30 minutes went by along with 3 other parties ranging from 3 to 5 people. I asked The hostess how much longer and she said her manager was waiting for a party to finish before she sat us. Another 10 minutes went by and I began to get upset because our placement should not be based on when another family finishes eating. We were about to get up and leave but a server came and got us, told us he was working a big party but he would be more than glad to serve us. Keep in mind the hostess never came by to address us again, nor did any manager. We would probably still be sitting there now if the server who was around the bar area did not offer to wait on us. Now granted I am not an unreasonable person nor am I impatient but the lack of professionalism displayed by the management team was unacceptable. We arrived around 6:20 we were not eating to well over 8:00 pm. I didn't want any discount or free food just the common courtesy to say I'm sorry for your wait and we will get you and your family served as soon as possible, but I guess that was too much to ask for. It will be very unlikely for me to ever Dine at this establishment again.

resp.text: Tiffany, this is not alright with us! We're so sorry that there was a bit of a delay in the food preparation during your last visit.  Can you connect with us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ when you have a moment? Trussville even continuously checked to make sure our food was good and our drinks were full, Fultondale made Houdini jealous when it came to everything except their expectations of a tip...  I also like the idea of prepackaged peanuts in times of viral concerns.  Fultondale needs to absolutely learn a thing or two, well everything from the Trussville store!!!

name: andres hightower
text: Worst dining experience ever and I didn’t even get to eat. I arrived at 9:47 which I know is late however, NOBODY greeted me not the bartender whom was in my view not the waitress at the bar booths there was even a busses whom was walking back and fourth out the door. I started yelling “hello? Can I get some help is there any one here?” Nobody flinched. I sat on top of one of the peanut barrels and waited. Finally the waitress at the bar booths approached me and my friend and asked have we been helped I told her no and we had been waiting for a while and I even had started yelling to get someone’s attention and they never came she then proceeded to take her phone out and look at the time then said “well....what y’all want? I mean I can go get my manager..” so she went to get the manger while I waited on her the busser from before approached us and asked “were you ladies trying to get a table?” I told him the same thing I told the waitress he said “well...that’s because we’re closed” I said no you’re not he laughed and said “oh what is it? 9:59?” I said I didn’t get here at 9:59 though he then told me he didn’t even care because he was off the clock (still in uniform) and walked away...to buss a table. The manager finally approached me and I told her what had been happening and I that I watched her in the kitchen about to walk out look at me and turn around, I informed her that I had managed restaurants including fine dining and this was not how business works she told me she was in the back rolling silverware (even though I saw her) and said she could give me a coupon. I declined and let her know the staff was extremely rude. If I could give this location -5 stars I absolutely would. Horrible.

resp.text: Andres, thank you so much for bringing your experience to our attention. Please know we take your feedback about our staff's hospitality very seriously and will be following up with the Trussville location. Rest assured that we'll pass your message along to our team.

Then I get home and didn't have my salads. Go back to pick up salads, no one apologized. All this happens between the time my husband call and now. I just eating, this was my favorite place, my husband proposed to me here, but this not the first time I was not happy here lately. But it is the last,I hope you get it back to where it was. Be Blessed.

You see toke 30 minutes to get food( he had chopped steak) I had ordered Salmon. My potato was cold, well all was cold! Had to send all back! This toke another 30 minutes!!!! My husband ate while I watched him, then he watched me eat!!! Nothing was discounted, nothing was said!!!! Terrible, TERRIBLE, HORRIBLE!!!!

text: When I first walked in the houses seem so confused and out of it she didn't know where to seat me then when she did seat me in an area The Way Church came over and said that this I was closed and he wondered why she seated me there early upon ordering he never offered me water he just went on to bring my salad out with no rose included no napkins are nothing you never came back to see if I was okay I had to ask for napkins but my food came it was about about another very nice waiter and he never came to check on me upon leaving being that it was my birthday I had a coupon for a free dessert he prepared to go and put it in a to-go box and never brought back a paper bag or anything to put it in and just left it on the table and told me have a good day someone behind me said they had the same winner and they were ordering he told them he only had two hands I reported it to the manager who was very nice but as far as going back to that Logan's in Trussville I will never go back it was the food was not good the surface was not good and I would recommend someone else to go somewhere else I could have prepared my own meal at home and been satisfied so they get a zero

name: Landon Warrior
text:
The good:  Let me say the "Bacon on a Stick" appetizer was one of the best things I've ever eaten.  It was amazing.  You should stop by just for this appetizer.  I'm not kidding!

The awkward:
Me and my friend from work ate here on July 19, 2018.  Place was slow and the hostess told us that they didn't have a server to help us.  Which was bizarre however a nice young lady named Shelby stepped up and offered to take care of us which she did and I proceeded to give her the maximum tip I could on my company credit card.

The bad:
Friend's steak wasn't cooked correctly.  Kitchen refired it and made it correct.  The other food really didn't stack up to how awesome the appetizer was.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to review your experience, Landon. If you'd like us to follow up with your concerns, please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS. Thank you.

name: Carla White
text:
Ordered my steak med well, got well done, tough, full of fat and veins/something chewy!
Manager came to the table, said he would cook another one. The second steak arrived, cut it open and blood oozed out. Manager said he could put it back on the grill for a few minutes. My party had already finished eating so I declined. I should have asked for my money back but I took it home, thinking I could make it edible. This steak was also full of fat and  veins also. I threw it in the trash. I will never go there again

resp.text: We're sorry to hear we fell short of a great dining experience, Carla. Please know that we take your feedback seriously and we will be checking in with the store. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

We gave her another tip that she didn't want to take but we got her to take it because she deserved it. Also our son is very shy and when we was getting ready to leave he gave her a hug which he doesn't do to people he doesn't know. I highly recommend this Logan's and Stacy as ur waitress

Last visit I when I came in no one was at the front and I waited 10 minutes. I finally had to call using my cell phone to get the girl up there. Also several employees saw me waiting and no one apparently cared enough to let the girl know I was there I guess. Noticed 4 manager cards on the front desk and wondered why the service is so bad. This could be a great place but you have to get a better staff. And some managers that care

Guess all Logan’s are bad because gadsden is the Same way. Guess when management doesn’t care then staff won’t either. Wish I would have read the other reviews before I wasted my money.

name: Angela Whitaker
text: My son and I were the second set of customers to walk in the restaurant today, Sunday, as soon as they opened. We were thinking that one of the first orders of the day when it wasn't busy would surely be one of the BEST orders, not completely true. Although my food was ok, my son's wings were fried really hard. He tried to eat them because he doesn't like to complain but I advised him that you should be satisfied with what you pay for. We sent the wings back and told the server that we would pay for the three wings he ate and ordered something else. The manager came out, not to apologize, but to tell us that we didn't need to pay for the three wings. Oh ok, thanks. Guess that was his solution to the problem but then we receive the replacement meal. The replacement meal that we paid full price for and paid extra to get an upgraded side of macaroni and cheese that came in a container that was less than half full. So what do we do? Pay the bill, tip the server her 20%, take the food and leave to not return any time soon until someone in management encourages the kitchen staff to always work hard at sending out quality food. So when you visit, let me know if it has happened. Happy Sunday!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Angela. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

She was trying to wait about a dozen tables and couldn't remember what food went where.  I could go on on about all the people walking out, but trust me , was a mess. We felt sorry for the poor older lady trying to wait all those tables and still left her a 25% tip, because it wasn't her fault. Poor management.

text: The food was great, our waiter was great, but the hostess unbelievably rude. I asked the hostess to sweep some of the peanuts from underneath, she told me that’s how it was suppose to be and I asked her again and she only half-a__ed swept one side underneath the booth. I literally had to ask for a broom. Again I understand peanuts are supposed to be on the floor but who wants to sit at a booth where you consistently have to keep removing the bulky and sometimes a little sharp peanut shells from the bottom of your feet as you eat.

text: In the beginning we waited for 20 min before someone even came to ask if we needed a table and there was seats open all over the place. I then found out our waitress made my Margarita instead of a licensed bartender, which is why it was way too heavy on the tequila. The waitress also started talking to us about very inappropriate things such as birth control and giving us advice about kids in the future and how we should have never started using money as currency in america. When we found out the check was wrong we told the waitress and she came back and she started complaining about her boss to us, her customers. We stayed there for 2 and a half hours and received very mediocre food. The manager was nice and knew what she was doing, but the staff was very lazy and slow.

text:
Decided to try Logans again after the last time that was a complete disaster.

It was better this time but it was still poor. We had to wait over an hour to get seated. Which can be understandable but it wasn't because they were busy. It was because they didn't have enough wait staff there.  Over half of the restaurant was empty. Then they seated four 2 tops before me and my wife and 1 child. Even though we were next in line according to the hostess. I can understand seating 2 tops over 3 because they are busy and that's what's available but they had half of the restaurant empty. There was no reason to adhere to section integrity when tables are open. Then they were out of the steak I ordered and when the steak I chose  was served it was cold.

In the end the food wasn't bad but wasn't worth what I paid or the 2 plus hours we spent there. I have finally learned my lesson and will never ever give them another chance.

We never heard from a manager to explain what was going on. Just a young sweet girl and an overwhelmed waitress.

I've said it before but now it's definitely true. I will never ever eat at any Logan's again anywhere in the country. Pathetic at best. Do not waste your time or money.

name: Amber Burgett
text:
Do not waste your time. Hands down the WORST dining experience I've ever had in my 30 years. The wait wasn't too terribly bad, but after we were seated was terrible.

My roommate, her son, her girlfriend, and I were sat and promptly greeted by our server. We each ordered drinks, and then our food. The salads were pretty good, but then things took a U-turn.

Our food was first brought out to the table next to us. When we brought this to the attention of the server who brought it, he said "Let me go check the ticket." I know from some knowledge shared with me that when that happens, a fresh order is to be made because it touched the table. So the same man finally brings us our food, with the exception of my roommate, which I happen to know is another mistake, as we should have all been served together. I should also note these plates were the same ones as before, which I happen to know because I had a clear line of sight to the kitchen from where we were sitting. This is a health violation.

So after bringing our steaks out, I notice mine is undercooked (I ordered medium and got medium rare). My roommate's girlfriend's steak has been cut into, which is ANOTHER huge no-no. When this was brought to the attention of the man who brought them out (the same man I mentioned before), he claimed that was how it was cooked and acted as if he didn't care when we stuck a knife straight through the pre-existing hole in the middle of the steak.

After the guy walks off, my roommate's girlfriend goes to our server and asks to speak with a manager. Our server points directly at THE GUY WHO HAD BROUGHT US OUR FOOD. You remember him- the rude one. So she asks if there is another manager around. Keep in mind that my roommate still hasn't seen the first morsel of her food. She informs her that the other manager's name is Jennifer and she will be right over. Jennifer was great and went above and beyond to try and turn our visit around. She quickly explains she will check on my roommate's food and bring fresh steaks out to replace the ones we had.

My roommate finally gets her food, and there is cinnamon all over her baked sweet potato- which she specifically ordered without cinnamon. But there is also cinnamon all over her steak- why would the steak have cinnamon on it in the first place? So they bring out a fresh potato, which tastes like it's been sitting out for about 2-3 days before it was brought out to the table.

My roommate's girlfriend and I finally get our fresh steaks, and mine is RARE when I cut into it- worse than before.

We left not having to pay for any of our food, including what my roommate's son ate because his was fine- but I still won't be back. HORRIBLE experience.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your disappointing experience. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with you. Thanks.  Thank you, Timothy. Someone will be in touch.

name: Anissa Ledbetter
text: Took forever to get drinks. Food was ok. One from our party had a hair in there food. One had a loaded baked potato that wasn't loaded! Waitress was okay

name: Jenna Leigh
text: I went with my family last Saturday for a birthday celebration, and the service we got was inexcusably terrible. Let me say I've been to this Logan's many times since it opened, in fact it use to be one of my favorite restaurants in Trussville, but that has definitely changed. We got there a little after 2 PM and had to wait for a table until almost 3 PM. Now, I understand it was a Saturday, so even though it was annoying I was willing to look past it. Once we sat down, we sat there for 45 MINUTES without anyone even acknowledging that we were there. My uncle had to get up and go find someone to even get them to come take our drink order. After finally placing our drink order, it took another 45 minutes to get our drinks...and most of us ordered WATER. Our waitress had a terrible attitude,  we didn't even get our food until almost 5 PM, and once we did get it, it was not good. 3 1/2 hours for what should have been a simple lunch, when most of it was due to sitting around waiting on someone to even acknowledge that we were there is ridiculous. If it hadn't been for my grandmother refusing to leave, we would have left. And then, when my uncle asked about getting a discount, because there was no way we were paying full price for the terrible service, the manager had the nerve to ask "Why do you need a discount?" Even the management didn't seem to care. Needless to say, I will never be back.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear we fell short of a great time. We'd like to follow up with you, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

The manager (who I will say was extremely busy and did do all she can to handle the situation) then told us "Taylor" will be our server and she should be by any second. Thanks Taylor for never showing up. Probably for the best, we waited another 15 minutes and then decided it was time to leave. We will not be returning to this restaurant or any Logans anytime soon. name: K Russell
text:
It really saddens me to have to change my review of this place. However, after this pass weekend, they left me no choice. My fiance' and I go to Logan's faithfully, so needless to say, we have spent too much money in this place to be treated the way we were. The service and food quality has really gone down hill. Quite frankly, I can see why they're having to close so many locations now because the competition is better. Granted, all of the other Logan's in this city ARE indeed horrible, but this one was still the best in my book. That is no longer that case!

First of all, we ordered a basket of fried pickles, and we received a half of half basket of fried pickles. I would rather they just told us they were out rather than bring us what they did. We ate those because we were hungry, it was getting late, and we expected a much better dinner than appetizer. It got no better! We waited over 30 minutes for food, and when we got it, most of it was cold as hell. I guess our waitress forgot about it and left it on the counter. My fiance' had meatloaf that was not thoroughly cooked in certain areas, he never got the fries he ordered, so he practically left everything on his plate, he never touched the mashed potatoes and gravy. Our waitress took up our concerns with the manager about our 30-minute wait and the missing items, and as a courtesy she removed 3 whole dollars from our ticket. That was the cost of a side! Gee thanks! You took off what exactly? Our taxes off one of our sides! Then she goes on to explain that they had a party of 35 people come in that they had no idea was coming. That's great, but what the hell does that have to do with us? That's not our problem!! If your business can't serve large parties while maintaining the quality and integrity of your food to all other visitors then you SHOULDN'T be in business... PERIOD!

Basically, we paid full price for horrible food and horrible service. It's sad because we WERE faithful customers, and Logan's just lost us. On top of that, we were not the only people complaining about them when we left. They had people in the waiting area and parking lot who were also not very happy with them.

resp.text: We appreciate your positive feedback! Thanks for reviewing us!

text: Horrible experience. We walked in and the hostess had a look on her face as though she didn’t want to be there and when asked how long it’s like it kills her to give an estimate. She is like that every time we go. So she tells us 15-20 minutes for 2 people when the place is not even close to half full. So we wait instead of leaving....that was wrong on our end. We get sat and the manager comes by to get our drink order gives us rolls and at the time we think everything is good. Some odd time later a woman comes by saying she will be our server as Danny is the manager and she will take our order. We both ordered the 6 oz filet med rare and sides. At least 40 minutes later our meals come out not medium rare and the look and cut of the steak is that of a sirloin. Now we have ate at this location plenty of times and have ordered filets from Logan’s plenty of times. When the server came back we were just ready to go and had wasted a good portion of our day now having to go find lunch elsewhere. I offered to pay for our drinks and my boyfriends salad but the server said not to worry about it. We won’t be returning to this location! Thanks for ruining our Sunday lunch!

name: ira lucas
text: Totally disappointed in my visit, Sunday December 16, 2018. I have eaten here several times and the service has been average, but yesterday was awful. The hostess said it was a 30minute wait to get a table and their were people ahead of me waiting. However she said that if I would sit at the bar that there would be no wait and I would get immediate service. What a misstatement. As I proceeded to the bar, I couldn't help but notice 6 tables empty and wondered why no one had been seated there. Anyway, I sat at the bar and spoke to the gentleman who was seated to the right of me. He said that it had taken 20 minutes for them to take his to go order and that he had been waiting an additional 40 minutes for his prime rib order to come. After about 20 minutes of waiting myself, the bartender/waiter finally brought me a menu. I told him I wasn't expecting to wait an hour for my  food like the gentleman next to me. He said food was coming out in about 30minutes which obviously wasn't happening. Finally the waiter came to take the order of the gentleman on my left side who was with a young boy. He had been waiting over 30 minutes for his order to be taken. He explained to the waiter that he had ordered prime rib on his last visit and was disappointed because there was more fat than meat on his portion.  The waiter told him that the prime rib is usually very fatty and that gives flavor to the meat. I thought to myself that I have eaten prime rib at many places that had little fat and was very meaty, juicy and tender. The bartender/Waiter then suggested that the gentleman order the new York strip. At that moment I changed my mind about ordering the  16 ounce prime rib and decided that I would order the 22 ounce porterhouse,if I could ever get my order taken. By then the poor guy on my right was getting antsy because he had been there over an hour and said that if he had not already paid for his to go order that he would leave. Finally someone else came and asked him what he had ordered since he had been sitting there forever. That  person went to the kitchen and the bartender finally came out about 5 minutes later with the man's order. I thought to myself I hope he has his order right in his bag after that awfully long wait. So now I've been waiting over 35 minutes and still have not had my order taken. So now the bartender waiter guy goes to take someone else's order, bless their soul who was there before me. At that point, I could not take anymore,so I politely got up and told the people around me to have a nice evening and left. I would think that a major franchise as Logan's Roadhouse would provide extra help on busy days like Sunday. I left went to the grocery store and bought a large tbone steak and took it home and cooked it. Oh, also one lady ordered only potato skins to go and said she has been there over 30 minutes. I give yesterday at Logan's a negative -10.

resp.text: Hi, Ira. We're sorry to hear that your experience wasn't the best, and we will be looking into this for you. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

text: Totally disappointed in my visit, Sunday December 16, 2018. I have eaten here several times and the service has been average, but yesterday was awful. The hostess said it was a 30minute wait to get a table and their were people ahead of me waiting. However she said that if I would sit at the bar that there would be no wait and I would get immediate service. What a misstatement. As I proceeded to the bar, I couldn't help but notice 6 tables empty and wondered why no one had been seated there. Anyway, I sat at the bar and spoke to the gentleman who was seated to the right of me. He said that it had taken 20 minutes for them to take his to go order and that he had been waiting an additional 40 minutes for his prime rib order to come. After about 20 minutes of waiting myself, the bartender/waiter finally brought me a menu. I told him I wasn't expecting to wait an hour for my  food like the gentleman next to me. He said food was coming out in about 30minutes which obviously wasn't happening. Finally the waiter came to take the order of the gentleman on my left side who was with a young boy. He had been waiting over 30 minutes for his order to be taken. He explained to the waiter that he had ordered prime rib on his last visit and was disappointed because there was more fat than meat on his portion.  The waiter told him that the prime rib is usually very fatty and that gives flavor to the meat. I thought to myself that I have eaten prime rib at many places that had little fat and was very meaty, juicy and tender. The bartender/Waiter then suggested that the gentleman order the new York strip. At that moment I changed my mind about ordering the  16 ounce prime rib and decided that I would order the 22 ounce porterhouse,if I could ever get my order taken. So now the bartender waiter guy goes to take someone else's order, bless their soul who was there before me. At that point, I could not take anymore,so I politely got up and told the people around me to have a nice evening and left. I would think that a major franchise as Logan's Roadhouse would provide extra help on busy days like Sunday. text:
THE FOOD
The food was ok nothing to brag about. We ordered the filet med/rare it was more rare than med/rare but I was ok with that mine had hardly any flavor at all to it. Our potatoes was not quiet done and my salad was ordered with 1000 island dressing which I usually love at Logan's but the dressing here looked like 1000 island but tasted like French.

THE SERVICE
Our waitress was nice and friendly enough. A little hard to catch her attention when I was not real sure if ahe had brought me unsweat tea instead of sweet tea but once we finally got het attention she did everything she could to make it better. So no complaints there.
APPEARANCE
Clean the restrooms needed some attention but once it was relayed to the staff they were made aware of the fact that they needed attention and so I assume that was taken care of.

OVER ALL EXPERIENCE
It wasnt so bad that I wouldn't go back but will make sure to be more specific in my ordering as well as asking questions to make sure my idea of sweet tea and theirs is the same.

name: E W
text: So, every Wednesday Logans has a special so I bring my 2 kids and we enjoy a meal. The last 2 times we have come it has not been a good experience. Either the food is subpar or the service or both. Tonight we waited over 10 minutes to even be greeted. We had to get up and say something to the hostess for someone to come to the table. Well, then we waited another 5-10 minutes for drinks and rolls. I know it took our door an hr to come out. We were about to walk out. This was not a good experience at all. I ordered a filet, grilled shrimp, broccoli and rice pilaf. The shrimp was cold and the steak was not cooked as I ordered. The brocolli arrived later after I told the waiter jt was missing. My kids did not have their condiments with the food. My daughter didn't even eat hers because she said it was nasty. I will not be returning after this experience.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear we fell short of a great dining experience. Please know that we take your feedback seriously and we will be checking in with the store. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text:
I have never had luck with big parties at this location. But small groups usually get good service. They still serve peanuts but they don't allow you to put them on the floor anymore.

Ok, so last night Dec 10th 2016 our company went after a 14 hr day to go have a meal. We asked to seat 9 people and sat at the bar to wait for the table. We ordered drinks and kept reminding the staff at the door we were still waiting. After an hr.......yes an hr (not busy and we were told it would be 20min) we finally gave up. The manager acted as if she did not care and the staff made annoying faces when they half tried to clean a table for us. Once again we tried to give them local business, but they failed. 20 min after we left we had a great meal at Olive Garden where the server got a bigger tip from our one ticket that all his other tables all night. A logans server missed out on our ticket.

resp.text: Thank you for the review James, we appreciate your feedback! We would like to know more about your experience. name: Patrick Haggerty
text:
This was one of the worst experiences ever. Yesterday June 11th my family and I went there for my daughter's birthday dinner. We got seated right away. But then it took 10 minutes before the waitress came to take our drink orders. This was shocking since the restaurant was fairly empty. Also The waitress tried to bring my daughter Coca-Cola  twice when she had sweet tea that was empty . But that is not a big deal. Upon receiving our steaks That's when we were told that what my youngest daughter ordered they did not have. They asked her to re-order while the rest of us had our food in front of us.
I am not the type of parent that will eat in front of my child that has nothing. At that point I asked to speak to the manager. I watched as the waitress went over to the manager and told her I would like to see her. But she did not come right over. It took at least five minutes before she came to see what was going on. I explained what had happened and she did not even apologize. I asked her what we can do at this point. She said she would take our food back and make sure that we all got them served at the same time. It just did not sit right with me that she did not apologize and I had to ask what we can do to fix the situation. At that point I asked her for a check because we were leaving. It was then she just pointed towards the door. Again not apologizing or saying you don't owe anything. Just pointing towards the door. So we walked out and left the food on the table To say I am disappointed is an understatement. I especially felt bad for my daughter who just wanted to eat there on her birthday. Judging by the other reviews and my experience. This location has a serious problem from the management down.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your poor experience. We would like to follow up with you regarding your feedback, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

text: Worst experience ever tonight. Food was aweful and the service was even worse. My salad came out with my dinner, my son had to ask 3 times to get water and more bread. My order was wrong and my to go order for my husband came out to me plated. His side salad never came with his order. I waited 20 min for a box to take our nasty food home to give to our dog. When I asked the waitress if she could get my to go side salad as fast as she could (seeing that I already paid for it and I over paid on my bill) there was literally about 3-4 bites of lettuce. My son had practice at 6:00 and it was close to 5:50. Mind you we we got there at 4:45 and ordered right away with our drink order. We were done eating before 5:30. This is a real shame since my son is obsessed with your dinner rolls and we frequently dine there. I will never go back again. I paid for things I didn't get. I don't know if the cook was new but my steak had so much seasoning on it it was barely edible. I scraped as much off as possible. If our waitress would have been more attentive I would have said something. We spent too much of our time seated with no one taking care of us. Even when I said I have to go please give me my receipt to sign, she dropped it off with no pen. Leaving me to have to chase down another waitress to borrow her pen. As horrible as it was our waitress was kind when at our table (twice). We will eat at Logan's again but never again at the Trussville location.
